content_it:
Il Segretariato per l’Urbanistica e le Costruzioni di Belgrado ha avviato la consultazione pubblica preliminare per il piano territoriale relativo all’area a destinazione speciale del futuro complesso tecnologico per la produzione di cemento e prodotti cementizi “Ratari-Jazovnik”, progettato da Lafarge Serbia con sede a Beočin. Il piano riguarda le particelle catastali dei comuni di Ratari (Obrenovac), Jazovnik (Vladimirci) e Svileuva (Koceljeva), per un’estensione complessiva di 32.740 ettari. L’impianto di produzione sorgerà a Ratari su 18,80 ettari, mentre la cava per la materia prima occuperà 305,80 ettari tra Jazovnik e Svileuva, di cui 276,2 ettari destinati all’estrazione.  

Il settore cementiero serbo non riesce attualmente a soddisfare la domanda interna, con un deficit stimato in 700.000 tonnellate annue e importazioni per quasi 100 milioni di euro l’anno. L’investimento mira a coprire il fabbisogno nazionale fino al 2040, includendo anche un impianto per il trattamento di ceneri volanti della centrale termoelettrica Nikola Tesla B. La cava di Jazovnik, acquisita da Lafarge Serbia, ha una capacità annua di 900.000 tonnellate di calcare, utilizzato sia per la produzione di cemento che per la desulfurazione nei termovalorizzatori.  

L’intero processo prevede il trasporto su strada di 220.000 tonnellate annue di aggregati dalla cava e 400.000 tonnellate di ceneri volanti dalla centrale di Obrenovac. L’utilizzo delle ceneri volanti ridurrà significativamente il loro smaltimento in discarica, con benefici ambientali rilevanti. L’investimento permetterà inoltre la produzione di circa venti tipi di prodotti cementizi innovativi, non ancora disponibili sul mercato serbo, con minori emissioni di CO₂ e maggiore uso di materie prime non metalliche.  

L’obiettivo generale è un uso sostenibile delle risorse minerarie e il consolidamento della Serbia come leader regionale nel settore estrattivo, attraverso tecnologie moderne e un approvvigionamento sicuro per le industrie strategiche. Il piano è redatto dal Centro per la Pianificazione dello Sviluppo Urbano su incarico dell’Agenzia per la Pianificazione Territoriale e Urbanistica della Serbia. La consultazione pubblica è aperta dal 3 al 17 novembre, come riportato da ekapija.com.  

Questo progetto potrebbe offrire opportunità alle imprese italiane specializzate in tecnologie per l’industria del cemento, impianti di trattamento di sottoprodotti industriali e soluzioni per la riduzione delle emissioni.

title_en: Tender for construction of wastewater treatment plant in Cacak worth EUR 47 million announced
title_it: Appalto da 47 mln per depuratore a Čačak
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Kekyalyaynen/shutterstock.com) The Ministry of Finance, i.e. the Sector for Contracting and Financing of EU Funds (CFCU), has announced a tender for the construction of a wastewater collection and treatment system in the city of Cacak, within the framework of the Instrument for Pre-Accession Assistance (IPA III). The aim of the project is to improve wastewater management and compliance with the European Directive on Urban Wastewater Treatment. The scope of the works includes four units: design and construction of the Prelici wastewater treatment plant with an access road, design and reconstruction of the Ljubic Polje, Beljina and Kosutnjak pumping stations, with the construction of an access road to Ljubic Polje, CCTV inspection, design and rehabilitation of the sewage network, as well as the procurement of equipment for cleaning and inspection of sewage. The contractor will be responsible for the complete implementation of the works - from design and procurement of equipment to commissioning and testing of the system. The project will be financed from European Union funds, and the procurement will be carried out by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Serbia. The contract will last 1,099 days from the date of signing, while the deadline for submitting bids is February 19, 2026. For more information about the tender, see HERE . As stated earlier this year by the Mayor of Cacak, Milun Todorovic, the wastewater treatment plant will be located in Atenica, more precisely in Kulinovci, at the confluence of the Atenica River and the Morava River. According to earlier announcements, the investment was initially estimated at EUR 32 million, but due to price increases, it was increased to EUR 47 million. Todorovic also told local media in July that the relevant ministry was expected to issue a public call for tenders for the selection of contractors, which could be completed within two years. I. Z. content_it:
Il Ministero delle Finanze della Repubblica di Serbia, tramite il Settore per gli Appalti e il Finanziamento dei Fondi UE (CFCU), ha indetto una gara per la costruzione di un sistema di raccolta e trattamento delle acque reflue nella città di Čačak, nell’ambito dello Strumento di Assistenza di Pre-adesione (IPA III). L’obiettivo è migliorare la gestione delle acque reflue e garantire il rispetto della Direttiva europea sul trattamento delle acque urbane reflue.  

I lavori comprendono quattro lotti: progettazione e costruzione del depuratore di Preliči con strada di accesso; progettazione e ricostruzione delle stazioni di pompaggio di Ljubić Polje, Beljina e Košutnjak, inclusa una strada di accesso a Ljubić Polje; ispezione con telecamere e riabilitazione della rete fognaria; fornitura di attrezzature per la pulizia e l’ispezione delle fognature. L’impresa aggiudicataria sarà responsabile dell’intera esecuzione, dalla progettazione alla messa in esercizio del sistema.  

Il progetto sarà finanziato con fondi dell’Unione Europea. La durata del contratto è di 1.099 giorni dalla firma, e la scadenza per la presentazione delle offerte è fissata al 19 febbraio 2026. Inizialmente stimato in 32 milioni di euro, l’investimento è stato rivisto a 47 milioni a causa dell’aumento dei costi. Come riportato da ekapija.com, il sindaco di Čačak, Milun Todorović, ha confermato che l’impianto sorgerà ad Atenica, località Kulinovci, alla confluenza del fiume Atenica con la Morava, con conclusione prevista entro due anni dall’avvio dei lavori.  

L’appalto rappresenta un’opportunità per imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture idriche e tecnologie per il trattamento delle acque reflue.

title_en: EC decision on steel quotas and tariffs to affect Smederevo steel mill
title_it: Acciaio: nuove quote UE colpiscono Smederevo
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Baloncici) The European Commission has proposed a new reduction in quotas, but also an increase in tariffs on steel imports from non-EU countries, which, if the proposal is accepted by all 27 EU member states, will also hit Serbia, primarily its steel mill in Smederevo, which has been owned by the Chinese company Hesteel since 2016. This will be an additional blow to the steel mill, which is already suffering losses as a result of the introduction of quotas in 2019, which is why it shut down one blast furnace. This reduced production from more than two million to around 1.2 million tons per year, but no workers were laid off. In the last five years, the steel mill only had a profit in 2021. The largest loss in the last five years was recorded last year - 17.5 billion dinars, while in 2023 it amounted to 16.5 billion dinars. Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic announced the news about the EU tariffs on October 9. – These are the European Union tariffs on steel, which obviously affect the United Kingdom, Turkey and Serbia the most, but they have also hit all European countries, that is, all European producers, extremely hard. This will put our steel mill in an extremely difficult position. As you know, 5,000 people work there, and as many as 20,000 people are connected to the steel mill. This is a huge problem for us and for our Chinese partners – he said. The new proposal of the European Commission, in order to protect the steel industry in the EU, is to reduce the quotas for steel imports from 820,000 to 410,000 tons from July 1, 2026, and in case the quotas are exceeded, the tariffs will be increased from 25% to 50%. Hesteel bought the Serbian steel mill in order to make it easier for China to connect to the European steel market, and since then more than 80% of its production has been intended for export to EU countries. Now the question is whether it is possible to find a replacement for that market. World steel production has exceeded two billion tons, with China alone producing more than half of that amount, while all EU members together produce around 130 million tons annually. content_it:
La Commissione Europea ha proposto una riduzione delle quote e un aumento dei dazi sull’importazione di acciaio dai paesi extra-UE. Se approvata da tutti e 27 gli Stati membri, la misura colpirà direttamente la Serbia, in particolare l’acciaieria di Smederevo, di proprietà del gruppo cinese Hesteel dal 2016. L’impianto, già in difficoltà dal 2019 a causa dell’introduzione delle quote – che ha portato alla chiusura di un altoforno e a una riduzione della produzione da oltre 2 milioni a circa 1,2 milioni di tonnellate annue – ha registrato utili soltanto nel 2021 negli ultimi cinque anni. Le perdite più elevate si sono verificate nel 2023 (16,5 miliardi di dinari) e nel 2024 (17,5 miliardi di dinari).  

Il presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić ha annunciato il 9 ottobre che i nuovi dazi avranno un impatto significativo su Serbia, Turchia e Regno Unito, ma anche su tutti i produttori europei. “Questo metterà l’acciaieria in una posizione estremamente difficile. Vi lavorano 5.000 persone e altre 20.000 dipendono da essa”, ha dichiarato.  

La proposta della Commissione prevede di ridurre le quote da 820.000 a 410.000 tonnellate a partire dal 1° luglio 2026 e di aumentare i dazi dal 25% al 50% in caso di superamento. L’acciaieria di Smederevo esporta oltre l’80% della sua produzione nei paesi UE, e ora dovrà valutare la possibilità di trovare nuovi mercati alternativi.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la produzione globale di acciaio supera i due miliardi di tonnellate, di cui oltre la metà prodotta dalla sola Cina, mentre l’intera UE ne produce circa 130 milioni all’anno. La situazione potrebbe aprire opportunità per nuove collaborazioni industriali o per fornitori italiani di tecnologie e servizi per il settore siderurgico.

title_en: Ministry: Refinery in Pancevo to operate until November 25, care will be taken to ensure even supply of gas stations
title_it: Raffineria di Pancevo operativa fino al 25 novembre
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Nenad Cavoski) Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) has confirmed that the oil refinery in Pancevo, with its oil stocks, will continue to operate until November 25, the Ministry of Mining and Energy announced after a meeting of the standing task force of the Organization for the National Strategy for Crisis Situations in the Oil Sector. Among other things, it was said at the meeting that care would be taken to coordinate even supply of all gas stations, which is especially important for small gas stations, the statement said. The main topics of the meeting, in addition to the continuation of the operations of the refinery in Pancevo, were transport logistics and the dynamics of imports of petroleum products from neighboring countries. Acting Assistant Minister of Mining and Energy for the Oil and Gas Sector Sasa Kokovic said that the relevant ministry, together with other state institutions, had been particularly engaged in supporting and coordinating logistics in order to make maximum use of all capacities for the transport of imported petroleum products. The meeting was also attended by representatives of the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Domestic and Foreign Trade, the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Republic Directorate for Commodity Reserves, the Energy Reserves Administration, the Customs Administration, the Tax Administration, Transnafta, NIS, the Association of Oil Companies of Serbia and member companies of the association. content_it: Il Ministero dell’Energia e delle Miniere ha annunciato, al termine di una riunione del gruppo operativo per la Strategia Nazionale in caso di crisi nel settore petrolifero, che la raffineria di Pancevo di Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) continuerà a operare fino al 25 novembre grazie alle scorte di greggio disponibili. Durante l’incontro è stato sottolineato che verrà garantita una fornitura uniforme a tutte le stazioni di servizio, con particolare attenzione a quelle di piccole dimensioni. Tra i temi principali discussi figurano anche la logistica del trasporto e il ritmo delle importazioni di prodotti petroliferi dai Paesi vicini. Il viceministro delegato per il settore Oil & Gas, Saša Koković, ha precisato che il ministero, in collaborazione con altre istituzioni statali, sta coordinando attivamente la logistica per ottimizzare tutte le capacità di trasporto dei prodotti importati. Alla riunione hanno partecipato rappresentanti di diversi ministeri serbi, enti statali, aziende del settore energetico e l’Associazione delle Società Petroliere della Serbia, come riportato da ekapija.com. La conferma della continuità operativa della raffineria serba rappresenta un’opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nel comparto energetico e nella logistica di valutare collaborazioni nel contesto dei flussi energetici regionali.

title_en: Kaspersky: Security flaws threatening car safety
title_it: Falle di sicurezza minacciano auto connesse
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Zapp2Photo) At the Security Analyst Summit 2025 , Kaspersky presented the results of a security audit that discovered a serious security flaw that allows unauthorized access to all connected vehicles of an automaker. By exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in a publicly available application of a subcontractor, it was possible to take control of the vehicle’s telematics system, thereby jeopardizing the physical safety of the driver and passengers. For example, attackers could force gear changes or turn off the engine while the vehicle is in motion. The findings highlight potential weaknesses in the automotive industry’s cybersecurity and are a call for the introduction of stricter security measures. Automaker’s side The security audit was conducted remotely and focused on the manufacturer’s publicly available services and subcontractor infrastructure. Kaspersky identified several exposed web services. First, by exploiting a zero-day SQL injection vulnerability in a wiki application (a web platform that allows users to collaboratively create, edit, and manage content), the researchers were able to extract a list of users on the subcontractor side with hashed passwords, some of which were affected due to weak password policies. This intrusion provided access to the issue tracking system - a software tool used to manage and track tasks, bugs, or problems within a project. This system contained sensitive configuration data about the manufacturer’s telematics infrastructure, including a file with hashed passwords of users of one of the vehicle telematics servers. In a modern car, telematics allows the collection, transmission, analysis, and use of various data (e.g., speed, geolocation, etc.) from connected vehicles. Connected vehicle side (Photo: Unsplash/Remy Lovesy) On the connected vehicle side, Kaspersky discovered a misconfigured firewall that exposed internal servers. Using the previously obtained password for the service account, the researchers accessed the server’s file system and discovered the credentials of another subcontractor, which gave them complete control over the telematics infrastructure. Most alarmingly, the researchers discovered a firmware update command that allowed them to upload modified firmware to the Telematics Control Unit (TCU). This gave them access to the CAN ( Controller Area Network ) bus - a system that connects various parts of the vehicle, such as the engine and sensors. Subsequently, various other systems were also accessed, including the engine, transmission, etc. This allowed for the potential manipulation of a whole range of critical vehicle functions, which could jeopardize the safety of the driver and passengers. – The security flaws stem from issues that are quite common in the automotive industry: publicly available web services, weak passwords, lack of multi-factor authentication (2FA), and unencrypted storage of sensitive data. This incident shows how one weak link in the subcontractor’s infrastructure can lead to the complete compromise of all connected vehicles. The automotive industry must prioritize strong cybersecurity practices, especially when it comes to third-party systems, to protect drivers and maintain trust in connected vehicle technologies, comments Artem Zinenko, Head of Kaspersky ICS CERT Vulnerability Research and Assessment Team. Kaspersky recommends that subcontractors restrict access to web services via VPN, isolate services from corporate networks, enforce strict password policies, implement 2FA, encrypt sensitive data, and integrate the logging system with a SIEM system for real-time monitoring. For the automaker, Kaspersky advises restricting access to the telematics platform from the vehicle network segment, using allowlist access for network interactions, disabling SSH password authentication , running services with least privileges, and ensuring authentication of commands in TCUs, along with SIEM system integration. Kaspersky Kaspersky Security Analyst Summit 2025 Artem Zinenko zero day SQL injection issue tracking system security vehicles hashed passwords Your comment Send
content_it:
Al Security Analyst Summit 2025, Kaspersky ha presentato i risultati di un audit informatico che ha rivelato una grave vulnerabilità, consentendo l’accesso non autorizzato a tutti i veicoli connessi di un produttore automobilistico. Sfruttando una falla zero-day in un’applicazione pubblica di un subfornitore, i ricercatori hanno ottenuto il controllo del sistema telematico delle auto, mettendo a rischio la sicurezza fisica di conducenti e passeggeri. È stato infatti possibile forzare cambi marcia o spegnere il motore durante la marcia.

L’audit, condotto in remoto, ha evidenziato servizi web esposti. Attraverso un’iniezione SQL zero-day in un’applicazione wiki del subfornitore, sono state estratte credenziali utente con password hash deboli. Ciò ha permesso di accedere al sistema di tracciamento delle problematiche, contenente dati sensibili sull’infrastruttura telematica, inclusi file con password hash di server telematici.

Sul lato veicolo, un firewall mal configurato ha esposto server interni. Utilizzando le credenziali ottenute, i ricercatori hanno raggiunto un altro subfornitore, ottenendo il pieno controllo sull’infrastruttura telematica. Hanno così potuto caricare un firmware modificato sull’unità di controllo telematico (TCU), accedendo al bus CAN (Controller Area Network), che collega motore, trasmissione e sensori, permettendo di manipolare funzioni critiche del veicolo.

Artem Zinenko, responsabile del team di ricerca vulnerabilità Kaspersky ICS CERT, sottolinea come tali falle derivino da problemi comuni nel settore: servizi web pubblici, password deboli, assenza di autenticazione a due fattori (2FA) e dati sensibili non cifrati. “Questo caso dimostra come un singolo anello debole nella catena dei subfornitori possa compromettere l’intera flotta di veicoli connessi”, afferma.

Kaspersky raccomanda ai subfornitori di limitare l’accesso ai servizi web tramite VPN, isolare le piattaforme dalle reti aziendali, adottare policy rigorose sulle password, attivare la 2FA, cifrare i dati sensibili e integrare i log in un sistema SIEM per il monitoraggio in tempo reale. Per i produttori, si consiglia di restringere l’accesso alla piattaforma telematica dalla rete del veicolo, usare liste di controllo (allowlist), disabilitare l’autenticazione SSH via password, eseguire i servizi con i privilegi minimi e garantire l’autenticazione dei comandi nelle TCU, sempre con integrazione SIEM.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, queste scoperte sottolineano l’urgenza di adottare pratiche di cybersecurity più robuste nell’industria automotive, specialmente nei sistemi di terze parti. Per le aziende italiane attive nel settore automotive e nella subfornitura tecnologica, si aprono opportunità per fornire soluzioni di sicurezza avanzate, componenti hardware sicuri e servizi di consulenza specializzati nella protezione delle infrastrutture telematiche.

title_en: Mining in Serbia under new rules – Drafting of law that brings harmonization with EU standards on critical raw materials begins
title_it: Nuova legge mineraria in linea con l'UE
content_en: Illustration (Photo: freedomnaruk/shutterstock.com) The Ministry of Mining and Energy announced that the drafting of a new Law on Mining and Geological Exploration has begun, which will replace the current law from 2015 . This move is aimed, as stated, at establishing a modern, transparent and efficient system of management of mineral and geological resources, in accordance with the principles of sustainable development and European standards. As stated in the explanation, the existing law no longer meets modern challenges, especially when it comes to environmental protection, management of strategic mineral raw materials and compliance with European regulations. The new law, it says, should provide improved legal certainty, a clearer role of the state and greater transparency in exploration and exploitation procedures. – Mineral and other geological resources represent natural resources of general interest and are state-owned, which imposes on the state the obligation to ensure their rational use and preservation for future generations – the Ministry’s explanation states. The new law aims to strengthen the role of the state as the owner and manager of natural resources, introduce modern standards of sustainable mining, with mandatory environmental protection and land reclamation, harmonize the national framework with European Union regulations, in particular with the Critical Raw Materials Act and the principles of the European Green Deal , introduce digitalization and e-commerce in all stages of procedures, for more efficient supervision and public availability of data, and ensure transparent models for granting rights to explore and exploit mineral resources. The law will also include the introduction of standardized reporting in accordance with international systems such as PERC, UNFC and PRMS, as well as the application of ESG principles (environmental, social and governance criteria) in all stages of mining. One of the key innovations will be the clear definition of control mechanisms over strategic and critical mineral resources, as well as their inclusion in spatial and development plans . It is also planned to establish a unified information system that will enable electronic submission of requests, conducting procedures and public access to data on exploration and exploitation fields. The implementation of the new law, as the Ministry points out, should contribute to a more transparent and responsible use of natural resources, strengthening public trust in institutions and creating a stable framework for the development of sustainable and competitive mining in Serbia. The public debate lasts until November 11, and the Ministry has invited the public to submit proposals and suggestions to sektor.geologijairudarstvo@mre.gov.rs. I. Z. content_it:
Il Ministero dell’Energia e delle Miniere della Serbia ha avviato la stesura di una nuova Legge sulle attività minerarie e l’esplorazione geologica, che sostituirà quella vigente dal 2015. L’obiettivo è istituire un sistema moderno, trasparente ed efficiente per la gestione delle risorse minerarie e geologiche, in linea con i principi dello sviluppo sostenibile e con gli standard europei. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la normativa attuale non risponde più alle sfide contemporanee, in particolare per quanto riguarda la protezione ambientale, la gestione delle materie prime strategiche e il recepimento della normativa UE, tra cui il Critical Raw Materials Act e i principi del Green Deal europeo.

La nuova legge prevede maggiore certezza giuridica, un ruolo più chiaro dello Stato e procedure più trasparenti per esplorazione ed estrazione. Le risorse minerarie, essendo di interesse generale e di proprietà statale, dovranno essere utilizzate in modo razionale e preservate per le generazioni future. Tra le novità: l’introduzione di standard moderni di estrazione sostenibile con obblighi di bonifica del suolo, la digitalizzazione di tutte le procedure, modelli trasparenti per l’assegnazione dei diritti minerari e l’adozione di sistemi internazionali di reporting (PERC, UNFC, PRMS) nonché l’applicazione dei criteri ESG (ambientali, sociali e di governance) in ogni fase dell’attività estrattiva.

Saranno inoltre definiti con chiarezza i meccanismi di controllo sulle risorse minerarie strategiche e critiche, che verranno integrate nei piani territoriali e di sviluppo. È prevista anche la creazione di un sistema informativo unificato per la presentazione telematica delle istanze, lo svolgimento delle procedure e l’accesso pubblico ai dati. La consultazione pubblica è aperta fino all’11 novembre e i contributi possono essere inviati all’indirizzo sektor.geologijairudarstvo@mre.gov.rs.

L’armonizzazione con la normativa europea e l’adozione di standard internazionali potrebbero offrire nuove opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nel settore minerario, in particolare per fornitori di tecnologie sostenibili, servizi di ingegneria e consulenza ambientale.

title_en: Loan Agreement signed with EIB for modernization, renovation and expansion of clinical centers in Belgrade, Novi Sad, Nis and Kragujevac
title_it: Finanziamento EIB per ospedali serbi
content_en: University Clinical Center of Serbia (Photo: Aleksandar Parezanović) Minister of Finance Sinisa Mali and Vice President of the European Investment Bank (EIB) Robert de Groot signed the Loan Agreement for the second phase of the reconstruction of clinical centers in Belgrade, Novi Sad, Nis and Kragujevac. The signing officially created the conditions for the start of the second phase of the project, which includes the modernization, renovation and expansion of four clinical centers with a total estimated value of EUR 662 million. Of this, the EIB loan amounts to a total of EUR 315 million through the signing of two financial agreements, the first in the amount of up to EUR 157 million, which has been signed, and the second in the amount of up to EUR 158 million, the signing of which is planned for 2026, while Serbia’s investment amounts to EUR 347 million. – Strengthening, modernizing, equipping and reconstructing healthcare institutions are of strategic importance for the Government of Serbia and with the help of partners such as the EIB, we are continuing the wave of investments in healthcare – said Mali. He added that Serbia had excellent doctors and medical staff, to whom it wanted to provide the most modern working conditions, for maximum performance. As he said, the completion of all new and reconstructed facilities is planned for the end of 2032 . In the previous phase, a total of EUR 200 million was contracted with the European Investment Bank based on three signed financial agreements. The funds from all three loans have been fully withdrawn. Ministarstvo finansija Republike Srbije Evropska investiciona banka EIB Ministry of Finance European Investment Bank Siniša Mali Robert de Groot reconstruction of clinical centers Your comment Send
content_it: Il ministro delle Finanze serbo, Siniša Mali, e il vicepresidente della Banca europea per gli investimenti (BEI), Robert de Groot, hanno firmato l’accordo di prestito per la seconda fase della ricostruzione dei centri clinici di Belgrado, Novi Sad, Niš e Kragujevac. La firma ha ufficialmente avviato la seconda fase del progetto, che prevede la modernizzazione, ristrutturazione e ampliamento delle quattro strutture per un valore complessivo stimato di 662 milioni di euro. Di questa somma, 315 milioni provengono da prestiti BEI, erogati tramite due accordi: il primo, già firmato, per un massimo di 157 milioni, e il secondo, previsto per il 2026, per ulteriori 158 milioni. La Repubblica di Serbia contribuisce con 347 milioni di euro. “Rafforzare, modernizzare, dotare e ricostruire le istituzioni sanitarie è di importanza strategica per il governo serbo e, grazie a partner come la BEI, proseguiamo con una forte ondata di investimenti nel settore sanitario”, ha dichiarato Mali, sottolineando l’impegno a offrire al personale medico le condizioni operative più moderne per massimizzarne le prestazioni. Il completamento di tutte le nuove e ristrutturate strutture è previsto entro la fine del 2032. Nella fase precedente, erano già stati contratti 200 milioni di euro con la BEI attraverso tre accordi finanziari, i cui fondi sono stati interamente erogati, come riportato da ekapija.com. Le imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture sanitarie, tecnologie mediche e servizi di ingegneria potrebbero trovare opportunità significative nei prossimi bandi legati a questo ampio programma di ammodernamento.

title_en: PERI DUO – New generation of sustainable and efficient systems
title_it: Sistema PERI DUO: innovazione sostenibile per l’edilizia
content_en: (Photo: PERI Srbija) The modern construction industry faces increasing pressure to increase productivity, improve safety and at the same time meet ESG (Environment, Social, Governance) standards of sustainable business. One of the key steps in this direction is innovation in materials, especially in the formwork and scaffolding segment. The PERI company has been investing in research and development of polymer composites for years, and the result of that work is DUO – the first complete formwork system made of techno-polymer that changes the way work is done on the construction site. Materials science-based innovation PERI has developed a composite material based on a polymer base, optimized by the application of special additives. Unlike traditional materials such as steel or wood, techno-polymers are extremely durable, resistant to moisture over time and not deformation prone. The production process allows for great flexibility during design - with the same components, it is possible to perform the formwork of walls and mezzanine structures. This simplifies assembly and reduces the number of elements in the system. Sustainability as a strategic asset DUO is not only a technical innovation, but also a response to the demands of sustainable construction. The system brings three key benefits: • Zero-waste production – all raw materials used are processed to create the final product. During production, no waste is produced. • Less weight, lower transport costs and emissions – a very light system compared to steel or wood, which enables faster work processes, saves time, reduces transport and labor costs. • 100% recyclability – used DUO panels are returned to the production cycle and become new products, thus realizing the principle of sustainable economy. (Photo: PERI Srbija) Efficiency and productivity on the construction site The DUO system is intended for walls, mezzanine structures, columns and foundations – one system covers the majority of typical construction works. Thanks to the low weight, the elements can be mounted manually, without the use of a crane, which enables work even in smaller or hard-to-reach locations, as well as in urban areas where the noise level is limited. The system is characterized by: • minimum number of different components, • operation without special tools, • quick mastery of the process even by less experienced staff. In this way, DUO increases productivity and reduces latency, which directly contributes to higher project profitability. (Photo: PERI Srbija) Light universal formwork for walls, slabs, columns and foundations. Recognized globally IThe innovativeness of the DUO system is confirmed by numerous international awards. Among them are the French MAT D`OR Award, the "Best Innovative Product" award in Angola, the Best Machine and Excellence Award at Bauma CONEXPO INDIA, as well as the BAKA Innovative Product Award 2019 in Germany. These recognitions confirm that DUO is setting new standards in formwork technology at the global level. New generation system formwork Combining advanced materials science, sustainability and ease of use, DUO is a logical step in the evolution of building solutions. It brings benefits to all key participants in the project - investors (reduced costs and ESG compliance), contractors (faster assembly and lower risk), engineers and planners (flexibility of the technical solution).. ESG standards are no longer just a trend – they are the basis of modern business and an important success criterion for every company. (Photo: PERI Srbija) Techno-polymers, as the material of the future, are getting specific application in practice. Solutions like the PERI DUO system show how innovations in materials and technology can be aligned with the principles of social responsibility, without compromising efficiency and profitability. For more information about the PERI DUO system , application possibilities and technical support, visit our website www.peri.rs or contact us via e-mail office@peri.rs . Our expert team is at your disposal for all your questions, technical consultations and system demonstrations on your project. PERI oplate d.o.o. content_it:
L’industria edile moderna affronta crescenti pressioni per aumentare produttività, migliorare la sicurezza e rispettare gli standard ESG (Environment, Social, Governance). In questo contesto, PERI ha sviluppato DUO, il primo sistema completo di casseforme realizzato in tecno-polimero, frutto di anni di ricerca sui compositi polimerici. A differenza di acciaio e legno, il materiale è estremamente durevole, resistente all’umidità e non soggetto a deformazioni. Il sistema permette di realizzare casseforme per pareti, solai, pilastri e fondazioni con un numero ridotto di componenti, senza utensili speciali e con facilità di montaggio anche da parte di personale meno esperto.

DUO offre vantaggi significativi in termini di sostenibilità: produzione a zero rifiuti, peso ridotto (con minori costi ed emissioni di trasporto) e riciclabilità al 100%. La leggerezza consente il montaggio manuale, anche in aree urbane o di difficile accesso. Il sistema ha ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali, tra cui il MAT D’OR in Francia e il BAKA Innovative Product Award in Germania, confermando il suo ruolo di riferimento globale nel settore.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, PERI DUO rappresenta un’evoluzione che unisce innovazione tecnologica, sostenibilità ed efficienza economica, con benefici per investitori, imprese edili e progettisti. Per le imprese italiane del settore edile e della subfornitura, questa soluzione rappresenta un’opportunità per migliorare la competitività attraverso tecnologie avanzate e conformi agli standard ESG.

title_en: Kristina Kočanović, Divna Design: Our goal is to become a synonym for emotional luxury, a design that goes beyond aesthetics and becomes a way of life
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: (Photo: Nikola Vukilić) At a time when Montenegro is increasingly becoming recognized as a luxury destination, with numerous new projects that push the boundaries, the need for the interior to follow this concept of elegance is growing. With the arrival of foreign investors in the country, new trends are arriving, and clients are becoming more open to creative ideas and getting out of their comfort zone. The Montenegrin interior designer Kristina Kočanović recognized this opportunity. After studying in Belgrade and Milan, as well as working in some leading companies in Podgorica, Belgrade and New York, she opened the Divna Design studio. As she pointed out in an interview for eKapija, Divna Design was born from a sincere desire to create spaces that have a soul - which are not only aesthetically appealing, but also honestly reflect the life and style of those who live in them. - When I founded the studio, my vision was to combine functionality, emotion and aesthetics into a unique entity. In the beginning, I did small projects, but with a clear goal: that every space we touch becomes wonderful in the true sense of the word - warm, harmonious and elegant - she says. The biggest challenge for a young designer who is building her own brand in Montenegro was to build trust, Kristina tells us. - It was necessary to show that behind beautiful renderings there is a serious team that delivers projects to the end, on time and with impeccable details. The Montenegrin market is small and demanding, but that teaches you that every project must be top-notch. The biggest success of Divna Design so far is not a single project, but the fact that our clients come back and recommend us. This trust is, for me, the greatest confirmation of quality. (Photo: Lazar Kovačević) Divna Design is known for its blend of luxury, elegance and moderate extravagance — how do you find the balance between those three elements? - Balance is in proportion. Luxury does not have to be overemphasized, but rather subtle — in materials, proportions, textures, in the way light touches the surface. I like to add a touch of extravagance through a detail — a piece of art, lighting, or an interesting piece of furniture — but all within the limits of elegance and ease. There is a strong aesthetic consistency in your projects — how much room do you leave for clients to influence the final appearance of the space? - In each project, there is a balance between my handwriting and the client`s lifestyle. I love when the client brings himself into the space, because then the design gains authenticity. My role is to translate all those desires into the language of aesthetics and functionality, to harmonize them into a harmonious whole. Finally, even though my signature is recognizable, the space always "talks" about the one who lives in it. (Photo: Lazar Kovačević) Do you think that clients in Montenegro and the region are increasingly open to contemporary and daring ideas in design? How would you compare the Montenegrin market with, say, Belgrade, New York or Milan, where you also gained experience? - With the arrival of foreign investors, our clients are also becoming more open to more creative ideas, and they are stepping out of their comfort zone. Today, clients follow world trends much more, they travel, they find inspiration on the internet — which also makes them more open to new ideas. Montenegro, although small, has more and more high-standard projects and space for experimentation. Of course, markets like Belgrade or Milan are faster and more diverse, but in Montenegro I see an opportunity to shape an authentic style - a combination of Mediterranean spirit and contemporary luxury. Do you think that there is enough space in Montenegro and the region for young designers to assert themselves in this sector? - There is space, but also a need for more support. This job requires experience and great responsibility — because a designer does not only create aesthetics, but also the quality of life of people. Young designers must have the opportunity to work on real projects, because that is where the essence is learned - in real space and time, on real projects and with real possibilities and contractors. I believe that, with the development of the market and new investments, those doors will be more and more open. (Photo: Anđela Perković) What trends are currently prevailing when it comes to interior design? And how do you envision the ideal interior of the future — does it lean more towards minimalism, sustainability, technology, or something else entirely? - Interior trends are closely followed by trends in fashion - what you wear today, you will very easily see translated into a living room tomorrow. Colors, materials and textures from the fashion world seamlessly flow into the design of the space. However, it is important to be measured and not get carried away by trends. I like that interiors have no fear of transience - to be contemporary, but also timeless, with a character that lasts. I think the ideal interior of the future combines technology with emotion and sustainability - smart homes that stay warm, with soul and human warmth that cannot be digitized. (Photo: Divna Design) In recent years, a large number of luxury projects have been developed in Montenegro, and you worked on some of them yourself. How does it affect the sector`s development? And what did these projects bring to Montenegro, when it comes to your industry? - Luxury projects have brought a completely new standard - in terms of quality, details, execution and aesthetics. This helped the entire industry to mature: from contractors, to architects and designers. I believe that we are all still on that path and have opportunities for even greater growth. As a studio, it gave us the opportunity to show that Montenegro has the talent and expertise to rival world destinations. What projects are you particularly proud of and is there one that you would say was a turning point in your career? When you look at your portfolio — what would you say is the "signature" of Divna Design, the thing that is immediately recognized as your work? - I am especially proud of projects in which we did everything - from the idea to the final detail, and when the renderings are identical to the photo of the finished state. These are projects that bear our stamp in every element. I`m from the coast, so projects made on the coast are always close to my heart. My signature is a blend of warmth and sophistication, a combination of natural tones, textures and light, with a dose of modern luxury. (Photo: Divna Design) What are the plans for Divna Design in the next years? Are you considering international projects? - Yes, certainly. It is my wish that Divna Design goes beyond the borders of Montenegro and that we transfer our aesthetic signature to projects in the region and abroad. I am especially inspired by projects on the coast - places that have character and a story, such as Kotor and Tivat and projects such as Porto Montenegro, Portonovi, Luštica... In the long term, the goal is for Divna Design to become synonymous with emotional luxury - design that goes beyond aesthetics and becomes a way of life. title_en: RGA: New Law on State Survey and Cadaster enables easier registration of ownership based on old documents
title_it: Nuova legge agevola registrazione proprietà
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Shutterstock/Juicy FOTO) The new Law on Amendments to the Law on State Survey and Cadaster, which brings great relief for citizens and enables easier registration of ownership rights based on old documents, entered into force on October 31, the Republic Geodetic Authority (RGA) announced. The most important new feature is the introduction of convalidation - a procedure that recognizes the legal validity of old documents that have formal deficiencies, but clearly prove ownership. – In practice, this means that several tens of thousands of old documents - which until now could only be registered in the real estate cadaster database through court proceedings - can finally be resolved simply, quickly and digitally – the statement says. As stated, the deficiencies of these old documents are most often formal - a stamp, a statement on registration permission, a plot number or some other data are missing - but the essence of the proof of ownership exists. The new law allows such documents to be recognized and registration to be carried out without additional paperwork. Citizens will be able to submit the request electronically via the Republic Geodetic Authority application, available on the RGA website starting from January 1, 2026. This means that anyone will be able to submit the request independently, without going to a counter or hiring a lawyer, even via mobile phone. – When the conditions are met, the cadaster will make the registration within five working days, and the decision will be able to be reviewed within a year – the statement adds. Republički geodetski zavod Beograd Republic Geodetic Authority RGA Law on Amendments to the Law on State Survey and Cadaster registration of ownership rights based on old documents Your comment Send
content_it: La nuova Legge di modifica alla Legge sulla rilevazione geodetica e sul catasto, che garantisce un notevole sollievo ai cittadini facilitando la registrazione dei diritti di proprietà sulla base di documenti antichi, è entrata in vigore il 31 ottobre, come annunciato dall’Autorità Geodetica della Repubblica (RGA). La novità più rilevante è l’introduzione della convalida, una procedura che riconosce la validità giuridica di documenti vecchi affetti da carenze formali, purché dimostrino in modo chiaro la titolarità del diritto di proprietà. In pratica, decine di migliaia di tali documenti – finora trascrivibili nel catasto esclusivamente tramite procedura giudiziaria – potranno ora essere regolarizzati in modo semplice, rapido e digitale. Le carenze di questi documenti riguardano solitamente aspetti formali, come l’assenza di un timbro, di una dichiarazione di autorizzazione alla registrazione, del numero di particella o di altri dati, senza però compromettere la sostanza della prova di proprietà. La nuova normativa consente il riconoscimento di tali atti e la conseguente registrazione senza ulteriore documentazione. I cittadini potranno presentare la domanda elettronicamente tramite l’applicazione dell’Autorità Geodetica, disponibile sul sito dell’RGA dal 1° gennaio 2026, in modo autonomo, senza recarsi allo sportello né rivolgersi a un legale, anche da smartphone. Qualora sussistano i requisiti, la registrazione sarà effettuata entro cinque giorni lavorativi e la relativa decisione sarà soggetta a revisione entro un anno, come riportato da ekapija.com. Questo quadro normativo potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità per imprese italiane attive nei settori dei servizi tecnici e informatici legati alla gestione del territorio e alla digitalizzazione di processi catastali.

title_en: CCIS: Serbia’s exporting potential limited by geopolitical developments
title_it: Esportazioni serbe frenate da geopolitica
content_en: Illustration (Photo: DeiMosz/shutterstock.com) The macroeconomic framework in Serbia remains stable, as do exports, but its potential is limited, given the stagnation in the EU, as the main export market, said Bojan Stanic, Assistant Director of the Sector for Strategic Analysis, Services and Internationalization of the Chamber of Commerce of Serbia (CCIS). – It is also important that the future of using our free trade agreements depends on geopolitics. Trade with Russia continues to decline, and on the other hand, Serbia is managing to significantly diversify its sources of energy supply. Full diversification has also been achieved in terms of oil imports – said Stanic ahead of the second annual conference “International Economic Position of Serbia - MEPS 2025: Challenges and Opportunities in the Current Geopolitical and Trading Reality.” Stanic stated that the new challenge was how to increase growth rates, which had been halved in 2025 from the expected 4.2% to 2.1%, according to IMF estimates. – We want to try to keep that rate above two percent, but a lot will depend on the situation on the energy market – he stated. He pointed out that external events had a greater impact on Serbia’s economic position and that the decline in foreign and direct investments by about 50% was not only the case in the country, but also in the region. – Of course, the political situation in the country also has an impact - on the one hand, protests, blockades, and on the other, the long wait for the formation of a new government, and in this regard, this is something that foreign investors pay attention to. However, what is happening outside has a greater impact – he stated. Asked how much trouble small and medium-sized enterprises were in due to the increase in the minimum wage, he said that it was necessary to increase the standard of living in order to strengthen purchasing power, and added that business people were facing problems such as rising energy prices, rising electricity prices and higher rental costs. Head of the Center for Strategic Analysis, Analytics, Planning and Publications of the CCIS Jelena Vasic stated that there were 17,000 businesses in the country that exported from Serbia, around 136,000 companies, but that “only” one percent of entrepreneurs in the country exported. She pointed out that she would talk about that at the conference with representatives of institutions, but also about what kind of staff was needed to make exports more successful. She mentioned the digital catalog of exporters of the CCIS, international economic cooperation and e-services of the CCIS and invited business people to register in the digital catalog. The conference at the CCIS Industry brought together representatives of institutions, academia and the economy to jointly consider Serbia’s position in global economic trends. The aim of the conference is to address key issues regarding Serbia’s economic positioning in the new trading and geopolitical circumstances. Privredna komora Srbije Chamber of Commerce of Serbia CCIS Bojan Stanić Jelena Vasić exports of Serbia Your comment Send
content_it:
Il quadro macroeconomico in Serbia rimane stabile, così come le esportazioni, ma il loro potenziale è limitato a causa della stagnazione nell’Unione europea, principale mercato di sbocco, ha dichiarato Bojan Stanić, vicedirettore del Settore per l’Analisi Strategica, i Servizi e l’Internazionalizzazione della Camera di Commercio di Serbia (CCIS). Secondo Stanić, il futuro degli accordi di libero scambio dipende fortemente dagli sviluppi geopolitici. Il commercio con la Russia continua a diminuire, mentre la Serbia sta riuscendo a diversificare in modo significativo le fonti di approvvigionamento energetico, raggiungendo una piena diversificazione anche per le importazioni di petrolio.

Stanić ha sottolineato che la nuova sfida consiste nell’aumentare i tassi di crescita, dimezzati nel 2025 rispetto alle previsioni iniziali passando dal 4,2% al 2,1% secondo le stime del FMI. “Vogliamo cercare di mantenere questo tasso sopra il 2%, ma molto dipenderà dall’andamento del mercato energetico”, ha affermato, ricordando che gli eventi esterni incidono più della situazione interna sull’economia serba. Anche gli investimenti esteri diretti sono calati di circa il 50%, un fenomeno che riguarda non solo la Serbia ma l’intera regione. Tuttavia, ha aggiunto, la situazione politica interna — con proteste, blocchi e il ritardo nella formazione del nuovo governo — influenza la percezione degli investitori stranieri.

Interpellato sull’impatto dell’aumento del salario minimo sulle piccole e medie imprese, Stanić ha evidenziato la necessità di migliorare il tenore di vita per rafforzare il potere d’acquisto, pur riconoscendo le difficoltà delle imprese legate ai rincari energetici, dell’elettricità e degli affitti.

Jelena Vasić, responsabile del Centro per l’Analisi Strategica, la Pianificazione e le Pubblicazioni della CCIS, ha ricordato che su circa 136.000 imprese presenti in Serbia, solo 17.000 esportano, corrispondenti a “solo” l’1% degli imprenditori. Ha annunciato che al convegno “Posizione economica internazionale della Serbia – MEPS 2025” si discuterà con rappresentanti istituzionali delle competenze necessarie per potenziare le esportazioni, nonché del catalogo digitale degli esportatori della CCIS, della cooperazione economica internazionale e dei servizi digitali offerti dall’ente.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’evento ha riunito istituzioni, mondo accademico ed economico per analizzare la posizione della Serbia nelle attuali dinamiche commerciali e geopolitiche. Per le imprese italiane, la crescente diversificazione commerciale della Serbia e la sua apertura a nuove partnership potrebbero rappresentare opportunità di collaborazione nei settori industriali e dei servizi avanzati.

title_en: Atanackovic: Fuel is cheapest at NIS, procurement through other means will be more expensive
title_it: Carburante più economico da NIS, alternative più costose
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Shutterstock/BalkansCat) The price of fuel is the lowest when purchased from Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), and other solutions for purchasing derivatives will be more expensive, assessed the honorary president of the Association of Serbian Employers, Nebojsa Atanackovic. – Certain quantities of crude oil for processing at NIS’s Pancevo Oil Refinery are in stock until November 25. After that, it is realistic to expect a price increase if derivatives are purchased through other means – Atanackovic, who owns a gas station, told Beta. He added that there was a possibility that the state could reduce the special tax it collected through excise duties, but that that would mean a smaller inflow of money into the budget. The owner of the Knez Petrol gas stations, Srdjan Knezevic, assessed that that day’s increase in fuel prices by three dinars for the next seven days should have happened the previous week due to the rise in the price of crude oil, which would determine whether the prices of derivatives would continue to rise or fall. – Everything depends on the movement of the price of crude oil, it can rise or fall. I expect the price to stabilize after the repair of the fire damage at the Mol refineries and the sale of Lukoil – said Knezevic. He stated that NIS had increased the delivery of fuel above the contracted quantities and that it had received 30% more. Knezevic said that his company had 120 gas stations in Serbia and that it was the largest retail chain after NIS, and that there was enough fuel at all of them. The owner of the Radun Avia gas stations, Jelena Radun, stated that she expected a slight increase in prices because fuel had started to be imported by tanker trucks, which increased costs. – We have an annual contract with NIS, but we do not purchase the entire quantity, but rather buy part of it from importers, and the input parameters show that the price of petroleum products is increasing – said Radun. content_it:
Il prezzo del carburante è il più basso quando acquistato dalla Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), mentre ogni altra soluzione d’acquisto risulterebbe più costosa. Lo ha affermato Nebojša Atanacković, presidente onorario dell’Associazione dei datori di lavoro serbi, che possiede anche una stazione di servizio. “Sono disponibili scorte di greggio per la raffineria di Pančevo fino al 25 novembre. Oltre quella data, è realistico attendersi un rialzo dei prezzi se i derivati verranno acquistati tramite altri canali”, ha dichiarato ad Beta. Atanacković ha aggiunto che lo Stato potrebbe ridurre l’accisa, ma ciò comporterebbe minori entrate per il bilancio pubblico.

Srdjan Knežević, titolare del gruppo Knez Petrol – la più grande rete di distribuzione al dettaglio in Serbia dopo NIS, con 120 stazioni di servizio – ha osservato che l’ultimo aumento di tre dinari sui prezzi del carburante, valido per sette giorni, sarebbe dovuto intervenire già la settimana precedente, in linea con l’andamento del greggio. “Tutto dipende dall’andamento del prezzo del petrolio greggio, che può salire o scendere. Mi aspetto una stabilizzazione dopo la riparazione dei danni da incendio alle raffinerie Mol e la vendita di Lukoil”, ha affermato Knežević, precisando che NIS ha aumentato le consegne oltre i quantitativi contrattuali del 30%.

Anche Jelena Radun, proprietaria della rete Radun Avia, ha previsto un lieve rialzo dei prezzi a causa dell’importazione via autobotte, che innalza i costi logistici. “Abbiamo un contratto annuale con NIS, ma non acquistiamo l’intero quantitativo da loro, integrando con importatori. Gli attuali parametri indicano un aumento del prezzo dei prodotti petroliferi”, ha dichiarato.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, il mercato serbo del carburante resta dunque strettamente legato all’andamento del greggio e alla capacità operativa di NIS. Per le imprese italiane attive nel settore energetico o nella logistica di prodotti petroliferi, la situazione evidenzia potenziali opportunità legate alla fornitura di tecnologie per il trasporto, stoccaggio o trattamento di carburanti, soprattutto in un contesto di crescente dipendenza da importazioni alternative.

title_en: Foreign investments arriving in Zitiste – 21.9 million dinars for reconstruction of parking lot
title_it: Investimenti esteri per parcheggio a Žitište
content_en: (Photo: Google StreetView/Screenshot) As part of the project for the development of local infrastructure and institutional strengthening of local self-government units, the Municipality of Zitiste has received a grant of 21,909,183 dinars for the reconstruction of the parking lot for passenger vehicles on Ive Lola Ribara and Veljka Vlahovica streets. The project is financed by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the French Development Agency, and is implemented by the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, in cooperation with the local self-government of Zitiste. The agreement on the allocation of funds was signed last week in the Government of Serbia, in the presence of Prime Minister Djuro Macut and Minister of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure Aleksandra Sofronijevic. On behalf of the Municipality of Zitiste, the agreement was signed by Deputy Mayor Djordje Zuza. After signing the agreement, the public procurement procedure and the selection of the most favorable contractor will follow. The reconstruction of this parking space in the central area of Zitiste will improve the communal infrastructure, increase the number of parking spaces, and improve traffic conditions and citizen safety. content_it: Nell’ambito del progetto per lo sviluppo delle infrastrutture locali e il rafforzamento istituzionale degli enti locali, il Comune di Žitište ha ottenuto un finanziamento di 21.909.183 dinari per la ricostruzione del parcheggio per autovetture situato nelle vie Ive Lola Ribara e Veljka Vlahovica. title_en: Expressway to Bezdan border crossing planned – 13.6 km bypass route
title_it: Bypass di 13,6 km verso il valico di Bezdan
content_en: (Photo: Netfalls Remy Musser/shutterstock.com) The plan for the Bezdan border crossing bypass is available for public inspection. The Department of Spatial and Urban Planning and Civil Engineering of the City Administration has invited citizens to participate in a public discussion on the draft Decision on the development of a detailed regulation plan for the construction of a bypass on the route from the Kozara pista roundabout on the Backi Breg - Sombor - Vrbas - Kikinda - Srpska Crnja expressway to the Bezdan border crossing, soinfo.org reports. According to the graphic representation, the bypass route that will touch the Bezdan settlement is 13.6 kilometers long, and the total area covered by the plan is around 300 hectares. The company MHM-projekt d.o.o. from Novi Sad, which was previously responsible for the development of the feasibility study and conceptual design of the expressway, will be the developer of the Plan. The funds for the development of the plan will be provided by the Public Enterprise Roads of Serbia and the Provincial Secretariat for Energy, Construction and Transport. The deadline for the development of the draft detailed regulation plan is 12 months at the most. The decision on whether to prepare a report on the strategic environmental impact assessment of the plan will be made based on the opinion of the body responsible for environmental protection of the city of Sombor and will represent an integral part of the documentation basis of the detailed regulation plan. title_en: German auto giant in crisis – Porsche loses around EUR 1 billion
title_it: Porsche perde quasi 1 miliardo di euro
content_en: (Photo: Pixabay.com/MarleneBitzer) Porsche has fallen into the red for the first time since going public in 2022, reporting a loss of almost EUR 1 billion as the German sports car maker made a costly switch to petrol engines rather than electric vehicles. The group reported an operating loss of EUR 967 million in the third quarter, compared to an operating profit of EUR 974 million in the same period last year. In the first nine months of 2025, it made an operating profit of just EUR 40 million, compared to EUR 4 billion in 2024. The sports car maker has been a reliable source of profit for the Volkswagen Group, but has struggled in the face of lower-than-expected demand for electric vehicles, falling sales in China and increased US tariffs. – We expect 2025 to be the lowest year, which precedes a noticeable improvement for Porsche from 2026 onwards – Chief Financial Officer Jochen Breckner said in a statement. Porsche has “willingly accepted” the weak results as it reorganizes its product line, Breckner said. The company announced last month that it would take a charge of 1.8 billion euros after abandoning a new all-electric hybrid, introducing new gasoline and hybrid models. Porsche will also focus more on making its cars “more individual, more exclusive and more desirable,” the company’s CFO said. Porsche Volkswagen Group Jochen Breckner operations losses Your comment Send
content_it: Porsche ha registrato una perdita operativa di 967 milioni di euro nel terzo trimestre 2025, scivolando in rosso per la prima volta dall’IPO avvenuta nel 2022. Nello stesso periodo dello scorso anno il margine operativo era di 974 milioni di euro. Nei primi nove mesi del 2025, l’utile operativo si è ridotto drasticamente a soli 40 milioni di euro, contro i 4 miliardi dell’intero 2024. Il costruttore tedesco di auto sportive, tradizionalmente un pilastro di profitto per il Gruppo Volkswagen, sta affrontando una congiuntura difficile a causa della domanda inferiore alle attese per i veicoli elettrici, del calo delle vendite in Cina e dei dazi statunitensi più elevati. Il CFO Jochen Breckner ha dichiarato che il 2025 sarà l’anno peggiore, ma prevede un netto miglioramento a partire dal 2026. Porsche ha “accettato volontariamente” questi risultati negativi mentre ristruttura la propria gamma prodotti, abbandonando un nuovo modello ibrido totalmente elettrico e prevedendo oneri per 1,8 miliardi di euro. L’azienda punterà ora su vetture “più individuali, esclusive e desiderabili”, introducendo nuovi modelli a benzina e ibridi. Come riportato da ekapija.com, questa strategia segna una parziale inversione rispetto al precedente impegno verso l’elettrificazione. L’evoluzione del mercato automobilistico europeo offre comunque opportunità per fornitori italiani specializzati in componentistica premium e soluzioni ibride.

title_en: Air Serbia offering 26% discount on tickets this weekend

content_en: (Photo: eKapija) The national airline Air Serbia is celebrating its 26th birthday by organizing a promotional campaign this weekend - giving every passenger a 26% discount on airline tickets to more than 50 destinations. The company’s announcement states that the discount is valid only during this weekend, October 25 and 26, with a promo code (on the Air Serbia portal), and the travel period covered by the campaign lasts until August 31, 2026. As announced, tickets can be purchased via the airserbia.com website, mobile application, Contact Center and branch office in TC Galerija. content_it: La compagnia aerea nazionale Air Serbia celebra il suo 26° anniversario con una campagna promozionale in programma questo weekend: tutti i passeggeri potranno usufruire di uno sconto del 26% sui biglietti per oltre 50 destinazioni. Secondo quanto comunicato dall’azienda, la promozione è valida esclusivamente sabato 25 e domenica 26 ottobre, utilizzando un codice promozionale disponibile sul portale Air Serbia. I biglietti possono essere acquistati tramite il sito airserbia.com, l’applicazione mobile, il Contact Center e l’ufficio situato nel centro commerciale TC Galerija a Belgrado, come riportato da ekapija.com.

title_en: Stara Pazova to get another factory – Muehlbauer’s facilities to develop and assemble batteries and fuel cells for electric vehicles
title_it: Nuovo impianto Muehlbauer a Stara Pazova
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Pixabay / kaboompics) The Muehlbauer factory will open today in Stara Pazova. The company’s facilities in Stara Pazova will develop and assemble batteries and fuel cells for electric vehicles, and as announced at the groundbreaking ceremony for the factory last year, 150 workers will be employed, with an average salary of EUR 900. The construction of the factory began in early 2024 , and the value of the investment project amounted to EUR 29.5 million. Muehlbauer was founded in 1981 as a company specializing in the production of precision parts for the aviation industry, and today it is a world-renowned manufacturer of innovative end-to-end ID solutions that focus on the production, personalization and issuance of secure ID cards and e-passports according to ICAO standards, and has established itself as a competent partner dedicated to the implementation of security systems. The company employs 3,870 professionals worldwide, and in 2022 it generated sales revenue of EUR 324.5 million. Muehlbauer Group has been present in Serbia since 2008, and the Technology Park in Stara Pazova is the first center of its kind in Europe, outside of Germany. Fotografije: MUEHLBAUER d.o.o. content_it: Oggi viene inaugurato a Stara Pazova il nuovo stabilimento del Gruppo Muehlbauer, specializzato nello sviluppo e nell’assemblaggio di batterie e celle a combustibile per veicoli elettrici. Come annunciato in occasione della cerimonia di posa della prima pietra lo scorso anno, l’impianto impiegherà 150 addetti con uno stipendio medio di 900 euro. La costruzione è iniziata all’inizio del 2024 e l’investimento ammonta a 29,5 milioni di euro. Fondata nel 1981 come produttrice di componenti di precisione per l’aviazione, Muehlbauer oggi è un leader mondiale nelle soluzioni integrate per documenti d’identità sicuri, inclusi passaporti elettronici conformi agli standard ICAO. Il gruppo, presente in Serbia dal 2008, conta 3.870 dipendenti globali e ha realizzato nel 2022 un fatturato di 324,5 milioni di euro. Il Technology Park di Stara Pazova rappresenta il primo centro del genere in Europa al di fuori della Germania. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’iniziativa rafforza ulteriormente il posizionamento della Serbia nel settore delle tecnologie per la mobilità sostenibile, aprendo potenziali opportunità di collaborazione per aziende italiane attive nella componentistica elettrica, nella produzione di materiali avanzati e nei sistemi di assemblaggio industriale.

title_en: Sanctions halt sale of NIS subsidiaries in the region
title_it: Bloccata vendita filiali NIS per sanzioni
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/dr Igi) Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) initiated the sale of its subsidiaries in the region two years ago, but the process has been halted due to US sanctions, writes Danas. NIS owns subsidiaries in three neighboring countries - Romania, Bulgaria and Bosnia and Herzegovina. Since the sanctions were imposed, all NIS subsidiaries in those three countries have closed gas stations, their accounts have been blocked and they have ceased operations. In Romania, NIS has 19 gas stations under the Gazprom brand (NIS Petrol S.R.L.), and on October 9, all financial transactions were suspended. The situation is the same in Bulgaria, where Gazprom/NIS has 23 gas stations - all of them have been closed, bank accounts have been blocked and fuel deliveries have been suspended. In Bosnia and Herzegovina, 42 gas stations operated through the companies NIS Petrol Banjaluka and G-Petrol Sarajevo, employing around 500 workers. Banks have closed accounts, international payments have been blocked, and deliveries from the Pancevo Refinery have been suspended for more than 10 days. According to information from Danas’ anonymous sources, several serious buyers are interested in the purchase and the negotiations on the acquisition have advanced significantly. What all subsidiaries have in common is that they are operating at a loss: in Romania, NIS is recording a loss of EUR 160 million, and in Bulgaria, EUR 90 million. Read more: NIS’s gas stations in Bulgaria to become AVIA – Uni Energy waiting for Commission’s approval to buy NIS Petrol Bulgaria worth more than EUR 30 million The losses in the operations of NIS’s subsidiaries in these countries appeared approximately two years ago, when the European Union began to significantly increase sanctions against the Russian energy sector (including Gazprom), which made business in Romania and Bulgaria more difficult, and the current blocking of operations and the closure of gas stations are bringing new losses. It is estimated that NIS will have losses of EUR 30-35 million in Romania and Bulgaria, and in Bosnia and Herzegovina, the loss will reach EUR 50 million. Old losses and expected new ones will create a business deficit for NIS of around EUR 350-360 million. NIS a.d. content_it: Due anni fa, Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) ha avviato la vendita delle sue controllate in Romania, Bulgaria e Bosnia ed Erzegovina, ma il processo si è interrotto a causa delle sanzioni statunitensi, come riportato da Danas. A seguito delle misure restrittive, tutte le stazioni di servizio di NIS nei tre Paesi sono state chiuse, i conti bancari bloccati e le attività sospese. In Romania, dove NIS gestisce 19 impianti con il marchio Gazprom (NIS Petrol S.R.L.), le transazioni finanziarie sono state congelate dall’8 ottobre. Situazione analoga in Bulgaria, con 23 stazioni chiuse e consegne di carburante interrotte. In Bosnia ed Erzegovina, 42 stazioni operative tramite NIS Petrol Banjaluka e G-Petrol Sarajevo, che impiegano circa 500 persone, sono ferme da oltre 10 giorni per il blocco dei pagamenti internazionali e delle forniture dalla raffineria di Pančevo. Secondo fonti anonime citate da Danas, diversi acquirenti seri avrebbero portato avanti trattative avanzate per la cessione. Le controllate sono tutte in perdita: 160 milioni di euro in Romania, 90 milioni in Bulgaria. Le perdite complessive, tra quelle passate e quelle previste, potrebbero raggiungere i 350-360 milioni di euro per NIS. Come riportato da ekapija.com, nonostante le difficoltà, permangono opportunità per operatori esteri interessati ad acquisire asset energetici nella regione a condizioni vantaggiose.

title_en: Institute of Transportation CIP to prepare preliminary design for construction of regional depot for maintenance of rolling stock in Nis
title_it: Deposito regionale a Niš per manutenzione treni
content_en: (Photo: Google Maps) In Nis, which should be included in the high-speed rail system in Serbia in the coming years, there are plans to establish a multi-purpose regional depot for the maintenance of rolling stock in this part of the country, specifically diesel sets (710 and 711), but also the most modern sets (Flirt and Kis). At the end of August, Srbijavoz announced a public procurement for the development of a preliminary design for the Nis (Popovac) depot , and the job was awarded to the Institute of Transportation CIP, which was the only one to submit a bid within this public procurement, the estimated value of which was 20 million dinars, and the value of the awarded contract was 19.8 million dinars excluding VAT. Let us remind that the eastern side of the Popovac marshalling yard was chosen for the construction of this depot. In accordance with the development and project plan of the railroad, Nis will be a regional rail center/junction of intersections and passages of passenger and cargo rail traffic along Corridor 10. It is envisaged that the technological process in the future regional depot must include the reception of arriving vehicles, diagnostics, rough internal cleaning, external machine washing, regular maintenance (inspection and unscheduled repairs) and wheel processing. In accordance with all this, the construction of several facilities is planned: a maintenance hall, a facility for housing an underground lathe for processing rail vehicle wheels, a facility for housing a rail vehicle washing facility, tracks for access to the facilities. tracks for testing the contact network under voltage, internal roads and fences of the complex. A Niš, città che nei prossimi anni sarà integrata nel sistema ferroviario ad alta velocità della Serbia, è prevista la realizzazione di un deposito regionale multifunzionale per la manutenzione del materiale rotabile, destinato sia ai convogli diesel (710 e 711) sia ai modelli più moderni (Flirt e Kis). Alla fine di agosto, Srbijavoz ha indetto una gara pubblica per la redazione del progetto preliminare del deposito di Niš (Popovac), aggiudicato all’Istituto per i Trasporti CIP, unico offerente. Il valore stimato della procedura era di 20 milioni di dinari, mentre il contratto è stato assegnato per 19,8 milioni di dinari (esclusa IVA). La sede scelta per la costruzione è il lato orientale del fascio di manovra di Popovac. 

Secondo il piano di sviluppo ferroviario, Niš diventerà un nodo regionale strategico per il traffico passeggeri e merci lungo il Corridoio 10. Il futuro deposito dovrà garantire l’accettazione dei convogli in arrivo, la diagnostica, la pulizia interna grossolana, il lavaggio esterno meccanizzato, la manutenzione ordinaria (ispezioni e riparazioni fuori programma) e la rettifica delle ruote. Sono previsti diversi edifici: un capannone officina, una struttura per la fresatrice sotterranea delle ruote, un impianto per il lavaggio dei rotabili, binari di accesso, binari per il collaudo della linea aerea di contatto sotto tensione, strade interne e recinzioni perimetrali. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la realizzazione del deposito si inserisce nel più ampio piano di potenziamento dell’infrastruttura ferroviaria serba. L’operazione rappresenta un’opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nel settore delle infrastrutture ferroviarie e della fornitura di impianti specializzati per la manutenzione del materiale rotabile.
sector: Infrastrutture e sovrastrutture per strade ferrate

title_en: NBS to introduce electronic bills of exchange on December 1
title_it: Cambiali elettroniche dal 1° dicembre
content_en: (Photo: eKapija / Aleksandra Kekić) On December 1, 2025, the Central Register of Electronic Bills of Exchange (CReM) will become operational, enabling the issuance and use of bills of exchange in electronic form, which until now have been used exclusively in paper, i.e. on blank bills of exchange, announced the National Bank of Serbia (NBS). On October 29, 2025, the NBS Executive Board and Governor adopted the Decision on Detailed Terms, Contents and Manner of Keeping the Register of Bills of Exchange and Mandates, and amendments to the Decision on the Manner of Enforcement of Claims by Debiting the Client’s Account and the Decision on the Single Tariff under which the National Bank of Serbia Charges Fees for the Services Provided, the NBS says. – CReM is a modern digital platform developed by the NBS that enables all operations related to bills of exchange - creation, issuance, transfer, presentation for collection, and deletion - to be carried out electronically, quickly, efficiently, and without paper documentation . This will significantly streamline operations, saving both time and costs for businesses and individuals alike. All data on electronic bills of exchange will be securely stored in CReM as an integral part of the Register of Bills of Exchange and Mandates, which has the legal status of a public register , thereby ensuring full transparency, reliability, and legal certainty in transactions involving electronic bills of exchange. Clients will access CReM via their electronic or mobile banking applications, using a qualified electronic signature (ConsentID application of the IT and eGovernment Office) for signing electronic bills of exchange and carrying out other important actions. For the use of an electronic bill of exchange in court and enforcement proceedings, an excerpt from CReM will serve as a public and credible document issued by the NBS – the NBS clarifies. Pursuant to the NBS decision, the total fees for issuing and using electronic bills of exchange, for both businesses and citizens, will be lower than the current fees charged by banks for paper bills of exchange. – It is expected that bank clients will recognize this advantage, although they will continue to have the option of choosing between electronic and paper bills of exchange, and banks will be obliged to respect that choice – the NBS says. From December 1, 2025, banks will be required to enable the use of electronic bills of exchange for all legal persons and entrepreneurs - their clients - and from end-November 2026, also for citizens. This will complete the process of full digitalization of banking operations involving bills of exchange and eliminate the need to visit a bank for their completion.
