content_it: La Zona Franca di Pirot, nell'ambito della delegazione serba, ha firmato un Memorandum di Cooperazione con quattro parchi industriali cinesi ad alta tecnologia durante l’11° Congresso Annuale della World Free Zones Organization, tenutosi nella città di Haikou, provincia di Hainan. L’accordo è stato siglato con i seguenti parchi: Haikou Jiandong New Area, Haikou Fullsing Internet Industrial Park, Hainan Resort Software Community e Overseas Returnees Town Lingshui. Oltre alla firma del memorandum, sono stati stabiliti numerosi contatti con rappresentanti di zone e istituzioni cinesi, con l’obiettivo di promuovere futuri scambi di esperienze, collaborazioni e investimenti. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la Zona Franca di Pirot è stata una delle sette zone franche e istituzioni internazionali a sottoscrivere tale intesa. Questo accordo apre potenziali opportunità di collaborazione per le imprese italiane nei settori della tecnologia, del software e dello sviluppo industriale avanzato.

title_en: Cooperation agreement signed between chambers of Vojvodina and Istanbul – Potential of Serbian industrial zones, railroads and transport in focus of interest of Turkish business people
title_it: Accordo tra camere di Vojvodina e Istanbul
content_en: Istanbul (Photo: Unsplash/Desert Morocco Adventure) The Cooperation Agreement between the Chamber of Commerce of Vojvodina and the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce was signed today in Istanbul as part of a two-day visit to Turkey by the President of the Provincial Government, Maja Gojkovic, and the President of the Chamber of Commerce of Vojvodina, Vladimir Gak. In addition to the President of the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce, Sekib Avdagic, they also met with Turkish business people, who were presented with the economic and investment potential of the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina. After the meeting with Avdagic, Gojkovic pointed out that Turkish business people had been interested in what Serbia offered in the areas of rail infrastructure, transport, what the potential of Serbia’s industrial zones was, but also what advantages Serbia had compared to global competition. – Turkey is among Serbia’s key partners in the field of investment, with 800 companies present in our country, employing more than 9,600 workers. Although most investments are concentrated in central and southern Serbia, there is growing interest in AP Vojvodina, especially in the sectors of renewable energy, industry and agriculture – Gojkovic stated. According to her, Turkish investments in the province are still in the development phase, but there is potential for rapid growth. – That is why we are here today, to present and offer a favorable business environment, developed infrastructure and qualified workforce – Gojkovic emphasized. Currently, the most represented sectors when it comes to companies with Turkish capital operating in AP Vojvodina are the manufacturing and construction industries, recycling industry and commerce. – Of exceptional importance is also the signing of a contract with a Turkish company for the construction of two solar power plants in Vojvodina. These projects will not only generate clean energy, but also create new jobs in local communities and are also part of a broader trend of Turkish investments in solar and wind projects in Serbia – Gojkovic said. She added that the potential of the AP Vojvodina did not lie only in the economy, highlighting spa tourism as an example of an area in which there was great room for investment and development. Privredna komora Vojvodine Novi Sad Vlada AP Vojvodina Chamber of Commerce of Vojvodina Istanbul Chamber of Commerce Maja Gojkovic Vladimir Gak Sekib Avdagic Your comment Send
content_it:
A Istanbul è stato firmato un accordo di cooperazione tra la Camera di Commercio di Vojvodina e la Camera di Commercio di Istanbul, nell’ambito della visita ufficiale in Turchia della presidente del Governo provinciale di Vojvodina, Maja Gojkovic, accompagnata dal presidente della Camera di Commercio di Vojvodina, Vladimir Gak. Nel corso degli incontri con il presidente della Camera di Istanbul, Sekib Avdagic, e con imprenditori turchi, è stato presentato il potenziale economico e d’investimento della Provincia Autonoma di Vojvodina.

Gojkovic ha evidenziato il forte interesse degli imprenditori turchi per le infrastrutture ferroviarie, il trasporto e le zone industriali serbe, nonché per i vantaggi competitivi offerti dal Paese. “La Turchia è tra i principali partner della Serbia per gli investimenti, con 800 aziende attive sul nostro territorio che danno lavoro a oltre 9.600 persone. Benché gli investimenti siano concentrati prevalentemente nella Serbia centrale e meridionale, cresce l’interesse per la Vojvodina, specialmente nei settori delle energie rinnovabili, dell’industria e dell’agricoltura”, ha dichiarato.

Attualmente, i settori maggiormente rappresentati da capitali turchi in Vojvodina sono l’industria manifatturiera, le costruzioni, il riciclo e il commercio. Di particolare rilievo è la recente firma di un contratto con un’azienda turca per la costruzione di due impianti fotovoltaici, progetti che produrranno energia pulita e creeranno nuovi posti di lavoro. Gojkovic ha inoltre evidenziato il potenziale della regione nel turismo termale, settore con ampie opportunità di sviluppo.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la Serbia offre un ambiente imprenditoriale favorevole, infrastrutture consolidate e manodopera qualificata, elementi che potrebbero interessare anche le imprese italiane attive nei settori dell’energia rinnovabile, dell’industria e delle infrastrutture.

title_en: Tender for construction of wastewater treatment plant in Srpska Crnja to be opened soon
title_it: Nuovo depuratore a Srpska Crnja
content_en: Illustration (Photo: gameanna/shutterstock.com) The Ministry of Economy and the Municipality of Nova Crnja recently signed a contract for the implementation of the project “Construction of a Wastewater Treatment Plant in Srpska Crnja.” The value of the project, as announced, is 552.6 million dinars, and the funds are fully provided from the budget of the Ministry of Economy. The date of the public procurement announcement for the selection of the contractor is November 24, 2025, as can be seen from the previous announcement. After the completion of the legal procedure, the works should, as previously announced, begin by the end of the year, depending on weather conditions. The project is planned to last three years and represents one of the largest infrastructure projects in the history of the municipality. In addition to the construction of the treatment plant, the second phase of the project is also planned - the construction of a fecal sewage system, which will form a single functional unit of the wastewater treatment system in Srpska Crnja. Otherwise, members of the Serbian Government adopted a Conclusion establishing that the Project “Construction of a Wastewater Treatment Plant in Srpska Crnja” is of importance to Serbia, which envisages the construction of a modern plant that will contribute to environmental protection, improving the quality of life and preserving groundwater. Ministarstvo privrede Republike Srbije Opština Nova Crnja Construction of a Wastewater Treatment Plant in Srpska Crnja Wastewater Treatment Plant in Srpska Crnja Your comment Send
content_it: Il Ministero dell’Economia e il Comune di Nova Crnja hanno recentemente firmato il contratto per la realizzazione del progetto “Costruzione di un impianto di depurazione delle acque reflue a Srpska Crnja”. Il valore dell’opera è di 552,6 milioni di dinari, interamente finanziati dal bilancio del Ministero dell’Economia. La gara pubblica per la selezione dell’appaltatore sarà indetta il 24 novembre 2025, secondo quanto anticipato. Al termine delle procedure legali, i lavori dovrebbero iniziare entro la fine dell’anno, salvo condizioni meteorologiche avverse. Il progetto avrà una durata di tre anni e rappresenta uno dei più importanti interventi infrastrutturali nella storia del comune. Oltre alla costruzione del depuratore, è prevista una seconda fase: la realizzazione di una rete fognaria nera, che completerà il sistema di trattamento delle acque reflue di Srpska Crnja. Il Governo serbo ha inoltre adottato una delibera con cui dichiara il progetto di interesse nazionale, sottolineando il suo contributo alla tutela ambientale, al miglioramento della qualità della vita e alla protezione delle falde acquifere. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’iniziativa apre potenziali opportunità per imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture idriche e tecnologie per il trattamento delle acque reflue.

title_en: Novi Sad to build STP 2 – Focus on development of automotive industry, mechatronics and industrial systems
title_it: Nuovo polo tecnologico a Novi Sad
content_en: STP Novi Sad (Photo: Dejan Aleksić) The construction of Science and Technology Park 2 is imminent in Novi Sad, which will be focused on the development of the automotive industry, mechatronics and industrial systems, the Ministry of Science, Technological Development and Innovation announced after a meeting between Minister Bela Balint and Novi Sad Mayor Zarko Micin. As indicated, the existing Science and Technology Park in Novi Sad is the most modern one in the region, and it also houses the Research and Development Institute for Artificial Intelligence of Serbia. – Novi Sad is widely recognized as a modern IT and innovation center and a university city with strong faculties in the field of technical and natural sciences, which represent the basis for the further development of innovation and research in the city. It is also the IT center of the region with more than 900 IT companies, which employ more than 15,000 people – said Micin. The topic of the meeting was the previous cooperation between the ministry and the city of Novi Sad, as well as the prospects for its further improvement in the areas of science and technological development at the local level. Balint assessed that Novi Sad represented an example of good practice in connecting the academic, economic and innovation sectors. Balint also met with representatives of the Science and Technology Park in Novi Sad, where he was presented with the scientific and innovation capacities of that institution, as well as the vision, mission and strategic directions of development, including current and planned activities. At the meeting with representatives of the STP, led by the director, Prof. Srdjan Kolakovic, PhD, it was emphasized that the STP Novi Sad was a unique science and technology park in Serbia, located within the university campus, independently financed and operating exclusively on the market. The members of the park are technology companies, startup companies, teams and research and development institutes. Fotografije: Naučno-tehnološki park Novi Sad d.o.o. Novi Sad Ministarstvo nauke, tehnološkog razvoja i inovacija Republike Srbije Science and Technology Park Novi Sad STP Novi Sad Ministry of Science construction of STP 2 in Novi Sad Bela Balint Žarko Mićin Srđan Kolaković Your comment Send
content_it:
È imminente la costruzione del secondo Parco Scientifico e Tecnologico (STP 2) a Novi Sad, dedicato allo sviluppo dell’industria automotive, della meccatronica e dei sistemi industriali. Lo ha annunciato il Ministero della Scienza, dello Sviluppo Tecnologico e dell’Innovazione dopo un incontro tra la ministra Bela Balint e il sindaco di Novi Sad, Žarko Mićin.  

L’attuale Parco Scientifico e Tecnologico di Novi Sad è considerato il più moderno della regione e ospita l’Istituto serbo per la ricerca e lo sviluppo sull’intelligenza artificiale. “Novi Sad è ampiamente riconosciuta come un centro moderno dell’innovazione e dell’IT, nonché città universitaria con facoltà forti nelle scienze tecniche e naturali, che costituiscono la base per ulteriore sviluppo della ricerca e dell’innovazione”, ha dichiarato Mićin, sottolineando che la città conta oltre 900 aziende IT con più di 15.000 addetti.  

La ministra Balint ha definito Novi Sad un esempio di buona pratica nell’integrazione tra settori accademico, economico e dell’innovazione. Durante un successivo incontro con i rappresentanti dello STP, guidati dal direttore Prof. Srdjan Kolaković, è stato evidenziato che lo STP Novi Sad è unico in Serbia: situato all’interno del campus universitario, è finanziato in modo indipendente e opera esclusivamente sul mercato. Tra i suoi membri figurano aziende tecnologiche, startup, team di ricerca e istituti di sviluppo.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, il nuovo STP 2 rafforzerà ulteriormente l’ecosistema dell’innovazione locale. Tale sviluppo potrebbe offrire opportunità di collaborazione alle imprese italiane attive nei settori automotive, meccatronica e sistemi industriali.

title_en: Chinese companies Techron and Minth Holding arriving to Indjija – Jobs for almost 2,500 people
title_it: Investimenti cinesi a Indjija: 2.500 nuovi posti di lavoro
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Nataliya Hora/shutterstock.com) The Chinese companies Techron and Minth Holding will open factories in Indjija. In the first phase, the construction of the Techron plant on an area of 4,500 square meters is planned, with the employment of 200 workers in the final phase. The company produces car parts for Volkswagen, Porsche, Audi and many others. The opening of the plant is planned for mid-2026, announced the mayor of Indjija, Marko Gasic, for the Novi Sad daily Dnevnik. – They submitted a request for location requirements, and in the next few days they should receive a response from Urban Planning to know within what limits they can build their plant. They have already found a company that will carry out the work for them. They have found a man who will manage the entire business, and he is currently in China undergoing training – said Gasic. The Chinese company Minth Holding will build an electric vehicle factory on 210 hectares of land, with a planned investment worth EUR 870 million and as many as 2,200 new jobs. The Indjija Municipal Assembly also adopted a decision to draft a Detailed Regulation Plan for the Advanced Mobility Center of Serbia, which created formal conditions for the start of one of the largest investments in the history of this city, pointed out Gasic. This investment is part of a broader agreement between the Government of the Republic of Serbia and the Minth Holding company, confirmed by the signing of a memorandum of understanding that paves the way for the construction of a modern production facility in Serbia. The construction of two large substations is also expected, which will double the capacity compared to the ones that Indjija has now. – We have enough electricity for all companies and the population, but the plans are such that they are planned decades in advance and that is what is needed. This is a major investment, where the state will allocate tens of millions of euros, and the work should start next year. We have enough gas capacity, but since plans are made in advance, we will certainly need a large gas station. The construction of a new gas station has been agreed with Srbijagas and we are also working on that – says Gasic. Techron Automotive doo Beograd Minth automotive Europe doo Loznica Techron Minth Holding opening of Mintha and Techron facilities in Indjija Your comment Send
content_it:
Le aziende cinesi Techron e Minth Holding avvieranno nuove produzioni a Indjija, in Serbia. La prima costruirà uno stabilimento su un’area di 4.500 metri quadrati, impiegando 200 persone nella fase finale; la struttura, che produrrà componenti per Volkswagen, Porsche, Audi e altri costruttori, dovrebbe aprire a metà 2026. Il sindaco di Indjija, Marko Gasic, ha riferito al quotidiano Dnevnik di Novi Sad che la società ha già individuato l’impresa per i lavori e il futuro responsabile dello stabilimento, attualmente in formazione in Cina.

Minth Holding, invece, investirà 870 milioni di euro nella costruzione di una fabbrica per veicoli elettrici su 210 ettari, creando 2.200 nuovi posti di lavoro. L’Assemblea comunale ha approvato il Piano Regolatore Dettagliato per il Centro Avanzato per la Mobilità in Serbia, creando le condizioni formali per uno dei più grandi investimenti nella storia della città. L’iniziativa rientra in un accordo tra il Governo serbo e Minth Holding, sancito da un memorandum d’intesa.

In parallelo, sono previsti lavori infrastrutturali significativi: saranno costruite due nuove sottostazioni elettriche, raddoppiando la capacità attuale, e una nuova stazione di gas, già concordata con Srbijagas. Come riportato da ekapija.com, queste opere anticipano esigenze energetiche future e supportano l’arrivo di grandi investimenti industriali. L’opportunità rappresenta un potenziale intersettoriale per aziende italiane attive nei settori delle infrastrutture energetiche, dei macchinari industriali e della componentistica automotive.

title_en: Australian Middle Island already drilling on Bobija: “There is as much gold and silver in the old barite mine as in Vares”
title_it: Middle Island punta sull'oro a Bobija
content_en: Former barite mine in Bobija (Photo: eKapija / Aleksandra Kekić) The Australian mining company Middle Island Resources (MDI), which last month became the owner of 14 licenses for mineral exploration in Serbia on as much as 62,000 hectares , has already started drilling in search of gold and other valuable metals. The company announced that it had started the first drilling program on the Bobija mountain near Ljubovija, using the reverse circulation method. Let us remind that MDI announced in September that it had concluded a binding share purchase agreement through which it acquired 100% ownership of the Australian company Konstantin Resources Limited, the owner of exploration licenses in Serbia that include three main project areas - Bobija, Priboj and Timok. The Bobija project, which the new owner announced that it would focus on first, covers a total of 20,800 hectares and is located only about 100 km southwest of Belgrade. This is a former barite mine, in whose open pit previous research has shown significant quantities of gold, and the project includes three issued exploration permits - Bobija, Bobija Istok and Kamenita Kosa - as well as an application for Orovica and a ten-year option for two mining licenses of the local company Bobija doo Ljubovija. – We are pleased to commence the maiden drilling program at Bobija, one of the key projects in Konstantin’s Serbian portfolio. The Bobija deposit is an under-explored, high-grade, polymetallic deposit with promising, near-surface drilling and rock chip results, is located within a granted mining lease, and is surrounded by a substantial, poorly-tested exploration tenure – stated MDI Non-Executive Director, Daniel Raihani. MDI says that they consider that the Bobija deposit is an analogue for the Vares polymetallic mine in Bosnia and Herzegovina, which was recently acquired by Dundee Precious Metals in a USD 1.25 billion cash-and-stock deal and which contains an estimated 20.9 million tons of ore. Konstantin Resources’ exploration at Bobija found 5.24 g/t gold and 120 g/t silver, along with 4.66% zinc and 4.36% lead in samples, with mineralization visible even at the bottom of the barite pit itself, as well as in the surface rocks. Middle Island has already completed channel sampling at the Bobija mine, and the Phase 1 drilling program, which includes up to 800 meters of drilling, with an average depth of 80 meters per hole, aims to assess the gold, silver, copper, lead and zinc content of the mineralization at the bottom of the open pit. MDI also expects to intersect significant intervals of barite mineralization. Drillex International d.o.o. from Bor has been appointed to conduct the drilling program at the Bobija Polymetallic Project located in Western Serbia. Drillex mobilized a track-mounted reverse circulation (RC) drill rig to the site and drilling has now commenced. B. P. Konstantin Resources doo Beograd Drillex International d.o.o. Bor Middle Island Resources MDI Konstantin Resources Limited Drillex International doo  Bor Bobija Tornička Bobija mining project Bobija barite mine Bobija exploratory drilling Your comment Send
content_it:
La società mineraria australiana Middle Island Resources (MDI), che lo scorso mese ha acquisito 14 licenze per l’esplorazione mineraria in Serbia su circa 62.000 ettari, ha già avviato perforazioni alla ricerca di oro e altri metalli preziosi. L’azienda ha annunciato l’avvio del primo programma di perforazione sul monte Bobija, presso Ljubovija, utilizzando il metodo a circolazione inversa. Il progetto Bobija, su cui MDI concentrerà inizialmente gli sforzi, copre 20.800 ettari a circa 100 km a sudovest di Belgrado ed è una ex miniera di barite dove studi precedenti avevano rilevato significative quantità d’oro. Il progetto include tre permessi esplorativi già rilasciati – Bobija, Bobija Istok e Kamenita Kosa – oltre a una richiesta per Orovica e un’opzione decennale su due licenze minerarie della locale Bobija doo Ljubovija.  

Daniel Raihani, consigliere non esecutivo di MDI, ha dichiarato: “Siamo lieti di avviare il primo programma di perforazione a Bobija, uno dei progetti chiave del portafoglio serbo di Konstantin. Il giacimento è un deposito polimetallico ad alto tenore, poco esplorato, con risultati promettenti in superficie, situato all’interno di una concessione mineraria valida e circondato da ampie aree esplorative ancora poco testate”.  

MDI ritiene che il giacimento di Bobija sia analogo alla miniera polimetallica di Vares, in Bosnia ed Erzegovina, recentemente acquisita da Dundee Precious Metals per 1,25 miliardi di dollari e contenente circa 20,9 milioni di tonnellate di minerale. Le esplorazioni di Konstantin Resources a Bobija hanno rilevato 5,24 g/t di oro, 120 g/t di argento, oltre a 4,66% di zinco e 4,36% di piombo nei campioni, con mineralizzazioni visibili anche sul fondo della cava di barite e nelle rocce superficiali.  

Middle Island ha già completato il campionamento a canale e avviato un programma di perforazione di Fase 1, fino a 800 metri complessivi con una profondità media di 80 metri per foro, per valutare i contenuti di oro, argento, rame, piombo e zinco. È previsto inoltre di intercettare significativi intervalli di mineralizzazione di barite. Le perforazioni sono eseguite da Drillex International d.o.o. di Bor, che ha trasportato sul sito un impianto a circolazione inversa.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’operazione rientra nella strategia di espansione di MDI nei Balcani. Per le imprese italiane attive nel settore delle macchine per l’estrazione mineraria o nei servizi tecnici connessi, questa attività apre potenziali opportunità di collaborazione con fornitori locali o internazionali coinvolti nel progetto.

title_en: Toyo Tires to build Innovation Center in Indjija – Experimental tire production on 6,000 m2
title_it: Toyo Tires inaugura centro innovazione a Indjija
content_en: (Photo: North Engineering) Based on the request of the investor Toyo Tires Serbia, an Urban Design Project was developed for the construction of an Innovation Center within the company’s industrial complex in Indjija. The project was developed by the Kubarch company from Subotica, while the architectural designer was the North Engineering company. According to the documentation, the new Innovation Center will be a specialized organizational unit of the Toyo Tires company intended for research, development and improvement of processes in the production of automobile tires . The goal of this center is to develop new and improved production solutions, which will further increase the competitiveness, efficiency and sustainability of the factory. The facility will cover an area of about 6,000 m², partly on two floors and partly on one. The center will include experimental spaces for small-scale tire production, laboratories for material testing, offices for data analysis and processing, as well as space for presentations and employee training. As stated, tire production at the center will be carried out once a week, for six hours, while the total production capacity of the factory is not expected to increase. The facility will employ around 20 employees, and occasionally presentations of results and training for up to 60 guests will be organized. Let us remind that, during a visit to the Japanese Toyo Tires factory in Indjija, President of the Provincial Government Maja Gojkovic announced plans to build a science and technology development center that would connect the factory with universities . She added that the details of the project would be discussed during the upcoming visit of the Provincial Government delegation to the company’s headquarters in Japan. The Toyo Tires factory in Indjija currently employs 671 workers and plans to produce 3.2 million tires this year, mostly for export to the American market. I. Z. Opis: Objekat će se prostirati na oko 6.000 m?, delom na dva, a delom na jednom spratu. U okviru centra predviđeni su eksperimentalni prostori za proizvodnju gume u manjem obimu, laboratorije za ispitivanje materijala, kancelarije za analizu i obradu podataka, kao i prostor za prezentacije i obuku zaposlenih. Kako je navedeno, proizvodnja gume u centru obavljaće se jednom nedeljno, u trajanju od šest sati, dok se ne očekuje povećanje ukupnog proizvodnog kapaciteta fabrike. U objektu će raditi oko 20 zaposlenih, a povremeno će se organizovati prezentacije rezultata i obuke za do 60 gostiju. (2025) Vidi sve Toyo Tire Serbia d.o.o. Inđija Kubarch doo Subotica North Engineering d.o.o. Subotica Toyo Tires Srbija Kubarch doo Subotica North Engineering doo Innovation Center Your comment Send
content_it: Su richiesta dell’investitore Toyo Tires Serbia, è stato redatto un progetto di urbanistica per la costruzione di un Innovation Center all’interno del complesso industriale dell’azienda a Indjija. Il progetto è stato sviluppato dalla società Kubarch di Subotica, con North Engineering quale progettista architettonico. Il nuovo centro costituirà un’unità organizzativa specializzata dedicata alla ricerca, sviluppo e ottimizzazione dei processi produttivi di pneumatici per autovetture, con l’obiettivo di migliorare competitività, efficienza e sostenibilità dello stabilimento. La struttura si estenderà su circa 6.000 m², in parte su due piani e in parte su un piano, e comprenderà aree sperimentali per la produzione in piccola scala di pneumatici, laboratori per il collaudo dei materiali, uffici per l’analisi dati e spazi per presentazioni e formazione del personale. La produzione sperimentale avverrà una volta alla settimana per sei ore, senza incremento della capacità produttiva complessiva. Il centro impiegherà circa 20 dipendenti e potrà ospitare fino a 60 partecipanti per presentazioni e corsi di formazione. Come riportato da ekapija.com, durante una visita allo stabilimento giapponese di Indjija, la presidente del Governo provinciale Maja Gojkovic aveva annunciato la creazione di un centro di sviluppo scientifico e tecnologico per collegare la fabbrica con le università. Lo stabilimento di Indjija impiega attualmente 671 lavoratori e prevede di produrre 3,2 milioni di pneumatici nel 2025, prevalentemente destinati al mercato statunitense. La realizzazione di questo centro offre opportunità alle imprese italiane operanti nel settore delle macchine per l’industria della gomma e della plastica, nonché nei servizi di consulenza tecnica e ricerca applicata.
sector: Macchine per la lavorazione della gomma e della plastica

title_en: Glenn Howlles, founder of Howells: Riverside is transforming Novi Sad through sustainable urbanism and modern architecture
title_it: Riverside: Novi Sad verso un'urbanistica sostenibile
content_en: Aleksandar Group company presented a new real estate project, backed by the renowned London architectural firms Howells and LDA, in collaboration with JP Urbanizam Novi Sad. The "Riverside" project in Novi Sad aims to transform the former industrial zone into a modern urban area, which will enrich the environment and the citizens’ daily life. In a conversation with the architect on the project and the founder of the Howells company, Glenn Howlles, we learn more about his vision for the "Riverside" project in Novi Sad, the challenges of transforming industrial zones, and how this project fits into global urban trends.. How do you see the importance of the Riverside project for Novi Sad, not only in terms of architecture, but also in the context of urban life? - Riverside is not just another construction project, more an invitation to live by the river, in an environment that combines functionality, openness and beauty. Novi Sad is a city with extraordinary potential, and a project like this is an opportunity to transform that potential into  urban space which encourages togetherness, inclusiveness and new dynamics in the daily life of citizens. With an investment worth EUR 150 million, the project includes the construction of 70,000 m2, 80% of which are residential, while the remaining 20% will be commercial units. Besides, one of the project`s special qualities is that Novi Sad will get a new urban part of the city with play and leisure facilities, including two large public squares, a pedestrian street and new cultural, commercial and sports facilities, including kindergartens for the youngest. Our goal is to create a space where everyone has direct access to the river, which further connects urban development with the natural environment. How did you approach the master planning of a former industrial zone in a regional context? - Our approach to master planning always starts with the people. We work in London, Birmingham and other cities in the UK which have undergone similar transformations, where we transformed post-industrial spaces into vibrant districts. We apply the same principles in Novi Sad: integration with natural resources such as the river, reliance on pedestrian and bicycle paths, by creating public squares and cultural points, and above all with great attention to the local context. "Riverside" is a project that will contribute to creating new public amenities that were lacking in this part of the city. By opening up the river bank through pedestrian and bicycle connections, greener public areas and better walkability of the space, "Riverside" is expected to bring significant, measurable improvements in the health, well-being and quality of daily life of the residents of Novi Sad, but also to visitors and commuters. (Photo: Aleksandar Group) Which project elements are most in line with contemporary urban trends? - These are primarily the opening of the city to the river, creating public areas truly accessible to all, then multifunctionality, which implies housing, recreation, work and culture all combined in one place. In addition, green infrastructure is being invested in – parks, sports grounds, children`s facilities, and even padel. Within the complex, Aleksandar Group also secured a donation of 100 million dinars for the improvement of sports facilities, including an outdoor gym, park furniture and football, basketball and volleyball courts. Also, over one hectare of land will be provided for green areas that will be expanded and preserved, making this project truly special and in accordance with the best world practices in urban planning. Your studio is famous for projects such as London City Island, Royal Wharf, Paradise in Birmingham. How does Novi Sad fit in that map? - Riverside has everything that large urban projects require, and that is a clear identity, a strong location, and the ambition to be relevant in the long term. I see it as a project that is on par with our works in London, not in size, but in its potential to change the way people perceive their city. Novi Sad, even though smaller than London or Birmingham, has exceptional resources that enable the creation of such an urban district. In cooperation with JP Urbanizam Novi Sad and other local partners, we want to create a space that not only meets contemporary urban needs, but also contributes to creating a better quality of life for all its residents. What do you consider the biggest challenge, and what is the most beautiful part of working on this project? - The biggest challenge was how to transform the current site into a functional and modern urban entity that will harmoniously fit into Novi Sad, providing new value to the community and creating room for the future growth and development of the city. And the most beautiful part, certainly, is the feeling of working on a project that has the potential to enrich people`s daily lives. With larger public areas, sports and cultural content, we create an environment that is not only economically functional, but also socially relevant. It`s a responsibility, but also a privilege – to create a place that will contribute to the quality of life in the long term. Finally, what does "architecture of the future" mean for you? - I believe that the architecture of the future strives for less formal expressiveness, but more to long-term sustainability and social relevance. It is an architecture that does not spend, but gives back and which does not divide, but rather connects. The project in Novi Sad was designed precisely in that spirit, as an inclusive urban entity that combines natural and built, private and public, local heritage and contemporary needs. We believe that this area will become the new gravitational core of a healthier, more connected lifestyle along the river.. Aleksandar gradnja d.o.o. content_it: Il gruppo Aleksandar ha presentato a Novi Sad il progetto immobiliare “Riverside”, realizzato con il supporto degli studi londinesi Howells e LDA Design e in collaborazione con JP Urbanizam Novi Sad. L’iniziativa punta a trasformare un’ex area industriale in un moderno quartiere urbano, con un investimento di 150 milioni di euro per 70.000 m² di superficie, di cui l’80% residenziale e il 20% commerciale. Il progetto prevede due grandi piazze pubbliche, una via pedonale, servizi culturali, commerciali e sportivi, nonché asili nido. Particolare attenzione è riservata alla riqualificazione della sponda del fiume, con percorsi pedonali e ciclabili, aree verdi e spazi accessibili a tutti. Sono inoltre inclusi oltre un ettaro di aree verdi, un centro sportivo all’aperto e campi polivalenti, grazie anche a una donazione di 100 milioni di dinari da parte del Gruppo Aleksandar. Glenn Howells, fondatore dello studio Howells, sottolinea che “Riverside” mira a creare un ambiente inclusivo che unisca natura e urbanità, ispirandosi alle migliori pratiche internazionali di rigenerazione urbana, come nei progetti londinesi City Island e Royal Wharf. Secondo Howells, il progetto ha il potenziale di ridefinire la percezione della città da parte dei cittadini, migliorandone benessere, salute e qualità della vita quotidiana. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’architettura del futuro, secondo lo studio, privilegia la sostenibilità a lungo termine e la rilevanza sociale rispetto all’espressività formale. Per le imprese italiane attive nei settori dell’architettura, dell’urbanistica, delle infrastrutture verdi e della rigenerazione urbana, il progetto rappresenta un’opportunità di collaborazione in un mercato in espansione allineato alle tendenze europee.

title_en: Floors that shape space: Combination of functionality, aesthetics and responsibility
title_it: Pavimenti sostenibili per spazi moderni
content_en: (Photo: Tarkett) Each space has its own rhythm, energy and purpose, and the floor is what connects them all. In modern business and residential environments, where aesthetics, functionality and sustainability increasingly intertwine, the right choice of floor becomes a strategic decision. As a company with a long tradition and strong presence through the retail network, Galerija Podova understands the needs of the modern market — from investors and designers to end users. Each space requires a different solution, and experience shows that the best results are achieved when technology, design and a responsible attitude towards resources meet in the same place. The focus is on floor coverings that combine durability, aesthetics and easy maintenance, respecting the principles of sustainable construction — LVT and SPC, new generation laminate and parquet. LVT and SPC – technology that changes space (Photo: Tarkett) Contemporay Tarkett LVT and SPC floors represent a fusion of advancen technology and sophisticated design. Their resistance to wear, moisture and temperature changes makes them ideal for high-frequency areas - offices, bars, public facilities. Advanced materials enable a long service life and minimal need for replacement, which directly contributes to lower resource consumption and, therefore, a lower impact on the environment. They are very suitable for quick renovations and installation over the existing floor. Thanks to realistic patterns that faithfully depict natural materials, these floors combine the experience of nature through the appearance of wood and stone with sustainable performance and ease of recycling. Laminate - a modern classic with a new look (Photo: Galerija podova) T oday, laminate is much more than a practical solution. Thanks to new processing technologies and a wealth of formats, it brings the warmth of wood and a variety of decor — from longer and wider boards that give the space a sense of calm, to a dynamic "herringbone" that brings character and rhythm. Waterproof and wear-resistant, modern laminates are ideal for offices, business and residential spaces where a balance between aesthetics, functionality and easy maintenance is sought. And in addition to all that, they are suitable for underfloor heating. Parquet - natural elegance at the service of sustainable luxury (Photo: Tarkett) Wood remains a timeless material, and today`s Tarkett parquets combine natural beauty with technological improvements. The three-layer construction of the boards allows for a more efficient use of wood, a greater degree of stability and a longer product life cycle. Innovative finishing layers preserve the natural texture of the wood and reduce the need for frequent renewal, while the different dimensions of the slats and planks allow for a perfect fit in any space. A longer lamella opens up the space and gives it airiness, while smaller formats create rhythm and warmth. That`s why parquet remains the first choice for representative spaces and interiors with high aesthetic standards, but also a symbol of sustainable luxury: natural, durable and renewable. Whether it is about large business complexes, residential buildings or individual projects, Galerija Podova offers a " turnkey" system - from advice and selection of materials, through delivery, to professional installation and finishing works. Such an approach brings predictability, quality and time saving, and enables responsible planning - because a good choice today means fewer interventions tomorrow. The floor is much more than a functional surface — it is part of the identity of the space, a mirror of the values ​​and philosophy of construction. LVT and SPC bring technical stability and longevity, laminate combines aesthetics and practicality, and parquet brings natural warmth and sustainability. Through its experience, expertise and commitment to quality, Galerija Podova remains a trusted partner to all those who build spaces of the future - those that last, inspire and contribute to a more responsible attitude towards the world we share. Ogni ambiente possiede un proprio ritmo, energia e destinazione d’uso, e il pavimento è l’elemento che li unisce tutti. Negli ambienti residenziali e commerciali contemporanei, dove estetica, funzionalità e sostenibilità si intrecciano sempre più, la scelta del pavimento diventa una decisione strategica. Galerija Podova, azienda con solida tradizione e ampia presenza nella rete retail, comprende appieno le esigenze del mercato moderno – dagli investitori e progettisti agli utenti finali. Le soluzioni più efficaci nascono dall’incontro tra tecnologia, design e un approccio responsabile alle risorse.

Particolare attenzione è rivolta a rivestimenti che uniscono durabilità, estetica e facilità di manutenzione, in linea con i principi dell’edilizia sostenibile: LVT e SPC, laminati di nuova generazione e parquet. I pavimenti LVT e SPC di Tarkett combinano tecnologia avanzata e design raffinato, con eccellente resistenza all’usura, all’umidità e agli sbalzi termici, risultando ideali per uffici, locali e strutture pubbliche ad alto traffico. La loro lunga durata riduce il consumo di risorse e l’impatto ambientale, e permettono una posa rapida anche su pavimentazioni esistenti, replicando in modo realistico l’aspetto del legno e della pietra.

Il laminato moderno, grazie a nuove tecnologie e formati diversificati – dalle doghe lunghe e larghe all’effetto “spina di pesce” – offre calore e personalità agli spazi, mantenendo caratteristiche di impermeabilità, resistenza e compatibilità con il riscaldamento a pavimento.

Il parquet Tarkett, invece, coniuga eleganza naturale e innovazione: la struttura a tre strati ottimizza l’uso del legno, garantisce stabilità e prolunga la vita del prodotto. Finiture avanzate preservano la texture naturale del legno, riducendo la necessità di interventi di manutenzione.

Galerija Podova offre un servizio chiavi in mano – dalla consulenza alla posa – assicurando qualità, risparmio di tempo e pianificazione responsabile. Il pavimento non è solo una superficie funzionale, ma espressione dell’identità dello spazio e dei valori di chi lo progetta. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’azienda si conferma partner affidabile per chi realizza ambienti destinati a durare, ispirare e promuovere una visione sostenibile.

Le soluzioni presentate offrono opportunità interessanti per le aziende italiane operanti nel settore dei materiali per l’edilizia, dell’interior design e della distribuzione specializzata, in un mercato sempre più orientato verso prodotti durevoli, esteticamente ricercati e ambientalmente responsabili.

title_en: Marina Dorćol brings life back to the banks of the Danube
title_it: Marina Dorćol rinnova il fronte del Danubio
content_en: (Photo: SEBRE) The true value of real estate lies in what never fades: a central location, a view, and distinctive architecture Everyone already knows about Marina Dorćol – one of the most recognizable examples of contemporary architecture in Belgrade. But today, we’re not focusing on where it’s located — we’re focusing on what it truly means for Lower Dorćol and for our city. On the site of the former power plant, in the heart of old Dorćol, a new urban hub is taking shape — one that connects the spirit of historic Belgrade with the rhythm of modern living. With a new public promenade, landscaped courtyards, and tree-lined streets, Marina Dorćol is not only transforming the appearance of this part of the city — it is creating a new local center of Lower Dorćol that, thanks to its open public spaces, parks, and amenities, will become a place all Belgrade residents will love to visit. An Investment That Brings Security and Long-Term Value Construction of the project’s first phase is in line with the schedule, and Marina Dorćol has become the choice of those seeking for both - a home for their family and a secure investment in the future. The architectural signature of Fiala+Kuzmanović brings a unique design defined by wave-like building forms, while apartments with private gardens and spacious terraces provide the comfort and feeling of living in a house — just minutes away from the city center. (Photo: SEBRE) The focus is on quality, comfort, and energy efficiency : ceilings as high as 2.9 meters, parking spaces up to 2.9 meters wide suitable even for the largest SUV models, and geothermal heating and cooling systems that ensure complete independence of each unit. Thanks to air filtration and heat recovery systems, along with a four-pipe heating and cooling system, residents can freely choose between heating and cooling modes throughout the year — achieving significant energy savings and a healthier living environment. Quality That Lasts Marina Dorćol exemplifies how architecture and nature can shape together a modern way of living. Through the use of durable materials, sustainable technologies and carefully designed spaces, the project brings long-term value and a distinctive aesthetic character to this part of Belgrade. Innovative VR Experience in the Sales Pavilion In line with its innovative spirit, Marina Dorćol introduces the first VR experience of its kind on the local real estate market . At the Belgrade sales pavilion, visitors can “take a walk through” the future neighborhood, explore the interiors of the apartments, and experience the ambiance of the green areas — all through immersive virtual reality. (Photo: SEBRE) Visits are scheduled in advance so that the sales team can dedicate full attention to each visitor and help them find their ideal home. For many buyers, this VR presentation has been the defining moment in recognizing the true value of the project and choosing their new home at Marina Dorćol. (Foto: SEBRE) Il vero valore immobiliare risiede in ciò che non tramonta mai: posizione centrale, vista privilegiata e architettura distintiva. Marina Dorćol, uno dei più noti esempi di architettura contemporanea a Belgrado, sta ridefinendo il quartiere di Dorćol inferiore, trasformandolo in un nuovo polo urbano. Sorto sul sito dell’ex centrale elettrica nel cuore storico di Dorćol, il progetto unisce lo spirito della Belgrado storica con il ritmo della vita moderna.  

Grazie a una nuova passeggiata pubblica, cortili verdi e vie alberate, Marina Dorćol non solo rinnova l’aspetto urbano, ma crea un centro vitale aperto a tutti i cittadini, con parchi e servizi di qualità.  

La prima fase dei lavori procede secondo i tempi previsti e si conferma una scelta sia per chi cerca una casa per la propria famiglia, sia per chi punta su un investimento sicuro e duraturo. Il progetto, firmato dallo studio Fiala+Kuzmanović, presenta forme sinuose e appartamenti con giardini privati e ampie terrazze, offrendo il comfort di una villa a pochi minuti dal centro città.  

L’attenzione è rivolta a qualità, comfort ed efficienza energetica: soffitti alti fino a 2,9 metri, posti auto larghi fino a 2,9 metri, adatti anche ai SUV più grandi, e sistemi geotermici per riscaldamento e raffrescamento indipendenti per ogni unità. Filtri per l’aria, recupero del calore e un sistema a quattro tubi permettono di scegliere liberamente tra riscaldamento e raffrescamento, garantendo risparmi energetici e un ambiente salubre.  

Marina Dorćol dimostra come architettura e natura possano plasmare un nuovo stile di vita urbano, combinando materiali durevoli, tecnologie sostenibili e spazi pensati con cura.  

Innovativo anche l’approccio commerciale: il padiglione vendite a Belgrado offre la prima esperienza di realtà virtuale sul mercato immobiliare serbo. I visitatori possono esplorare in anticipo gli interni e gli spazi verdi del futuro complesso, facilitando la scelta dell’abitazione ideale. Le visite sono su prenotazione per garantire assistenza personalizzata.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, il progetto rappresenta un’opportunità di collaborazione per imprese italiane specializzate in edilizia sostenibile, tecnologie per l’efficienza energetica e design urbano di alta qualità.

title_en: All Season Divčibare - Perfect combination of Nature, Luxury and Safe Return on Investment
title_it: All Season Divčibare: natura, lusso e investimento sicuro
content_en: (Photo: All Season Divčibare) On the slopes of Mount Maljen, at an average altitude of 980 m above sea level, All Season is born - a unique residential and tourist complex in the heart of untouched nature of Divčibare. Only 110 km from Belgrade and 180 km from Novi Sad, this mountain retreat offers a perfect balance between luxury, nature and investment potential.. Known for its mild mountain climate, clean air and a large number of sunny days throughout the year, Divčibare has always been recognized as an ideal vacation destination. The construction of the All Season complex , carefully designed to provide a luxurious and comfortable experience throughout the year, ushers this mountain center into a completely new phase of development. Located in a prime location, with rich facilities for all generations, excellent traffic connections and in the immediate vicinity of the ski slopes, the village center, hotels and all key facilities, All Season represents a unique opportunity for safe and profitable investment, and Divčibare is increasingly asserting itself as a new attractive investment destination in Serbia. (Photo: All Season Divčibare) An oasis in the heart of Divčibare The All Season complex is being built on a 2.4-hectare plot of land covered with evergreen forest, in the most beautiful part of Divčibare. The complex consists of five buildings, whose architecture fits harmoniously into the natural environment, and whose position is such that most apartments have a view of the river and lake. A third of the plot remains under the forest, preserving the authentic ambience, while the project borders state forests with the status of a protected natural asset – creating a true mountain oasis out of it. We offer apartments from 25 to 67 m², with different structures and orientations - from comfortable studio apartments to spacious two-and-a-half-bedroom units . The construction of the complex takes place in several phases, and the completion of the first phase (objects B3, B4 and B5) is planned for December 2026. Works on building B5 are already in an advanced stage, while preparatory works have started on B3 and B4. Content that makes a difference All Season is much more than an apartment complex - it is a carefully designed community that provides everything necessary for modern, relaxed and quality mountain living. Every detail of the project has been designed to combine comfort, nature and a modern lifestyle, creating a unique experience of living all year round. With a warm welcome for every guest and owner, the reception ensures total security, comfort and hotel level service, with professional staff available at all times. Nestled in the greenery, the park within the forest will have a promenade with benches and furniture, a modern children`s playground and an adventure park through which the picturesque Čalački stream flows - a perfect place for rest, recreation and family moments. Modern SPA & Wellness center, equipped with bio, Turkish and infrared sauna, hammam, massage rooms and areas for facial and body treatments. This exclusive zone of peace and relaxation is an ideal haven for complete refreshment of mind and body. Spacious pools with special water effects provide moments of relaxation, fun and enjoyment for all generations - whether it`s a family weekend or an extended stay. Designed in a contemporary mountain style, the multifunctional congress hall offers an ideal space for business events, seminars and conferences, with an inspiring view of nature that boosts creativity and productivity. In the warm and elegant ambience of the restaurant and cafeteria , guests can enjoy carefully selected dishes of local and international cuisine, along with an authentic gastronomic experience and a view of the untouched nature. The investors paid special attention to the creation of content for the youngest, so the All Season complex will also have a children`s playroom designed with a lot of care and love. In it, the little ones will be able to freely explore, dream, play and create memories, while parents enjoy the peace and silence of the mountains. (Photo: All Season Divčibare) Investment potential Buying an apartment in the All Season project represents an exceptional investment opportunity with an excellent return on investment (ROI). The location, contents and concept distinguish this complex as one of the most promising projects in Divčibare For owners who opt for the rental model via the reception desk, standardized furnishing of apartments, professional management and maintenance, and a complete system of daily issuing according to the hotel principle will be ensured . Thus, investors enjoy constant income, while the buildings retain their high value and attractiveness for the market. Apartment structure and prices In the current offer, in building B5, there are studio apartments with an area of ​​25 to 32 m², then one-and-a-half-room apartments of 56 to 67 m² , and two-and-a-half-room apartments with an area of ​​56 to 67 m² . Prices in the pre-sale phase range from EUR 1,990 + VAT to EUR 2,230 + VAT per square meter, depending on the position in the building. Special discounts are available to buyers for advance payments and the possibility of purchasing through a housing loan. (Photo: All Season Divčibare) Flexible payment dynamics The purchase of apartments within the All Season project is made possible through carefully designed and transparent payment dynamics, adapted to the needs of investors and buyers. Payment is made in several stages, according to the progress of the construction. Special discounts are provided for customers who decide to pay in advance, while with a 30% down payment, it is also possible to purchase through a home loan. This payment model makes investing in All Season safe, predictable and adaptable to different investment plans. Why invest in All Season? Exceptional location - peace, nature and proximity to ski slopes; Luxurious amenities for all generations; Professional management and passive income possibility; Excellent price, quality and potential earnings ratio; Steady growth of the real estate market in Divčibare. If you would like more information about the complex itself, but also about the availability of the units, you can book an project presentation appointment at the company`s premises either in Belgrade - Kula West, Omladinskih brigada 86, or in the sales hall at Divčibare, Poručnika Savičića i Radića bb. Also, you can visit the website www.allseasondivcibare.rs , write to prodaja@allseasondivcibare.rs , or call +381 69 611 555. Sulle pendici del Monte Maljen, a un’altitudine media di 980 metri sul livello del mare, sorge All Season, un complesso residenziale e turistico unico nel cuore della natura incontaminata di Divčibare, a soli 110 km da Belgrado e 180 km da Novi Sad. Il progetto, attualmente in costruzione su un’area di 2,4 ettari ricoperta da foresta sempreverde, comprende cinque edifici la cui architettura si integra armoniosamente con l’ambiente naturale. Un terzo dell’area resterà boschiva, preservando l’autentico carattere del luogo e confinando con foreste statali protette.

Il complesso offrirà appartamenti da 25 a 67 m² — monolocali, bilocali e trilocali — con consegna della prima fase (edifici B3, B4 e B5) prevista per dicembre 2026. Le opere per l’edificio B5 sono già avanzate, mentre sono iniziate le attività preliminari per B3 e B4.

All Season non è solo un complesso abitativo, ma una comunità pensata per offrire comfort, servizi di livello alberghiero e attività per tutte le età: parco con area giochi, centro SPA & Wellness con saune, hammam e massaggi, piscine, ristorante con cucina locale e internazionale, e una sala congressi in stile montano contemporaneo. È prevista anche una sala giochi dedicata ai bambini.

L’acquisto di un appartamento rappresenta un’opportunità di investimento con un solido ritorno economico. Per chi sceglie il modello di locazione gestito dalla reception, sono garantiti arredi standardizzati, manutenzione professionale e gestione alberghiera. I prezzi in fase di pre-vendita vanno da 1.990 a 2.230 euro/m² più IVA, con sconti per pagamenti anticipati e possibilità di finanziamento con mutuo al 30% di anticipo.

Divčibare si sta affermando sempre più come destinazione immobiliare di pregio in Serbia, grazie alla sua posizione strategica, al clima mite e alla crescente domanda turistica. Come riportato da ekapija.com, il progetto All Season unisce natura, lusso e redditività, offrendo un’occasione interessante per investitori italiani attivi nel settore immobiliare turistico o alla ricerca di opportunità in mercati emergenti nei Balcani.

title_en: From Naval base to creative hub: Vero & Versa redefine waterfront living
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: (Photo: Porto Montenegro) Porto Montenegro , the Adriatic’s leading luxury waterfront destination, unveils its next evolution with Vero & Versa Residences : two visionary developments that fuse lifestyle, wellness, culture, and creativity. This new concept introduces 202 design-led homes that celebrate human-scale living and contemporary community. At the heart of Porto Montenegro’s 25-acre walkable neighbourhood, Vero & Versa sit within the destination’s expanding cultural district, where everything from international schools and gourmet dining to wellness centres and waterfront cafés is within steps. "Vero and Versa are situated right at the heart of it all," says David Margason , Managing Director of Porto Montenegro. "They respond to how people want to live today, with connection, purpose, and luxuriantly verdant spaces for reflection and engagement." VERO: THE DYNAMIC HEART Vero embodies the vibrant side of Porto Montenegro. The larger of the two buildings, it features 155 residences defined by clean architectural lines, generous balconies, and lush views. Four private entrances lead to a central reception, gym, and landscaped podium pool deck. At street level, 16 flexible spaces host creative studios, boutique retail, artisanal dining, and independent fashion brands: creating a lively, expressive neighbourhood. Vero captures the energy of modern Adriatic living, designed for those who thrive on connection and creativity. (Photo: Porto Montenegro) VERSA: THE TRANQUIL COUNTERPART In contrast, Versa offers an intimate retreat of 47 residences designed around calm, clarity, and wellness. With natural materials, open layouts, and abundant light, Versa features a rooftop pool , a first-floor gym , and a ground-floor wellness clinic . It is a sanctuary for reflection, the serene complement to Vero’s outward-facing dynamism. Together, Vero & Versa form an architectural dialogue: one extroverted and energetic , the other introspective and restorative , a perfect balance for modern living. LIFESTYLE AND DESIGN Life at Vero & Versa revolves around balance and wellbeing. Residents enjoy rooftop and podium-level pools, gyms, wellness spaces, and landscaped communal areas. Interiors showcase natural textures, bespoke furnishings, and generous terraces, with Manor Interior Design packages for a personalised touch. The neighbourhood buzzes with artisan-led dining, open-air film nights, pop-up exhibitions, and live music, reinforcing Porto Montenegro’s reputation as a year-round creative hub. Porto Montenegro’s track record of sold-out developments, including Boka Place , underlines buyer confidence across 40+ nationalities. Sustainability remains a cornerstone. title_en: Peace as a luxury of the future - Why do cities need an "architecture of silence"?
title_it: L'architettura del silenzio nelle città
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Snowscat/Unsplash) Some cities never sleep, but lately, they also don`t even seem to be silent anymore. The constant hum of traffic, construction sites and noise from apartments have become a daily companion of life in urban areas. Silence has become perhaps the rarest resource in modern cities. As the decibels increase along with the number of new buildings, architects around the world are trying to find a way to put it back into space, not by avoiding noise, but by designing to contain it - through materials, technology and smart design. "The Architecture of Silence" combines the science of sound and the art of construction, restoring peace to a space that has lost it. Pavle Panić, founder and director of architectural studio 13 and member of the Association of Serbian Architectural Practices, emphasizes that the fight against noise is no longer a luxury, but a necessity of urban planning and architectural action. - Methods for noise reduction are varied and adapted to different environments and sound sources. Passive and active technologies , as well as solutions in urban planning and traffic management, are most often combined. Passive methods prevail in our practice - says Panić. He explains that passive methods are based on blocking, absorbing or redirecting the sound , and include sound barriers and walls made of dense materials like concrete or brick, but also vegetative barriers, i.e. green walls and belts of trees, which have an ecological function in addition to the aesthetic one. Special attention, he adds, is paid to insulation in buildings, through the application of materials such as mineral wool, fiberglass and acoustic panels, as well as windows with multi-layered glass. Panić notes that, although less often, in practice active technologies for noise control are increasingly appearing, such as active noise cancellation (ANC) or masking of unwanted frequencies with more pleasant tones, which is already used in public transport and airports. In the future, as he says, "smart facades and acoustic sensors will bring a new dimension to noise management in architecture. - Technological development shifts the approach to noise control from static solutions to dynamic and responsive systems. Smart facades can react to changes in external noise in real time, using microphones and speakers to neutralize unwanted frequencies - similar to noise-cancelling headphones - Panić explains. However, as he points out, the biggest challenges in the implementation of the "architecture of silence" in existing cities are not only technical, but also financial and aesthetic. - The biggest problems are costs , the complexity of reconstruction of old buildings and the balance between silence, functionality and visual identity of the space. That is why it is crucial to apply phased and integrated approaches, to combine design and materials that do not violate authenticity, and at the same time muffle noise - he states. Illustration (Photo: Chait Goli from Pexels) When it comes to innovations, Panić points out that acoustic metamaterials, acoustic concrete, light aerogels and green walls of the new generation are among the most promising solutions for the future. - Sustainable materials such as recycled rubber, cork and hemp fibers are showing excellent results. They not only quieten the space, but also contribute to the sustainability of the construction - Panić adds. In the fight against noise in cities, the biggest enemy of silence is not always cars, but - people. More precisely, their lack of understanding of the physical laws of acoustics. As Professor Miomir Mijić, an expert in acoustics from the Faculty of Electrical Engineering in Belgrade, explains, although traffic is the dominant source of noise in the capital, right behind it are the building ventilation and air conditioning systems, the so-called HVAC systems. - Their growing importance in the threat of noise was caused by the effects of climate change, but also by the increase in people`s expectations in the domain of air and thermal comfort - says Professor Mijić. When architecture can (not) help While solving traffic noise is a matter of urban planning and the city`s traffic organization, the possibilities of architecture to influence it are limited. - Between the facade of the building and the road there is nothing that could affect the exposure to noise. In the domain of architecture, you can only adjust the configuration and materialization of the facade, possibly the organization of the space around the building, but the ranges of all that are within the limits of a few decibels - the professor explains. Where architecture plays a dominant role is the noise control of mechanical equipment. However, in practice, mistakes are often made. - A mistake we often see is that during the design process, the accommodation of bulky HVAC machines is not thought about. In the end, they all end up on the roof or on the ground next to the building, where people from the surrounding buildings watch and listen to them. And then the machines become an element of architecture - Mijić warns. What does "architecture of silence" really mean? Although the term "architecture of silence" sounds appealing, Professor Mijić points out that the term is actually rather vague. - Silence is a relative term. We can talk about absolute silence - when the surrounding sounds are so quiet that the senses do not register them. But, paradoxically, that`s when people start hearing what they didn`t before - speech, noises, footsteps. The ideal peace becomes its opposite - he explains. There is, however, another kind of silence - the one in which sounds are present, but do not attract the attention of the ear. - The experience of silence arises when the sounds around us do not attract attention and remain outside of our consciousness. In order to achieve this, it is necessary to have a constant, neutral sound of a moderate level in the environment, which does not draw attention - says Mijić. According to him, such a "neutral hum" can be the sound of traffic itself - if it is present in a dosed manner. - The architecture of silence, in this sense, is reduced to the adjustment of traffic noise to the desired level. And that is a serious challenge for which there is no simple formula - he concludes. Most important innovation – knowledge When it comes to the future, Professor Mijić does not see the solution in new materials, but in education. - The innovation that would make the greatest progress is not material, but educational - quality education about building acoustics for all participants in design and construction. A lot of things that are wrong arise from misunderstanding - he points out. He adds that the "architecture of silence" can also be realized with today`s technologies - if the essence of the problem is understood. - Everything can be achieved even with what we have today, if there is understanding in the design team. Acoustics is based on simple physical laws, so probably nothing revolutionary can be done there. In the last 50 years, we have been able to create an architecture of silence, if we are asked to do so - and if we are allowed - Professor Mijić concludes. Ivana Žikić PAVLE PANIĆ PR PROJEKTNI BIRO STUDIO 13 NOVI SAD Asocijacija srpskih arhitektonskih praksi Beograd ETF Beograd studio 13 Association of Serbian Architectural Practices Faculty of Electrical Engineering in Belgrade Miomir Mijić Pavle Panić Architecture of Silence special edition newsletter real estate and construction real estate and construction where space becomes an opportunity Your comment Send
content_it:
Il silenzio è diventato una risorsa rara nelle città moderne, sommerse dal rumore del traffico, dei cantieri e delle attività domestiche. Di fronte a questa sfida, architetti e urbanisti stanno sviluppando soluzioni integrate per ridurre l’inquinamento acustico, non eliminando il rumore, ma progettando spazi che lo contengano. Pavle Panić, fondatore dello studio architettonico 13 e membro dell’Associazione delle pratiche architettoniche serbe, sottolinea che contrastare il rumore non è più un lusso, ma una necessità. Le strategie adottate spaziano da metodi passivi – come barriere acustiche in calcestruzzo o mattoni, pareti verdi e materiali fonoassorbenti (lana minerale, pannelli acustici, vetri multistrato) – a tecnologie attive emergenti, tra cui sistemi di cancellazione attiva del rumore (ANC), già utilizzati in aeroporti e trasporti pubblici. In futuro, facciate intelligenti dotate di sensori acustici potranno adattarsi in tempo reale alle variazioni del rumore esterno.

Tuttavia, l’applicazione di queste soluzioni incontra ostacoli tecnici, economici ed estetici, soprattutto negli edifici esistenti. Tra le innovazioni più promettenti figurano metamateriali acustici, calcestruzzi fonoassorbenti, aerogel leggeri e materiali sostenibili come gomma riciclata, sughero e fibre di canapa. Il professor Miomir Mijić, esperto di acustica della Facoltà di Ingegneria Elettrica di Belgrado, ricorda che il rumore non proviene solo dal traffico, ma spesso da impianti HVAC mal progettati, posizionati su tetti o vicino agli edifici senza considerare l’impatto acustico.

Il concetto di “architettura del silenzio”, pur suggestivo, è complesso: il silenzio assoluto è paradossalmente disturbante, mentre la vera quiete si raggiunge quando i suoni ambientali sono costanti, neutri e non invadono la coscienza. Secondo Mijić, la vera innovazione non risiede nei materiali, ma nella formazione: una corretta educazione sull’acustica edilizia per tutti gli attori del processo progettuale è fondamentale per realizzare spazi veramente silenziosi, anche con le tecnologie attuali. Come riportato da ekapija.com, queste soluzioni rappresentano un’opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in materiali fonoassorbenti, facciate intelligenti e consulenza acustica applicata all’architettura.

title_en: The third office building within the AFI City Zmaj complex confirms the status of one of the most attractive business locations in the city
title_it: Terzo edificio per AFI City Zmaj
content_en: New building within AFI City Zmaj (Photo: AFI) AFI continues to expand its presence in Serbia, developing projects that set new standards for business and residential space. Our vision is to create modern and sustainable complexes, which follow the growth of companies and redefine the quality of business premises in Belgrade, as well as throughout the country. That`s why each of our investments has a long-term character. We want to build spaces where companies develop, and the city gains new value and contemporary architectural recognition, said Adir El Al, general manager of AFI in Serbia. Construction of the third building has begun within the AFI City Zmaj business complex, which will bring new square footage for companies looking for modern infrastructure and a working environment of the highest standards. The project is designed to keep the existing green areas, with the planned planting of a new row of trees in front of the complex itself, which carefully nurtures the balance between the urban office space and the natural environment, which relaxes, but at the same time creates a working atmosphere that improves focus and motivates. The new building was designed as a modern business building on 8 floors, with a floor area of ​​about 2,500 square meters. Conceived according to the "shell and core" system, it enables tenants to organize the space flexibly, from larger single-floor areas to smaller functional units. There will be a total of five elevators in the building, while the facade of the building will be done in light tones, with contemporary panels and large windows, so as to achieve a harmonious and harmonious look. Along with the planned construction of a new business building, the creation of 388 parking spaces was also planned, which will satisfy the needs of all new tenants. Business premises that grow with your business Numerous studies show that a well-designed office space can significantly affect the productivity of employees, which in an adequate environment can increase by 25-35%. That`s why companies, when choosing office space, pay more and more attention to location, accessibility, quality and arrangement of the environment, flexibility of space and availability of additional content. The expansion of the AFI City Zmaj complex is being carried out according to the highest standards, with a clear vision of creating a business space that follows the rhythm and development of your business. An attractive location only 9 kilometers from the center and 10 kilometers from the Nikola Tesla Airport, close proximity to the highway, as well as the Zemun railway station, will allow you to quickly and easily reach all the key city locations. AFI City Zmaj already has over 27,000 square meters of office space in its current offer, which can be further modified based on the needs of clients. This flexibility allows companies to fully adapt the space to their needs, while simultaneously operating in a highly functional business park that is one of the drivers of innovation in Belgrade. AFI City Zmaj (Photo: AFI) Airport City Belgrade - in step with development The development of AFI City Zmaja is taking place in parallel with the expansion of AFI Airport City Belgrade, the largest business complex in the region. Within it, the construction of the first of three premium office buildings - Airport City Business Avenue Tower 1 - has been completed. The architecture of this facility combines top design and high-quality materials, providing flexible and highly functional office spaces. Airport City Business Avenue (Photo: AFI) In addition, two more luxury buildings are planned, one of which will be dedicated to the exclusive and unique AC Hotel by Marriott. The realization of these ambitious projects further strengthens the position of AFI as one of the leaders in the commercial real estate market in Serbia. AFI - long-term strategy, clear vision AFI, the creator of these projects, has been operating in our region for more than two decades and is synonymous with quality and reliability. Part of this company`s portfolio is Business Garden, a business oasis in the heart of the capital, as well as one of the symbols of Belgrade, the imposing residential and business complex Skyline Belgrade. With more than 300,000 square meters in its portfolio, AFI has positioned itself on the market as a leader with invaluable experience, followed by expertise, commitment and vision.
