È iniziata la costruzione del terzo edificio all’interno del complesso business AFI City Zmaj a Belgrado, confermando la vocazione della zona come una delle location più attrattive per le aziende. Il nuovo edificio, alto otto piani con una superficie di circa 2.500 metri quadrati per piano, sarà realizzato secondo il sistema “shell and core”, permettendo ai futuri inquilini di personalizzare gli spazi in base alle proprie esigenze. Sarà dotato di cinque ascensori e di una facciata in tonalità chiare con grandi vetrate, progettata per integrarsi armoniosamente con l’ambiente circostante, preservando le aree verdi esistenti e aggiungendo una nuova fila di alberi.  

Il progetto prevede anche la realizzazione di 388 posti auto, a garanzia di comodità e accessibilità. Situato a soli 9 km dal centro di Belgrado e a 10 km dall’aeroporto “Nikola Tesla”, con vicinanza alla tangenziale e alla stazione ferroviaria di Zemun, il complesso offre già oltre 27.000 metri quadrati di uffici flessibili.  

Secondo Adir El Al, direttore generale di AFI in Serbia, l’obiettivo è creare spazi moderni, sostenibili e adattabili alla crescita delle imprese, contribuendo al contempo al rinnovamento architettonico della città. AFI, attiva nella regione da oltre vent’anni, conferma così il proprio ruolo di leader nel mercato immobiliare commerciale serbo, con un portafoglio superiore a 300.000 metri quadrati che include anche Business Garden e Skyline Belgrade.  

I progetti si sviluppano parallelamente all’espansione di AFI Airport City Belgrade, il più grande complesso business della regione, dove è già stato completato il primo di tre edifici premium – Airport City Business Avenue Tower 1 – e sono previsti altri due edifici, uno dei quali ospiterà l’AC Hotel by Marriott.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la strategia di AFI si basa su investimenti a lungo termine, qualità costruttiva e attenzione all’ambiente lavorativo, elementi sempre più decisivi per le aziende nella scelta della sede. La crescente domanda di spazi ufficio flessibili, ben collegati e sostenibili rappresenta un’opportunità per le imprese italiane specializzate in arredi modulari, tecnologie per smart building e soluzioni di efficienza energetica.

title_en: Nikola Babić, CEO of B Capital Group: We are developing three modern complexes in the heart of Boka, the first tenants in 2027
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: Nikola Babić (Photo: B Capital Group) In the Bay of Kotor, one of the most beautiful in the world, projects are being developed that change the face of Montenegro and position it as one of the most desirable investment destinations in the region. The company B Capital Group stands out among them, with three exceptional projects - Topla Homes in Herceg Novi, Nexus Residences in Radanovići and Olive Grove in Orahovac. Each of these projects brings unique benefits to prospective tenants. Whether you`re looking for a permanent home, a summer retreat or a high-yielding investment, you`re sure to find what you`re looking for in one of these complexes. Topla Homes and Nexus Residences are already under construction and are expected to be completed by July 2027. Work on the Olive Grove project will start soon, and this complex will welcome its first tenants by the end of 2027. As Nikola Babić, executive director of B Capital Group , said in an interview for eKapija, this company was created as a logical step in upgrading the long-term consulting work of family companies — CAU - Center for Architecture and Urbanism, with two decades of business, and Moncore , which has been successfully operating in the field of design for five years. - CAU and Moncore provide a wide range of consulting services that include: site analysis, feasibility studies, project management, design, construction and design supervision, project audits, as well as interior design. It was the experience gained through the implementation of numerous projects of various typologies, scope and complexity across Montenegro that motivated us to take a step further and, in addition to providing services to investors, to launch our own investment projects Through B Capital Group, we strive to translate our combined experience into quality projects of contemporary design, which will provide our customers with a comfortable home and/or a safe investment. Your two companies have participated in the development of some of the most recognizable projects in Montenegro, such as Luštica Bay, Porto Montenegro, Portonovi Resort and Porta Rai. What experiences and standards from those projects have you transferred to B Capital Group? - Our team, which today has about 100 members from various professions, participated during the previous years in the development of some of the most important projects in Montenegro, among them: Luštica Bay, Porto Montenegro, Portonovi Resort and Porta Rai. On most of the mentioned projects, we are still engaged in various roles - from project planning, interior design, audit, supervision, to project management. This entails working in accordance with international standards and proves our competence for the realization of complex investments. From each of the projects we work on, we strive to recognize and transfer the best practices to B Capital Group investments — from the organization of space, the selection of materials and technical solutions, to the application of procedures that guarantee the quality of construction. Through B Capital Group, we are focused on creating projects that combine design and functionality adapted to customer needs, with an optimal price-quality ratio. Thanks to our many years of design and construction experience, we make thoughtful decisions about each segment of construction, which ensures longevity, aesthetic value and recognizable quality of the space we create. Topla Homes (Photo: B Capital Group) Topla Homes in Herceg Novi is currently under construction. What are the key features of this project and what makes it attractive to potential buyers? - Topla Homes represents a modern residential concept in the very heart of Herceg Novi, which combines comfort, functionality and a high level of quality housing. The project is located in an extremely attractive location — in the central city zone, in the immediate vicinity of all key amenities such as schools, shops, health facilities and recreational areas, which makes it an ideal choice for modern family life. The building includes 46 apartments spread over two levels of underground garages, and it is designed to provide every tenant with a sense of comfort and privacy. The peace provided by the private gardens and the impressive views from the rooftop terraces, which create a unique experience of living between the sea and the greenery, give the project a special value. As in all our projects, we paid great attention to the quality of materials, design details and functionality of the space, with the aim of Topla Homes becoming recognized as a combination of modern style, thoughtful planning and a pleasant living environment in the heart of Herceg Novi. Nexus Residences (Photo: B Capital Group) The construction of the Nexus Residences complex in Radanovići is also underway. Can you tell us what is special about this project and how it differs from other luxury residential projects in Montenegro? - The Nexus Residences project represents a carefully thought-out investment that stands out for its extremely attractive location in Radanovići, in the very heart of the Montenegrin coast. The complex is ideally located between Kotor, Tivat, Budva and Luštica Bay, which makes it the perfect choice for those who want a combination of a peaceful environment and close proximity to the most famous tourist and business areas. Connectivity is one of the key assets of this location - the new boulevard connects all the mentioned cities, while the proximity of the Tivat airport enables easy and fast international connections, which additionally contributes to the attractiveness of the complex. What further highlights this zone is the fact that it offers the best living conditions - in the immediate vicinity there are shops, various facilities, local and international schools, as well as a new cable car that offers one of the most beautiful views of the Bay of Kotor. We believe that in the coming years, this area will see the greatest increase in real estate values, which was the key reason for us to realize the complex in that position. Through Nexus Residences, we want to offer a combination of modern design, functionality and high quality of life, in accordance with the standards we nurture through all B Capital Group projects. Topla Homes (Photo: B Capital Group) When do you expect the completion of the works and the move-in to these complexes? - Completion of works on both complexes is planned for July 2027 at the latest, when we expect the first tenants to move in. The works are carried out according to the established plan and phase dynamics, with clearly defined deadlines and careful monitoring of each stage of implementation, in order to ensure quality continuity and respect for the planned time structure. Olive Grove (Photo: B Capital Group) Another project that you are developing is the Olive Grove in Orahovac. What makes this project special in relation to other residential complexes on the Montenegrin coast? Who is it intended for - is it more suitable for local residents, foreign investors, or those looking for a peaceful retreat by the sea, but close to urban centers? - The Olive Grove project in Orahovac represents our most exclusive residential complex, designed for true lovers of the Boka Kotor Bay and its distinctive traditional architecture. Located between Kotor and Perast, Olive Grove offers a unique blend of authentic Mediterranean ambience and modern comfort. We paid special attention to preserving the identity of the space and creating architecture that fits harmoniously into the landscape, without disturbing the natural appearance of the Bay of Kotor. With incredible sea views, close proximity to the coast and all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay, Olive Grove provides the perfect retreat for those seeking peace, privacy and authenticity. It is an exclusive location that attracts both domestic and foreign buyers, as well as all those who want to enjoy the beauty and spirit of the Bay of Kotor. Olive Grove (Photo: B Capital Group) How does the architecture and design of the project reflect the authenticity of Boka, while at the same time following the trends of modern, comfortable living? How did you manage to "reconcile" the past and the future, i.e. the legacy of Boka and the vision of modern living? - In the development of the Olive Grove project, we put a special emphasis on preserving the authenticity of Boka Kotor architecture and harmonizing it with the modern way of life. During the design process, we worked intensively with conservators and the Administration for the Protection of Cultural Property, to ensure that every detail is in accordance with the spirit of the space and the rules for the protection of cultural heritage. We have analyzed in detail the existing buildings and the architectural context of Boka, and through the careful application of authentic materials - primarily stone on the facades, then the characteristic shapes of the roofs and the proportions of the openings - we have come to a modern interpretation of the traditional Boka Kotor architecture. In this way, the Olive Grove project combines the past and the future, creating an environment where heritage, aesthetics and the comfort of modern life are in complete harmony. When do you expect the construction of this complex to begin, and when will the first tenants move in? - The start of the construction of the Olive Grove complex is planned for the end of this year, while we expect that the entire project will be finished and ready for occupancy by the end of 2027 at the latest. The works will take place in clearly defined phases, with consistent monitoring of the quality and dynamics of execution, in order to ensure the realization of the project in accordance with the planned standards and deadlines. Nexus Residences (Photo: B Capital Group) What will the company focus on in the next period? Are there any plans to develop new projects in Montenegro or beyond, in addition to the existing ones? - In the coming period, the focus of the company B Capital Group will be on the realization of active projects - Nexus Residences, Topla Homes and Olive Grove - in order to ensure the quality and dynamics expected from us. At the same time, we are actively planning and developing new projects that we will consider and implement in the coming years. The company`s plan is to constantly develop several active projects at multiple locations throughout Montenegro, striving to provide our customers with the best possible experience and value through each realized project. title_en: Angelina Nekić, director of Delta Real Estate: Delta District reached height of more than 50 meters, first tenants move in in 2027, InterContinental hotel at the end of 2026.
title_it: Delta District: residenza esclusiva a Belgrado
content_en: The company Delta Real Estate realizes one of the most significant projects on the domestic market - Delta District . It is a unique residence related to a well-known brand, which combines the residential, business and hotel segments, and is being built in one phase. We talk about the current progress of the works and the importance of the project with Angelina Nekić, vice president of Delta Holding and director of Delta Real Estate. Delta District is a unique residence in the region. What is special about this concept? - This concept is special because it brings a new housing experience that has not existed in the region until now and shows how much our city is developing in the direction of world metropolises. It is a unique mixed-use complex that combines residential, business and hotel facilities, providing tenants with the opportunity to live and work in the same space, with direct access to all the amenities of a five-star hotel. It is a small and secluded community of 280 apartments spread over two towers, designed to provide peace, comfort and a sense of exclusivity. The special value of the project is given by its exceptional location - in the very heart of the business and diplomatic zone of New Belgrade, in a fully formed block without planned additional construction. Such an environment brings stability and growth in the value of the investment, because it is located in an area that is already positioned as the central point of Belgrade. Residents are separated from the highway exit by only one traffic light and a 60-second drive, which makes this location one of the best connected in the city. title_en: Tender for section of highway from Matesevo to Andrijevica extended until October 30
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: (Photo: YouTube.com/Ministarstvo kapitalnih investicija/Printscreen) Monteput and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) have extended, by ten days, the deadline for submitting technical and financial bids for the selection of the designer and contractor for the second section of the Bar-Boljare highway, from Matesevo to Andrijevica. As announced, the tender will be open until October 30. – Taking into account the complexity of the tender documentation relating to the preparation of bids for the design and execution of works on the second section of the highway, as well as the numerous questions and requests submitted by potential bidders during the procedure, the additional extension of the deadline for submitting bids aims to ensure full transparency and equal access to all interested participants – it was announced. Monteput states that the additional time allows bidders to prepare their bids in a quality manner, especially considering the procedures required to obtain appropriate security funds related to guarantees, which require additional coordination and administrative steps. – This increases the competitiveness of the procedure and ensures that the submitted bids meet the technical and financial requirements from the tender documentation to the greatest extent possible – the statement concludes. title_en: Novi Sad hosts Third Traffic Fair – Safety and efficiency in focus
title_it: Fiera del traffico a Novi Sad
content_en: Aleksandar Bulajic (Photo: Novosadski sajam) The Third Traffic Fair, an event dedicated to improving traffic safety and efficiency, opened yesterday at the “Master” Congress Center at the Novi Sad Fair and last until today, October 21. This event brings together numerous experts, institutions and organizations dealing with the development of traffic infrastructure and culture, with a special focus on the safety of traffic participants. The opening of the fair was also attended by Aleksandar Bulajic, member of the City Council for Traffic and Roads, who on that occasion emphasized the importance of continuous investment in traffic safety in the territory of the City. – The City of Novi Sad is constantly working to improve traffic safety for all age groups - from preschool and primary school children, through young drivers, to elderly people over 65 – said Bulajic. He added that “special emphasis is placed on preventive activities, such as the distribution of car seats and education of the youngest.” – We believe that safety is formed from an early age – said Aleksandar Bulajic. (Photo: Novosadski sajam) During the fair, visitors have the opportunity to attend presentations and panels where experts in the field of traffic, safety and transport are exchanging experiences, present innovative solutions and initiatives. The Fair program is adapted to all ages, and the youngest will learn about the importance of traffic safety through games, a training ground, traffic signs and educational performances. The Traffic Fair is organized by the Novi Sad Fair and the Traffic Safety Center, with the support of the Provincial Secretariat for Energy, Construction and Transport, the City Administration for Traffic and Roads, as well as numerous institutions and organizations that actively work on improving traffic safety and infrastructure. The opening of the Fair was also attended by the Dean of the Faculty of Technical Sciences Boris Dumnic, Dean of the Faculty of Traffic Engineering in Doboj Miroslav Kostadinovic, Director of the Traffic Safety Agency Branko Stamatovic Assistant Chief of the Traffic Police Administration Zlatko Belencan and General Director of the Novi Sad Fair Slobodan Cvetkovic. Fotografije: Novosadski sajam a.d. Novi Sad Udruženje Centar za bezbednost saobraćaja Beograd Pokrajinski sekretarijat za energetiku, građevinarstvo i saobraćaj Novi Sad Gradska uprava za saobraćaj i puteve grada Novog Sada Novi Sad Fair Traffic Fair Aleksandar Bulajić Your comment Send
content_it: Si è aperta ieri, 20 ottobre, presso il Centro Congressi “Master” della Fiera di Novi Sad, la Terza Fiera del Traffico, dedicata al miglioramento della sicurezza e dell’efficienza stradale, con chiusura prevista oggi, 21 ottobre. L’evento riunisce esperti, istituzioni e organizzazioni attive nello sviluppo delle infrastrutture e della cultura della circolazione, con particolare attenzione alla sicurezza di tutti gli utenti della strada. Alla cerimonia di apertura ha preso parte anche Aleksandar Bulajić, membro del Consiglio comunale per il Traffico e le Strade, che ha sottolineato l’importanza degli investimenti continui nella sicurezza stradale sul territorio cittadino. “Il Comune di Novi Sad lavora costantemente per migliorare la sicurezza per tutte le fasce d’età – dai bambini in età prescolare e scolare, ai giovani conducenti, fino agli anziani oltre i 65 anni”, ha affermato Bulajić, aggiungendo che “particolare attenzione è rivolta alle attività preventive, come la distribuzione di seggiolini per auto e l’educazione dei più piccoli. Crediamo che la sicurezza si formi fin dalla prima infanzia”. Durante la fiera, visitatori di ogni età possono partecipare a presentazioni, tavole rotonde e attività educative, con i bambini coinvolti attraverso giochi, percorsi didattici, segnaletica stradale e spettacoli tematici. L’evento è organizzato dalla Fiera di Novi Sad e dal Centro per la Sicurezza Stradale, con il sostegno del Segretariato provinciale per l’Energia, le Costruzioni e i Trasporti, dell’Amministrazione comunale per il Traffico e le Strade, e di numerose altre istituzioni attive nel settore. Hanno preso parte all’inaugurazione anche il preside della Facoltà di Scienze Tecniche Boris Dumnić, il preside della Facoltà di Ingegneria dei Trasporti di Doboj Miroslav Kostadinović, il direttore dell’Agenzia per la Sicurezza Stradale Branko Stamatović, il vicecapo dell’Amministrazione della Polizia Stradale Zlatko Belencan e il direttore generale della Fiera di Novi Sad Slobodan Cvetković. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’evento rappresenta un’occasione per condividere soluzioni innovative e buone pratiche nel settore dei trasporti, con potenziali opportunità di collaborazione per aziende italiane specializzate in sicurezza stradale, tecnologie per la mobilità e infrastrutture intelligenti.

title_en: Instead of demolishing 100 houses, tunnel to be built – Plans to continue construction of Milos Veliki highway
title_it: Nuovo tunnel per l'autostrada Milos Veliki
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Broesis/Pixabay) After the section of the Milos Veliki highway from Pakovrace to Pozega has been completed, its construction is planned to continue further towards Ivanjica, in order to complete the route to Boljare. Earlier, information appeared that according to the original plan, the construction of this section in the territory of the municipality of Ivanjica would result in the demolition of about 100 houses and the occupation of fertile land. The locals expressed great concern and dissatisfaction, therefore a meeting was held in Ivanjica between representatives of the local government, the CRBC company and the locals of Radaljevo. – After discussions with state authorities and investors, it was decided to create a new conceptual solution that includes a new tunnel variant that will bypass more than 90% of the disputed plots – the mayor of the municipality of Ivanjica, Aleksandar Mitrovic, told RINA. He emphasizes that, in this way, the state has shown its willingness to meet the needs of the people despite the fact that the new route will cost significantly more. CRBC SERBIA OGRANAK BEOGRAD Opština Ivanjica CRBC Miloš Veliki highway Radaljevo Your comment Send
content_it: Dopo il completamento del tratto autostradale Milos Veliki da Pakovrace a Pozega, si prevede di proseguire i lavori verso Ivanjica per completare il collegamento fino a Boljare. Inizialmente, il progetto prevedeva la demolizione di circa 100 abitazioni e l'esproprio di terreni agricoli nel comune di Ivanjica, suscitando forti proteste da parte della popolazione locale. A seguito di incontri tra istituzioni locali, rappresentanti dell’impresa CRBC e cittadini di Radaljevo, è stata definita una nuova soluzione progettuale. “Dopo colloqui con le autorità statali e gli investitori, è stato deciso di adottare una variante con un nuovo tunnel che eviterà oltre il 90% dei terreni contestati”, ha dichiarato il sindaco di Ivanjica, Aleksandar Mitrović, sottolineando che lo Stato ha dimostrato sensibilità alle esigenze della popolazione nonostante l’incremento significativo dei costi. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la modifica del tracciato rappresenta un compromesso tra sviluppo infrastrutturale e tutela del territorio. Questo approccio potrebbe offrire opportunità alle imprese italiane specializzate in gallerie e opere sotterranee di alta complessità.

title_en: Initiative launched to modernize rail infrastructure between Serbia and Adriatic ports
title_it: Potenziamento ferrovie Serbia-Adriatico
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Federico Rostagno/shutterstock.com) The Chamber of Commerce of Serbia (CCIS), together with the northern Adriatic ports of Rijeka, Koper and Trieste, has launched an initiative towards the relevant governments and EU institutions to accelerate the modernization of rail infrastructure and remove all administrative barriers that hinder efficient transport between Serbia and Adriatic ports, the CCIS announced. The president of the CCIS, Marko Cadez, met with the presidents of the Ports of Rijeka and Koper, Dusko Grabovec and Nevenka Krizan. Together, they stressed that it was time for concrete steps, because any further delay in the transport of goods to these ports cost the region lost investments and slowed development. – The ports of Rijeka, Koper and Trieste represent a strategic direction for the economy of Serbia and the region. This is the shortest and most modern logistics route for connecting the economies of the Western Balkans with the global market – said Cadez. Due to insufficient investments, outdated rail infrastructure, and the lack of inspection controls for veterinary and phytosanitary supervision at crossings, transport between Serbia and the northern Adriatic ports is carried out predominantly by road. All this leads to large jams and delays at border crossings, especially at Batrovci, where trucks wait on average for more than 10 hours, and in some cases up to 36 hours. – The revised TEN-T network and the EU Growth Plan for the Western Balkans of six billion euros by 2027 give us the opportunity for political and financial support for the modernization of railroads. This is an opportunity for the region to stand together before the EU and show that connectivity is a prerequisite for joint progress – said Cadez. Connecting the Serbian economy with the northern Adriatic ports is of crucial importance for access to global markets and for the further development of industry, export and logistics. The initiative of the CCIS and its partners has a clear goal - for Serbia to become an integral part of a modern, green and efficient European rail system. Privredna komora Srbije Chamber of Commerce of Serbia CCIS Marko Čadež Duško Grabovac Nevenka Križan Port of Rijeka Port of Koper Port of Trieste Your comment Send
content_it:
La Camera di Commercio della Serbia (CCIS), insieme ai porti dell'Alto Adriatico di Rijeka, Capodistria e Trieste, ha lanciato un’iniziativa rivolta ai governi competenti e alle istituzioni UE per accelerare la modernizzazione dell’infrastruttura ferroviaria e rimuovere gli ostacoli amministrativi che ostacolano il trasporto efficiente tra la Serbia e i porti adriatici, come riportato da ekapija.com.  

Il presidente della CCIS, Marko Čadež, ha incontrato i vertici dei porti di Rijeka e Capodistria, Duško Grabovac e Nevenka Križan, sottolineando l’urgenza di passi concreti: ogni ulteriore ritardo nel trasporto merci verso questi porti comporta investimenti persi e rallenta lo sviluppo dell’intera regione.  

Čadež ha ricordato che Rijeka, Capodistria e Trieste rappresentano la rotta logistica più breve e moderna per collegare le economie dei Balcani occidentali ai mercati globali. Tuttavia, a causa di investimenti insufficienti, infrastrutture ferroviarie obsolete e mancanza di controlli veterinari e fitosanitari ai valichi, il trasporto avviene prevalentemente su strada, causando lunghe code e ritardi, in particolare al valico di Batrovci, dove i tir attendono in media oltre 10 ore, talvolta fino a 36.  

Il rinnovato corridoio TEN-T e il Piano di Crescita UE per i Balcani occidentali, dotato di 6 miliardi di euro entro il 2027, offrono un’opportunità chiara per ottenere sostegno politico e finanziario alla modernizzazione ferroviaria. L’obiettivo dell’iniziativa è integrare pienamente la Serbia in un sistema ferroviario europeo moderno, sostenibile ed efficiente.  

Questa strategia apre opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nel settore delle infrastrutture ferroviarie, dei sistemi logistici e dei servizi tecnici specializzati.

title_en: First parts of new Sava bridge to arrive from China in mid-November – Complete structure to be on Sava bank in early 2026
title_it: Arrivo in novembre delle prime parti del nuovo ponte sulla Sava
content_en: Future bridge on the Sava (Photo: Printscreen/Facebook/Siniša Mali) Work on the Sava bridge is proceeding according to schedule. The remains of the old one are being removed, while work is being done on the access roads. The first parts of the steel structure of the new bridge will arrive in a month, and at the beginning of next year, according to the authorities, the complete structure will be on the Sava bank. Work is underway at four locations on the construction site of the new bridge. One team of workers is removing the pillars of the old bridge, another is installing piles for the new one, and a third is building a temporary dock, where barges with the first parts of the steel structure, which is already in Constanta, are due to arrive from China on November 15. However, the most important thing is to complete all 108 piles for the new bridge on the Sava, weighing 7,000 tons, on time . 48 have been completed so far. On the New Belgrade side, 33 piles have been completed, as well as one foundation for the first pillar of the new bridge. In the Belgrade Waterfront settlement, the first 18 piles are being drilled and concreted. – We also expect to continue work on driving piles into the river, which will be used to make chain beams, and after the completion of the enlargement of the main arch of the bridge, which is expected in the middle of next year, the new bridge structure will be lowered onto barges via chain beams – explains Lazar Pavic, bridge engineer for the company Power China. Special machines, which are placed on barges, are working on the pillars of the old bridge. On the first, which was demolished, an excavator is removing the remains of concrete and reinforcement from the bottom. The foundations of the second pillar are being broken up, and the third still needs to be cut and removed. – The pillar closest to the New Belgrade side will fit into the area of the pillar that has now been completely demolished, and the pillar closer to the Belgrade side will be between the pillar that is about to start being demolished and the bank – specifies Vladimir Vujic from Mostogradnja . The construction of the piles and the two pillars that are in the river, according to engineer Pavic, is expected by the end of the year. – The first pile driving in the river will begin at the end of this year and these piles will probably be carried out sometime in the next six months – says Pavic. First, experts from the Demining Center search the riverbed and banks. The first time divers did this was more than 10 years ago, when the design of the new bridge on the Sava River began. Then they found an unexploded air bomb and three artillery shells and everything was safely removed. – The dynamics of the Demining Center’s work are such that we fit in with construction works, where the need for construction drilling for subsequent piles is expressed, the Demining Center conducts soil testing, hands it over to them and then they do their work – says Zoran Stevanovic from the Demining Center of the Republic of Serbia. Fotografije: +9 Opis: Novi Savski most imaće ukupno 6 saobraćajnih traka, od čega su 4 automobilske i 2 tramvajske. Dužina novog mosta je 420 m, a biće postavljen na ukupno 6 stubova. Širina mosta je 38 m, a na mestima vidikovca za pešake je 42 m. Dvosmerni tramvajski saobraćaj će biti pozicioniran u sredini, a dvosmerni drumski saobraćaj će imati po dve kolovozne trake, sa po 6,5 metara po smeru. Vidi sve Power Construction Corporation of China Limited Ogranak Beograd Centar za razminiranje Beograd Mostogradnja a.d. Beograd Power China Lazar Pavić Vladimir Vujić Zoran Stevanović Old Sava Bridge Belgrade new Sava bridge Belgrade Your comment Send
content_it:
I lavori per il nuovo ponte sulla Sava procedono secondo il cronoprogramma. Sono in corso la rimozione dei resti del vecchio ponte e la costruzione delle strade di accesso. Le prime componenti della struttura in acciaio, attualmente a Costanza, arriveranno dalla Cina il 15 novembre. All’inizio del 2026, l’intera struttura sarà posizionata sulla sponda della Sava.  

Attualmente operano quattro squadre sul cantiere: una rimuove i piloni del vecchio ponte, un’altra installa i pali per il nuovo manufatto, una terza sta costruendo un molo temporaneo per l’approdo delle chiatte, mentre si procede con la realizzazione dei 108 pali necessari per il nuovo ponte, del peso complessivo di 7.000 tonnellate. Finora ne sono stati completati 48: 33 sul lato di Nuova Belgrado, inclusa una fondazione per il primo pilone, e 18 nell’area di Belgrade Waterfront.  

Lazar Pavić, ingegnere ponti della Power China, spiega che entro la metà del 2025 sarà completato l’allargamento dell’arco principale, per poi abbassare la struttura del ponte sulle chiatte tramite travi a catena. Parallelamente, sono in corso le operazioni di bonifica del fondo del fiume da parte del Centro per lo Sminamento della Serbia, che ha già rimosso in passato residuati bellici.  

Il nuovo ponte avrà sei corsie totali (quattro stradali e due tranviarie), una lunghezza di 420 metri e una larghezza di 38 metri, estendibile a 42 metri nei punti panoramici pedonali.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la realizzazione dell’opera rappresenta un’opportunità per imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture e tecnologie per la costruzione di ponti e opere d’arte stradali.

title_en: Vucic: Fruska Gora Corridor to be completed in 2027
title_it: Corridoio Fruška Gora completato nel 2027
content_en: (Photo: Jamar Penny/Unsplash) The Fruska Gora Corridor will be completed in 2027, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said today, attending the groundbreaking of the first tube of the “Iriski Venac” tunnel, on the route of that road. The length of the double-tube tunnel is 3.5 kilometers, and it will connect Novi Sad and Petrovaradin, with the Belgrade-Sid and Belgrade-Sabac-Loznica highways. The groundbreaking of the second tube has been announced for next month, and when that is done, the “Iriski Venac” tunnel will be the longest in Serbia. Vucic is attending the groundbreaking of the right tunnel tube, 1.3 meters long. (Photo: JP urbanizam Novi Sad/UP, screenshot) The Novi Sad-Ruma expressway is 44.41 kilometers long, and its construction began on May 1, 2021, when the works were planned to be completed in three years. The road will have four lanes of three and a half meters each, without hard shoulders, and will connect the highways to Sid and Subotica. The value of the project is estimated at EUR 606 million, and the main contractor is the Chinese company CRBC . Predsedništvo Republike Srbije CRBC SERBIA OGRANAK BEOGRAD president of Serbia CRBC Aleksandar Vučić Iriški venac Novi Sad Ruma expressway Fruška Gora Corridor Your comment Send
content_it:
Il Corridoio Fruška Gora sarà completato nel 2027, ha dichiarato oggi il Presidente della Serbia Aleksandar Vučić in occasione dell’avvio dei lavori per la prima canna del tunnel “Iriški Venac”, parte di questa infrastruttura stradale. Il tunnel a doppia canna, lungo complessivamente 3,5 chilometri, collegherà Novi Sad e Petrovaradin con le autostrade Belgrado-Sid e Belgrado-Sabac-Loznica. L’inizio dei lavori per la seconda canna è previsto per il prossimo mese; una volta concluso, il tunnel “Iriški Venac” diventerà il più lungo della Serbia.  

L’esecutivo ha inoltre ricordato che la costruzione dell’autostrada espressa Novi Sad-Ruma, lunga 44,41 chilometri, è iniziata il 1° maggio 2021 con un termine previsto di tre anni. La strada avrà quattro corsie da 3,5 metri ciascuna, senza banchine di emergenza, e collegherà le autostrade per Sid e Subotica.  

Il valore complessivo del progetto è stimato in 606 milioni di euro, e l’appalto principale è stato affidato all’impresa cinese CRBC, come riportato da ekapija.com.  

Questo ambizioso progetto infrastrutturale potrebbe offrire opportunità alle imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture e materiali per la costruzione, nell’ambito di futuri bandi o collaborazioni tecniche.

title_en: Air Serbia and airBaltic to expand cooperation agreement: Airbus A220-300 soon in Air Serbia’s fleet
title_it: Air Serbia introdurrà Airbus A220-300
content_en: (Photo: Pixabay.com/johanwiden69) Air Serbia and airBaltic have announced the expansion of their existing cooperation with the signing of a two-year wet lease agreement. Starting from November 1, 2025, airBaltic will operate flights on behalf of Air Serbia using modern Airbus A220-300 aircraft with a capacity of 148 seats, the Serbian national airline carrier announced. By introducing airBaltic and next-generation aircraft into its own operations, Air Serbia is further enhancing the passenger experience and continuing the process of strengthening and expanding its route network. During the upcoming winter season, two airBaltic aircraft will be engaged in Air Serbia’s operations, while as many as four aircraft will be in service during the 2026 summer season, the press release says. – We are very pleased to continue developing our cooperation with airBaltic, one of the most innovative airlines in Europe and our long-time codeshare partner. This partnership is of particular importance for Air Serbia, as on our flights, passengers will have the opportunity to travel comfortably and quickly to their destinations aboard modern Airbus A220-300 aircraft. We remain committed to innovation and technological development, all with the aim of strengthening our competitiveness in the European market. This type of aircraft will be an important model and reference point for future decisions regarding the composition of Air Serbia’s fleet, all in line with the continued development and implementation of the company’s strategic plans – said Jiri Marek, CEO of Air Serbia. – With Air Serbia, we have maintained a long-standing cooperation for more than ten years, ensuring good connectivity between the Baltic region and the Balkans. Expanding this cooperation through the ACMI agreement supports efficient fleet use and reliable operations for both airlines. The ACMI model enables airBaltic to provide flexible capacity to partner airlines across Europe while maintaining consistent product quality and operational reliability with our modern Airbus A220-300 fleet and experienced crews – said Thomas Ramdahl, Chief Commercial Officer at airBaltic. title_en: New EES border crossing system to be introduced at Kelebija first
title_it: Nuovo sistema EES al valico di Kelebija
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Michaelvbg) The Consulate General of Hungary in Subotica has announced that the new border crossing system between Hungary and Serbia will come into effect on October 28 at 8 am at the Kelebija-Tompa border crossing. At other border crossings, the new system of entry and exit from the European Union countries will be applied from November 4. In a statement published by the consulate on its official Facebook page, it is stated that on October 12, 2025, the gradual implementation of the new registration system at border crossings, a system known as the EES (Entry and Exit System), began in Hungary. The system will be applied at Hungary’s Schengen border towards citizens of third countries and involves more administrative tasks at the border crossing, according to the consulate. Hungary first started applying the EES system at the border with Ukraine. The consulate also said that the new system did not apply to travelers holding Hungarian travel or identity documents and that they would still be able to cross the border in the usual way. This practically means that the new EES system will not apply to dual citizens, i.e. citizens of Serbia who hold both Serbian and Hungarian citizenship. content_it: Il Consolato Generale d’Ungheria a Subotica ha annunciato che il nuovo sistema di attraversamento delle frontiere tra Ungheria e Serbia entrerà in vigore il 28 ottobre alle ore 8 al valico di Kelebija-Tompa. Negli altri valichi, il nuovo sistema di registrazione per l’ingresso e l’uscita dai Paesi dell’Unione europea sarà applicato a partire dal 4 novembre. Come riportato dal consolato sulla sua pagina Facebook ufficiale, il 12 ottobre 2025 è iniziata in Ungheria l’attuazione graduale del sistema EES (Entry and Exit System). Il sistema sarà applicato alle frontiere Schengen dell’Ungheria nei confronti dei cittadini di Paesi terzi e comporterà maggiori adempimenti amministrativi al valico. L’Ungheria ha introdotto inizialmente il sistema EES al confine con l’Ucraina. Il consolato ha inoltre precisato che il nuovo sistema non si applicherà ai viaggiatori in possesso di documenti ungheresi di viaggio o d’identità, i quali potranno continuare ad attraversare la frontiera con le modalità usuali. Ciò significa, in pratica, che il sistema EES non riguarderà i cittadini serbi con doppia cittadinanza serbo-ungherese. Questo aggiornamento normativo potrebbe facilitare la pianificazione logistica delle imprese italiane operanti nella regione, soprattutto per quanto riguarda il trasporto merci e i viaggi d’affari transfrontalieri.

title_en: European supercomputers to be accessible from Serbia – EU building “antenna” for its AI factories here
title_it: Antenne IA per supercomputer europei in Serbia
content_en: (Photo: jamesteohart/shutterstock.com) The European Commission has announced the launch of the “AI Factory Antennas” initiative in seven EU member states - Belgium, Cyprus, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Malta and Slovakia - as well as in partner countries, including Iceland, Moldova, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, North Macedonia and Serbia, foreign media reported. What are “AI Factory Antennas?” Let us remind that, as eKapija wrote in April , the European Commission has identified the establishment of artificial intelligence factories as a strategic priority, as announced in last year’s Artificial Intelligence Innovation Package. The package envisages that by 2025-2026, at least 15 AI factories and several antennas (connected to AI-optimized supercomputers in existing AI factories) will be operational across the EU, enabling a pan-EU “AI ecosystem” and promoting growth by prioritizing access for AI startups and SMEs. At least nine new AI-optimized supercomputers will be acquired and deployed across the EU, more than tripling the current EuroHPC AI computing capacity. The AI factories will be deployed across the following European countries: Austria, Germany, Luxembourg, Sweden, France, Italy, Greece, Spain, Finland, Poland, Bulgaria and Slovenia. And now we’ve also heard where the “antennas” will be located - in fact, hubs, local access points connected to the main AI centers (AI factories), which allow remote access to these resources. The locations were unveiled today by European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen during her visit to the Western Balkans, which she began in Tirana, saying that this way companies from the region are given access to European AI infrastructure, RTT News reported. These Antennas will collaborate closely with AI Factories to provide national AI communities with secure remote access to world-class, AI-optimized supercomputing resources. Fully integrated into the EuroHPC ecosystem, the network aims to expand access to AI talent, infrastructure, and innovation across Europe. Another 6 new AI factories in the EU They also remind that, on Friday, the Commission also announced a major expansion of Europe's AI infrastructure, adding six new AI Factories to the existing network, bringing the total to 19 AI Factories across 16 Member States. This rollout, as said, drives forward the AI Continent Action Plan and complements the EU's investment in future AI Gigafactories, large-scale facilities dedicated to developing and training advanced AI models and frontier systems, while aligning with the Apply AI Strategy to accelerate the uptake of artificial intelligence across Europe’s economy and public sector. content_it:
La Commissione Europea ha annunciato l’avvio dell’iniziativa “Antenne delle Fabbriche di IA” in sette Stati membri (Belgio, Cipro, Ungheria, Irlanda, Lettonia, Malta e Slovacchia) e in Paesi partner, tra cui Islanda, Moldavia, Svizzera, Regno Unito, Macedonia del Nord e Serbia, come riportato da ekapija.com.  

Le “Antenne” sono punti di accesso locali collegati alle Fabbriche di Intelligenza Artificiale – centri dotati di supercomputer ottimizzati per l’IA – e consentono l’accesso remoto a tali risorse. L’iniziativa rientra nel Pacchetto sull’Innovazione nell’Intelligenza Artificiale presentato lo scorso anno, che prevede almeno 15 Fabbriche di IA e diverse Antenne operative entro il 2025-2026.  

Le Fabbriche di IA saranno attive in Austria, Germania, Lussemburgo, Svezia, Francia, Italia, Grecia, Spagna, Finlandia, Polonia, Bulgaria e Slovenia. Grazie a questa rete, le imprese della regione, inclusa la Serbia, potranno accedere all’infrastruttura europea di supercalcolo dedicata all’IA.  

Inoltre, la Commissione ha annunciato l’aggiunta di altre sei Fabbriche di IA, portando il totale a 19 in 16 Stati membri, nell’ambito del Piano d’azione “AI Continent” e della strategia “Apply AI”, finalizzati ad accelerare l’adozione dell’intelligenza artificiale nell’economia e nel settore pubblico europei.  

Questa espansione dell’ecosistema EuroHPC offre opportunità alle aziende italiane di collaborare con nuovi hub tecnologici e accedere a infrastrutture avanzate per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate sull’intelligenza artificiale.

title_en: Quantum computing: Why we mustn’t ignore the three biggest cybersecurity threats
title_it: Minacce quantistiche alla cybersecurity
content_en: (Photo: Wright Studio/shutterstock.com) One of the most talked-about technological challenges of the moment is the rise of quantum computing and its potential impact on digital security. Kaspersky experts have identified three risks associated with quantum computing that require a swift response from the cybersecurity community. What does Moore’s Law have to do with it? Silicon technologies are set to reach their limits in the near future. Moore’s Law, which predicted that transistor density would double every two years, has slowed significantly in recent years as transistors are now atomic-sized, making it even more difficult to miniaturize them. As classical computers approach their physical limits, their performance growth slows, limiting progress in areas that rely on complex calculations. Quantum computers, on the other hand, offer the potential to solve certain problems much faster than classical systems. However, their practical application remains limited to narrow and experimental domains for now - current quantum computers have only a few hundred physical qubits and do not have a robust error correction system. However, experts estimate that we could have a fully reliable quantum computer within the next decade. This would enable significant technological progress, but also open up a new era of cybersecurity threats. The need for an urgent response to these threats is also supported by Deloitte’s Global Future of Cyber 2024 study, according to which 83% of organizations are already assessing or taking steps to mitigate the risks associated with quantum computing, which shows growing awareness and the existence of proactive strategies in the private sector. Governments and corporations around the world are investing enormous amounts of money in the research and development of quantum technologies, further confirming the growing awareness of this topic and proactive planning. The prerequisites for the widespread use of quantum computers in the next 10 to 15 years are already apparent: • Projections for the 2030s suggest that computers will have thousands of qubits. • Google has announced plans to build a machine with a million qubits by the end of the decade. • Leading countries have launched national quantum programs, investing billions of dollars worldwide. • 10 powerful quantum systems are expected to be operational within the next ten years. A target for advanced actors: where do the risks lie? (Photo: Maksim Kabakou/shutterstock.com) Despite the expected computational advantages, the potential of quantum computers raises serious security concerns due to their ability to break today’s widely used encryption methods. While it is unlikely that small-time criminals will get their hands on such advanced and expensive technology, the threat is very real when it comes to advanced persistent threats (APT groups) and state-backed actors. Quantum computers could compromise traditional encryption methods that currently protect data in numerous digital systems, posing a direct threat to the global cybersecurity infrastructure. Potential threats include intercepting and decrypting confidential diplomatic, military, and financial communications, as well as decrypting private negotiations in real time - which quantum systems could do much faster than classical computers, turning confidential conversations into publicly available information. 1. Store now, decrypt later: A key threat in the coming years Threat actors are already collecting encrypted data today, with the intention of decrypting it in the future as quantum capabilities advance. This “store now, decrypt later” tactic could expose sensitive information years after it is transmitted - including diplomatic correspondence, financial transactions, and private communications. This concept is also confirmed by a joint statement of 18 EU member states: “This is a threat in cases where the confidentiality of data must be protected over a long period of time (for example sensitive personal data or trade secrets)... We call on public administrations, critical infrastructure providers, IT companies, and the entire industry to make the transition to post-quantum cryptography an absolute priority... Organizations and governments should start the transition immediately.” 2. Sabotaging of blockchains and cryptocurrencies Blockchain networks are not immune to quantum threats. Bitcoin’s digital signature algorithm (ECDSA), which relies on elliptic cryptography (EC), is particularly vulnerable. Potential risks include: • forging digital signatures, which threatens Bitcoin, Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies, • attacks on ECDSA mechanisms that protect crypto wallets, • altering the history of blockchain transactions, thereby undermining the trust and integrity of the system. 3. Quantum-resistant ransomware solution: a new line of defense It is possible that, in the future, developers and operators of advanced ransomware will start using post-quantum cryptography to protect their malicious programs. Such “quantum-resistant” ransomware would be designed to resist decryption by both classical and quantum computers, making data recovery without paying a ransom almost impossible. – Currently, quantum computing does not offer a way to decrypt files locked by existing ransomware. Data protection and recovery still depend on traditional security solutions and cooperation between law enforcement agencies, quantum technology researchers and international organizations – said Sergey Lozhkin, head of Kaspersky GReAT team for META and APAC. Building a quantum-safe defense Quantum computers do not yet pose a direct threat, but when they do, it may be too late to react. Encrypted data that has long-term value is already at risk of future decryption. “ The cybersecurity community, IT companies, and governments must coordinate activities and efforts to prevent the risks that are coming, and to avoid creating systemic vulnerabilities that cannot be fixed later, ” says Sergey Lozhkin. He adds that “ decision-makers need to develop clear strategies for migrating to post-quantum algorithms, while businesses and researchers should start implementing new security standards now. ” The transition to post-quantum cryptography will take years. Preparations must begin now, because the decisions we make today will define the resilience of our digital infrastructure for decades to come. – Without international coordination and timely infrastructure upgrades, risks to financial, government and corporate data could become critical – Lozhkin warned. Kaspersky Kaspersky Kaspersky GReAT team for META and APAC Sergey Lozhkin quantum computers blockchain confidential data cybersecurity Your comment Send
content_it:
Secondo gli esperti di Kaspersky, il rapido sviluppo del calcolo quantistico pone tre gravi rischi per la sicurezza informatica globale, richiedendo una risposta immediata. Sebbene i computer quantistici attuali dispongano solo di poche centinaia di qubit e non abbiano ancora sistemi robusti di correzione degli errori, si prevede che entro un decennio possano diventare pienamente affidabili. Ciò consentirebbe progressi tecnologici significativi, ma minaccerebbe anche gli attuali metodi di crittografia.  

La prima minaccia è la strategia “archivia ora, decifra in seguito”: attori malevoli stanno già raccogliendo dati crittografati con l’intento di decifrarli in futuro. La seconda riguarda le blockchain e le criptovalute: algoritmi come l’ECDSA su cui si basano Bitcoin ed Ethereum sono vulnerabili agli attacchi quantistici, con rischi di falsificazione di firme digitali e alterazione della cronologia delle transazioni. La terza minaccia è l’emergere di ransomware “quantum-resistant”, che potrebbero utilizzare crittografia post-quantistica per rendere impossibile il recupero dei dati senza pagare il riscatto.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, un documento congiunto di 18 Stati membri dell’UE sottolinea l’urgenza di adottare la crittografia post-quantistica, soprattutto per proteggere dati sensibili a lungo termine. Sergey Lozhkin, a capo del team Kaspersky GReAT per META e APAC, avverte che la transizione richiederà anni e deve iniziare subito: “Le decisioni prese oggi definiranno la resilienza delle nostre infrastrutture digitali per decenni”. Senza coordinamento internazionale e aggiornamenti tempestivi, i dati finanziari, governativi e aziendali potrebbero trovarsi a rischio critico.

title_en: Vucic asks von der Leyen for Serbia to be exempted from steel tariffs and quotas
title_it: Serbia chiede esenzione dai dazi sull'acciaio
content_en: Illustration (Photo: ruhmal/shutterstock) Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said today that he had submitted a letter to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen requesting that Serbia be exempted from tariffs and new quotas for steel, although only Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein could do so. – I also asked and believe that the European Commission will find a way to ease the status of candidate countries at least a little and make things easier on this issue – Vucic said after a meeting with von der Leyen in Belgrade. Speaking about US sanctions on Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), he said that when the company was under US sanctions, it was de facto also under European sanctions. – This problem is not easily solvable for us. I hope that we will have the support and assistance of the EU in all issues of importance for Serbia’s energy security and stability – Vucic said. He added that Serbia would continue to develop energy infrastructure with Europe and that interconnectors would be built towards North Macedonia and Romania. – Let’s see how and in what way we can strengthen Serbia in terms of the possibility of diversifying energy sources – he said. He added that they had discussed preserving peace and stability in the region, as well as the dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina, adding that he believed that it could continue in a constructive manner. – I will not use the opportunity to criticize anyone else, except to say that it takes two to tango – said Vucic. Il presidente ha inoltre affrontato il tema delle sanzioni statunitensi su Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), sottolineando che queste comportavano di fatto anche sanzioni europee. “Questa situazione non è di facile soluzione per noi. Confidiamo nel sostegno dell’UE in tutte le questioni cruciali per la sicurezza energetica e la stabilità della Serbia”, ha aggiunto.  

Vučić ha confermato la volontà di sviluppare ulteriormente le infrastrutture energetiche in collaborazione con l’Europa, con l’obiettivo di realizzare interconnessioni con la Romania e la Macedonia del Nord per diversificare le fonti energetiche. Ha infine ribadito l’importanza del dialogo tra Belgrado e Pristina, auspicando un proseguimento costruttivo, e ha sottolineato che “per ballare il tango ci vogliono due”.  

L’eventuale esenzione dalle misure protezionistiche sull’acciaio potrebbe aprire nuove opportunità commerciali per le imprese italiane operanti nel settore siderurgico e nella subfornitura metalmeccanica in Serbia.

title_en: World’s biggest mining company also targeting Serbian treasure – Australia’s BHP agrees earning of 7 copper and gold exploration permits for Zajecar area
title_it: BHP punta sul rame e oro in Serbia
content_en: (Photo: Jaromir Chalabala/shutterstock.com) Mundoro Capital Inc. has announced that it has entered into a definitive option agreement with a wholly owned subsidiary of BHP Group Limited, in which Mundoro has granted to BHP an option to earn-in to seven of Mundoro’s exploration licenses in Serbia. The Central Timok Project near Zajecar contains numerous targets, with the most advanced being the Skorusa copper-gold porphyry system, the Tilva Rosh Prospect, where trenching returned 12 meters at 30.39 g/t Au and 171.27 g/t Ag, and additional prospective targets include Markov Kamen, Orlovo, D-vein, Prekostenski, Zlot 1-3, Bukova, Tilva Mare, Glavica, Bacevica North, Gorunov, Oblez SE and Branik, on a total of 418 square kilometers. Pursuant to the agreement, Mundoro has granted to BHP, which is one of the biggest mining companies in the world along with Rio Tinto, an option to earn, over 10 years, a 100% interest in the BHP-Mundoro Central Timok Project.  To exercise the option, BHP must fund cumulative exploration expenditures up to USD 35 million. Mundoro will operate the project and retains a 2% NSR royalty upon exercise. Mundoro has been looking for gold and copper in the Timok region in Serbia since 2011. Let us remind that this is not the first cooperation between Mundoro and BHP in Serbia. In January 2023, the Canadians also signed an option agreement with the Australians, according to which BHP has the opportunity to acquire ownership in three Serbian copper projects – Bor Lake, South Timok and the Trstenik exploration area. BHP subsequently established a subsidiary in Serbia, BHP Metals Exploration doo, whose owner, according to data from the Serbian Business Registers Agency, is BHP Billiton (the old name for BHP). According to the 2023 agreement, BHP received the right to acquire a 100% stake in each of the mentioned projects by paying approximately USD 1.7 million in cash, paying operating fees to Mundoro over a period of three years, and also bearing exploration costs in the amount of USD 7.5 million on three projects over three years. Read more: Australians looking for gold 100 km from Belgrade – Company buys drilling rights on 62,000 hectares in Serbia, starting with Bobija Gold keeps pouring out of Rogozna, Australians bringing in more drills – New lode struck at Gradina with over 10 grams per ton Australian company eyeing Serbian gold again – Drilling also to be done in Ibar Valley BHP announced at the time that it intended to focus on “raw materials of the future” for these projects, including copper, nickel and potassium. Teo Dechev, CEO of Mundoro commented in a statement on the occasion of the signing of the latest agreement with BHP that “we are pleased to announce the expansion of our strategic partnership with BHP, a world leader in the resources industry.” – This deepened collaboration focuses on exploring a package of additional exploration licenses in the highly prospective Timok region of eastern Serbia for copper porphyry systems. This integrated approach, which draws upon Mundoro’s deep understanding of local geological conditions and BHP’s cutting-edge global exploration methodologies, is designed to enhance targeting capabilities and significantly increase the likelihood of new discoveries within the Timok region. We believe this expanded partnership will drive value for both companies and has the potential to contribute to the economic development of eastern Serbia – said Dechev. A total of CAD 15.4 million has been spent on the project by Mundoro and previous partners, the press release adds. B. P. BHP Metals Exploration d.o.o. content_it:
Mundoro Capital Inc. ha annunciato la stipula di un accordo definitivo con una controllata del gruppo australiano BHP, uno dei maggiori operatori minerari mondiali insieme a Rio Tinto. L’accordo prevede che BHP possa acquisire, entro 10 anni, il 100% di sette permessi esplorativi detenuti da Mundoro nella regione di Zaječar, in Serbia, nell’ambito del Central Timok Project. Per esercitare l’opzione, BHP dovrà sostenere spese esplorative per un totale di 35 milioni di dollari. Mundoro continuerà a gestire il progetto e manterrà una royalty del 2% sulle entrate nette (NSR).  

Il progetto riguarda un’area di 418 km² e include diversi target promettenti, tra cui il sistema porfirico rame-oro di Skorusa e la prospezione Tilva Rosh, dove scavi superficiali hanno restituito valori di 12 metri con 30,39 g/t di oro e 171,27 g/t di argento.  

Questa collaborazione non è la prima tra le due società in Serbia: nel gennaio 2023, BHP aveva già acquisito diritti su altri tre progetti (Lago di Bor, South Timok e Trstenik), impegnandosi a investire 7,5 milioni di dollari in tre anni. BHP ha inoltre costituito in Serbia la controllata BHP Metals Exploration doo, registrata presso l’Agenzia serba per il registro delle imprese.  

Secondo il CEO di Mundoro, Teo Dechev, questa estensione del partenariato strategico punta a valorizzare le conoscenze geologiche locali di Mundoro e le metodologie esplorative globali di BHP, aumentando le probabilità di nuove scoperte nel promettente distretto del Timok. Come riportato da ekapija.com, tale collaborazione potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nel settore minerario e nei servizi connessi all’esplorazione e all’estrazione di metalli strategici.

title_en: Pirot carpet - a combination of tradition, female entrepreneurship and business prestige
title_it: Il tappeto di Pirot: tradizione e imprenditoria femminile
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Keni) The Pirot carpet (kilim) is a combination of tradition, female entrepreneurship and business prestige. In a time when corporate gifts are often uniform and impersonal, one authentic product from Serbia is becoming a choice that combines tradition, art and business prestige - the Pirot carpet . More than a souvenir, it represents a gesture of respect, identity and deep cultural continuity . A gift with soul and meaning Giving a Pirot carpet as a gift is not just an act of attention - it is passing on a piece of Serbian cultural heritage . Each carpet is hand-woven , unique and unrepeatable, made with the care and love of weavers who inherited this skill from their mothers and grandmothers. Motifs such as “turtle” (longevity), “sofra” (abundance) or “bombs” (fertility) carry deep symbolism, which is why each carpet has its own story and becomes an amulet of good wishes. In the world of generic business gifts, the Pirot carpet stands out as a gift with character and identity , which not only enhances the space, but also conveys a message of authenticity, durability and respect for culture - values that distinguish successful companies. Pirot carpet making and UNESCO: recognition of craft and female entrepreneurship Today, Pirot carpet making is receiving well-deserved attention and global recognition. It is not the carpet itself that is being protected, but Pirot carpet making as an old craft and part of the intangible cultural heritage of Serbia , recognized as an important form of female entrepreneurship and local development. The nomination of Pirot carpet making for the UNESCO list of intangible cultural heritage confirms that this tradition has invaluable importance for preserving identity and cultural diversity. By giving a Pirot carpet in this context, companies are giving their partners a piece of living heritage – a combination of art, tradition and social responsibility. Authenticity and quality that lasts The Pirot carpet is made using the “front-to-back” technique, without knots, from wool from Stara planina , known for its durability and color fastness. This artisanal process requires exceptional precision, and the result is a carpet that lasts for decades and retains its original appearance and shine. Authenticity is also reflected in the motifs - more than 120 recognizable geometric and floral patterns, each with its own symbolism. That is why the Pirot carpet is not seen only as a decorative object, but as a work of art and part of the cultural identity of Serbia . The Pirot carpet as a reflection of business values For companies that strive for their gifts to reflect true values - quality, durability and respect for tradition - the Pirot carpet is the perfect choice. It conveys a message of reliability, elegance and authenticity, and at the same time represents a unique cultural bridge between Serbia and international partners . In a business environment, a rug can decorate an office, conference room or reception area, bringing warmth and the spirit of tradition. It is a memorable gift - not as an object, but as a symbol of attention and respect. KilimArts&Crafts - keepers of authenticity and tradition Authentic Pirot carpets can be found through the company KilimArts&Crafts d.o.o. , which is dedicated to preserving crafts and supporting local weavers. The website kilim.rs exclusively offers carpets with a certificate of protected geographical origin , made in Pirot using traditional techniques. By purchasing through KilimArts&Crafts , you not only get an original product, but also directly support female entrepreneurship and the preservation of cultural heritage . Every carpet that leaves the “Damsko srce” workshop in Pirot carries a story about the identity, skill and pride of generations of women who preserve this old craft. More than a gift - a message about values A Pirot carpet is not just a gift. It is a story about tradition, art and social responsibility , about Serbia that does not forget its heritage, but turns it into a contemporary value. Gift a carpet that speaks - and be part of preserving one of the most beautiful expressions of Serbian culture. Visit kilim.rs and discover a collection of authentic carpets that carry the spirit of Pirot, tradition and female creativity. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) 1. Where can I buy an original Pirot carpet? Original Pirot carpets are available exclusively from certified manufacturers and sellers, such as KilimArts&Crafts . All their products have a certificate of protected geographical origin , which guarantees authenticity. 2. How can I recognize a real Pirot carpet? A real kilim has a “front-to-back” weaving technique (it is identical on both sides) and is made without knots. The material is always natural wool , and the motifs have traditional names and symbolism (e.g. “turtle”, “bombs”, “wreath”). 3. How much does a Pirot carpet cost? The price depends on the dimensions, complexity of the motif and the density of the weave. Hand-woven kilims are an investment in art and durability , not a mass-produced product - each piece is unique. 4. Is a Pirot carpet suitable as a corporate gift? Yes. The Pirot carpet is the perfect authentic corporate gift from Serbia, as it combines tradition, art and a message of lasting values. It is ideal for foreign partners, embassies, international organizations and cultural institutions. 5. Who is behind the production of original kilims today? Authentic kilims are made by female artists from Pirot , gathered around the workshop “ Damsko srce ” and the company KilimArts&Crafts , which is dedicated to the promotion and preservation of this craft and female entrepreneurship. Il tappeto (kilim) di Pirot rappresenta un connubio tra tradizione, imprenditoria femminile e prestigio aziendale. In un’epoca in cui i doni aziendali risultano spesso impersonali, questo prodotto autentico della Serbia si distingue per la sua carica simbolica, artistica e culturale. Ogni pezzo è tessuto a mano, unico e irripetibile, realizzato con cura da artigiane che tramandano la tecnica di generazione in generazione. I motivi tradizionali — come la “tartaruga” (longevità), la “sofra” (abbondanza) o le “bombe” (fertilità) — portano con sé significati profondi, trasformando ogni tappeto in un vero e proprio amuleto di buoni auspici.

L’arte della tessitura del kilim di Pirot è riconosciuta come patrimonio culturale immateriale della Serbia e candidata per l’iscrizione nella lista UNESCO, in quanto espressione storica di imprenditoria femminile e sviluppo locale. Realizzato con lana della Stara Planina e con la tecnica “fronte-retro” (senza nodi), il tappeto mantiene nel tempo colore, lucentezza e forma.

Per le aziende che desiderano trasmettere valori autentici — qualità, durata e rispetto per la tradizione — il kilim di Pirot è un dono significativo, capace di arredare spazi di rappresentanza e creare un ponte culturale con i partner internazionali.

I tappeti autentici sono prodotti dall’atelier “Damsko srce” e commercializzati da KilimArts&Crafts d.o.o., unica fonte certificata con marchio di origine geografica protetta. L’acquisto sostiene direttamente l’artigianato locale e l’imprenditoria femminile. Come riportato da ekapija.com, ogni tappeto racconta una storia di identità, abilità e orgoglio femminile.

Per le imprese italiane, il kilim di Pirot rappresenta un’opportunità per offrire doni aziendali distintivi, carichi di significato culturale e di valore artistico, ideali per consolidare relazioni internazionali con un tocco di autenticità balcanica.

title_en: Representatives of United Nations Working Group on Business and Human Rights visit Zijin Copper in Bor
title_it: Visita dell’ONU a Zijin Copper in Bor
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Dragan Mujan) The interim report that we will present to the Serbian public on October 15 will be short, but we will balance all the positive effects that you have achieved, which are undeniable, with areas where there is still room for improvement, said Lyra Jakuleviciene, a representative of the United Nations Working Group on Business and Human Rights. She made this statement during a visit to Bor, during which the working group met with the management of Serbia Zijin Copper . – The mining sector is not a sector that does not have an impact on the environment and human rights – she stated. The aim of the visit was to get informed about the company’s further plans and the challenges that Serbia Zijin Copper faces in the implementation of current and future business activities. The UN delegation presented to the General Director of Serbia Zijin, Qiu Guozhu, the mandate of the Working Group as well as issues of importance for its work, primarily on the implementation of UN principles in the field of business, business entities and human rights. – We are independent experts dealing with human rights. We are not interested in politics, we do not work for any company or government. We collect information on the ground and that is why we wanted to come to Bor. Not all companies will allow such a visit and that is why we are grateful that you opened your doors to us. We look at issues in the field of business and human rights from our own perspective, business entities probably do not have the same view and that is why it was important for us to meet with you and to take into account everything we heard from you when compiling the interim report – added Jakuleviciene. Qiu Guozhu emphasized that it was necessary to invest a lot of energy, effort and investment in improving, above all, the historical heritage of a century of mining in that region because seven years was too short to completely put in order what had been neglected for decades. – Your guidelines in promoting the implementation of the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights around the world are closely aligned with our corporate vision and values. We constantly align our operations with the best international practices in the areas of human rights, labor, safety and environmental protection and we firmly believe that responsible business conduct is not only an obligation, but also a key driver of sustainable local development. Therefore, we respect the principles of openness, transparency, cooperation and mutual benefit – said Qiu. At the meeting that followed the tour of the metallurgy complex, the implementation of current mining projects, the implementation of environmental protection principles, cooperation with the local community and corporate social responsibility were discussed. During the meeting, it was emphasized that the company had paid the greatest attention in the past period to the area of environmental protection, the statement says. They stated that numerous measures had been implemented to improve the quality of air, water and soil, which had yielded excellent results compared to the period before the arrival of the strategic partner. Representatives of the United Nations Working Group on Business and Human Rights emphasized that Zijin was one of the few companies that had included a complaint mechanism for employees in its operations. content_it:
Lyra Jakuleviciene, rappresentante del Gruppo di Lavoro delle Nazioni Unite su Imprese e Diritti Umani, ha dichiarato durante la visita a Bor che la relazione interinale, che sarà presentata al pubblico serbo il 15 ottobre, sarà breve ma equilibrata, riconoscendo gli indubbi effetti positivi raggiunti dall’azienda e le aree in cui sono ancora necessari miglioramenti. Il Gruppo ha incontrato la direzione di Serbia Zijin Copper per approfondire i piani futuri dell’azienda e le sfide legate alle sue attività minerarie, settore che inevitabilmente impatta sull’ambiente e sui diritti umani.

Jakuleviciene ha sottolineato l’indipendenza del loro mandato: “Non siamo interessati alla politica, né lavoriamo per governi o aziende. Raccogliamo informazioni sul campo, e apprezziamo che Zijin abbia accolto la nostra richiesta di visita, cosa non scontata”. Il direttore generale di Serbia Zijin, Qiu Guozhu, ha ricordato gli ingenti sforzi compiuti negli ultimi anni per affrontare l’eredità ambientale di un secolo di attività estrattive, evidenziando che sette anni sono insufficienti per risolvere decenni di degrado. Ha inoltre affermato che la visione aziendale è pienamente allineata ai Principi Guida delle Nazioni Unite su Imprese e Diritti Umani, con un impegno costante verso le migliori pratiche internazionali in materia di diritti umani, sicurezza, lavoro e tutela ambientale.

Durante l’incontro, seguito da un sopralluogo allo stabilimento metallurgico, sono stati discussi i progetti minerari in corso, la protezione ambientale, la cooperazione con la comunità locale e la responsabilità sociale d’impresa. L’azienda ha confermato di aver dedicato particolare attenzione alla qualità di aria, acqua e suolo, ottenendo risultati significativi rispetto al periodo precedente l’arrivo del socio strategico. Il Gruppo ONU ha inoltre riconosciuto che Zijin è tra le poche aziende del settore ad aver istituito un meccanismo interno per la gestione delle denunce dei dipendenti. Le informazioni raccolte contribuiranno alla stesura della relazione interinale, come riportato da ekapija.com. Per le imprese italiane specializzate in tecnologie ambientali e in soluzioni per la sostenibilità industriale, il rinnovato impegno di Zijin Copper potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità di collaborazione in un contesto in evoluzione.

title_en: New “mini-port” to be built on 58 ha in Krnjaca – Green permit requested for bulk cargo terminal worth EUR 83.4 million
title_it: Nuovo terminal merci alla rinfusa a Belgrado
content_en: (Photo: ECOlogica URBO/Zahtev za određivanja obima i sadržaja studije o proceni uticaja na životnu sredinu, screenshot) The Port Governance Agency has submitted a request to the Ministry of Environmental Protection for approval of the Environmental Impact Assessment Study for the Construction Project of a Bulk Cargo Terminal for the New Port of Belgrade. The location in question is in Krnjaca, where one of the two planned terminals will be built within the port area of the new port on the Danube. In addition to the terminal in Krnjaca, the new main port complex in Belgrade will also be located upstream of the Pupin Bridge , also on the Banat side of the river. The Environmental Impact Assessment Study was prepared by the companies ECOlogica URBO from Kragujevac and Ehting from Belgrade. The urban planning project covers an area of approximately 57.9 hectares. The planned bulk cargo terminal will be of the open type, with an operational quay of 630 meters in length and six transshipment points (berths) with a total length of 105 meters. The project envisages the construction of an operational quay and the terminal’s backfill area, a raw material dump, a sub-terminal for the separation of sand and gravel, a sub-terminal for concrete aggregates and concrete and asphalt bases, an administration building with vehicle access control and a building next to the scale, facilities for port operators, a transformer station and a connecting switchgear, traffic areas and parking lots, a corridor for the passage of the railroad track according to the port’s DRP, as well as green areas. The administration building will have a floor area of GF+1, consisting of 18 container units, with offices, video surveillance rooms and a meeting room. 12 buildings for port operators will be built behind the berths, which represents the maximum number of possible operators on the site. The location requirements for the project were issued at the end of 2024, while the companies that will carry out the technical control of the project for the construction permit were recently selected. In the tender announced by the Port Governance Agency in early July, the contract was won by the Institute of Transportation CIP, Axis gradjevinski biro from Sremska Kamenica and Statik from Kovin, as the only bidders. The construction of the complex is planned in two phases. In the first phase, key infrastructure elements such as the operational quay, terminal, administrative building, vehicle entrance and internal infrastructure will be completed, while in the second phase, after the completion of the first one, the construction of port operator facilities will follow in accordance with the needs and dynamics of activating the entire complex. As eKapija previously wrote, the value of the investment is estimated at around EUR 83.4 million , and construction is planned to begin this year and be completed by 2027. I. Z.
