content_it:
L’Agenzia per la pianificazione territoriale e urbanistica della Repubblica di Serbia ha annunciato la presentazione pubblica del progetto di sviluppo urbanistico e architettonico per la centrale solare Kolubara A, che prevede la chiusura e la bonifica della discarica di ceneri, scorie e carbone del sito. Il progetto, redatto da Andzor Engineering di Novi Sad per conto di Elektroprivreda Srbije (EPS), sarà consultabile dal pubblico dall’8 al 15 ottobre.  

La costruzione di impianti fotovoltaici sulle discariche delle centrali termoelettriche Kolubara A e Morava – entrambe destinate alla dismissione – era stata annunciata tre anni fa. Lo scorso anno, EPS aveva indetto una gara per la documentazione urbanistica, rivelando una potenza installata di 71 MW per Kolubara A e 45 MW per Morava. Entrambi i progetti includono anche interventi di messa in sicurezza e riqualificazione ambientale delle aree.  

Il rilascio del permesso di costruzione è previsto entro la fine del 2025. Secondo quanto dichiarato nel 2023 dall’amministratore delegato di EPS, Dušan Živković, l’azienda prevede di investire 5,4 miliardi di euro in progetti di energie rinnovabili entro il 2030.  

La centrale termoelettrica Kolubara A, in funzione dal 1956 vicino alle miniere a cielo aperto di Veliki Crljeni, è la più antica del sistema serbo, con una capacità di 271 MW suddivisa in cinque unità. Il processo di dismissione, avviato nel 2023 con una gara per il progetto concettuale di conservazione, interessa anche la centrale termoelettrica Morava.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, questo progetto rappresenta un passo significativo nella transizione energetica della Serbia, con opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in ingegneria energetica, bonifica ambientale e tecnologie fotovoltaiche.

title_en: US Treasury Department issues special license to NIS until October 8
title_it: Proroga licenza speciale per NIS fino all'8 ottobre
content_en: (Photo: Adriana Iacob/shutterstock.com) On September 30, the US Treasury Department issued a new special license that postponed the entry of full sanctions against NIS into force, and allowed the company to continue its operating activities until October 8, 2025, at the latest, Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) announced today. NIS reminds that it has also submitted an additional request for removal from the SDN (Specially Designated Nationals) list. This is a lengthy and complex process, and the initial request was sent on March 14 of this year. NIS continues with the activities aimed at overcoming the current situation, and it will inform the public about any new circumstances that may affect the company’s operations, in a timely manner, the statement concludes. JANAF: license for transport to Pancevo extended by another week Jadranski Naftovod (JANAF) has obtained a license allowing the implementation of the Crude Oil Transportation Agreement concluded with the company NIS a.d. , valid until October 8, 2025, says the press release reported by Beta. The press release adds that, in the coming days, JANAF, through its US attorney and with the support of the Government of the Republic of Croatia, “will submit a request to OFAC for an extension of the license.” NIS a.d.’s activities towards the US authorities will play a key role in the extension of the license after October 8, 2025, the press release adds. Il 30 settembre il Dipartimento del Tesoro degli Stati Uniti ha rilasciato una nuova licenza speciale che posticipa l’entrata in vigore delle sanzioni complete contro Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), consentendo alla società di proseguire le proprie attività operative fino all’8 ottobre 2025, come annunciato oggi da NIS. L’azienda ricorda inoltre di aver presentato una richiesta aggiuntiva per la rimozione dalla lista SDN (Specially Designated Nationals). Si tratta di un processo lungo e complesso; la prima richiesta era stata inviata il 14 marzo di quest’anno. NIS prosegue le attività finalizzate a superare la situazione attuale e si impegna a informare tempestivamente il pubblico su eventuali nuovi sviluppi che possano influenzare le sue operazioni, come riportato da ekapija.com.

Parallelamente, Jadranski Naftovod (JANAF) ha ottenuto una licenza che consente l’esecuzione dell’accordo per il trasporto di greggio stipulato con NIS, valida anch’essa fino all’8 ottobre 2025, secondo quanto riferito dall’agenzia Beta. Nei prossimi giorni, JANAF, tramite il proprio legale statunitense e con il supporto del Governo della Repubblica di Croazia, presenterà a OFAC una richiesta di ulteriore proroga della licenza. Le iniziative intraprese da NIS presso le autorità statunitensi saranno decisive per ottenere un’estensione della licenza dopo la data del 8 ottobre 2025.

Questa situazione potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità per le imprese italiane operanti nel settore energetico e nella logistica petrolifera, qualora si concretizzasse una stabilizzazione delle condizioni operative di NIS e dei suoi partner.

title_en: REF-G and REF-T forms to be implemented
title_it: Nuovi moduli REF-G e REF-T per rimborso accise
content_en: (Photo: VGstockstudio/shutterstock.com) The Tax Administration has informed taxpayers that, starting today, October 1, 2025, new REF-G and REF-T forms will be used in the procedure for submitting requests for refunds of excise duty paid on oil derivatives, biofuels and bioliquids used for transport purposes and for heating. The replacement of the forms was carried out based on the Regulation on amendments to the Regulation on detailed conditions, manner and procedure for exercising the right to refunds of excise duty paid on oil derivatives from Article 9, paragraph 1, items 3), 5) and 7) of the Law on Excise Duties, used for transport purposes and for heating. The previous forms, which were in use until September 30, 2025, cease to be valid, the Tax Administration said in a statement. Taxpayers are obliged to submit requests exclusively on the new forms starting today. The new forms REF-G - Request for refund of excise duty paid on oil derivatives, i.e. bioliquids and REF-T - Request for refund of excise duty paid on oil derivatives, i.e. biofuels, are available on the Tax Administration website in the Legal Entities/Entrepreneurs/Individuals-Tax Returns and Forms section. Poreska uprava Srbije Tax Administration new REF G i REF T forms requests for refund of excise duty paid on oil derivatives bioliquids and biofuels Your comment Send
content_it: L’Amministrazione fiscale serba ha comunicato che, a decorrere dal 1° ottobre 2025, saranno utilizzati i nuovi moduli REF-G e REF-T per le richieste di rimborso dell’accisa pagata su derivati del petrolio, biocarburanti e bioliquidi impiegati per il trasporto e il riscaldamento. Tale modifica deriva dal Regolamento recante modifiche al Regolamento sulle condizioni, le modalità e la procedura per l’esercizio del diritto al rimborso delle accise, ai sensi dell’articolo 9, comma 1, punti 3), 5) e 7) della Legge sulle accise. I moduli precedentemente in uso fino al 30 settembre 2025 non sono più validi. I contribuenti devono presentare le domande esclusivamente con i nuovi moduli, disponibili sul sito dell’Amministrazione fiscale nella sezione “Persone giuridiche/Imprenditori/Privati – Dichiarazioni e moduli”. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la novità interessa imprese che operano nel settore energetico e dei biocarburanti, settori in cui le aziende italiane potrebbero trovare opportunità di collaborazione o fornitura grazie alla crescente attenzione alla sostenibilità energetica.

title_en: Lozionica officially opened – New address of eGovernment House, which will be home to AI and Cyber districts, Open Data Hub and Digital District (PHOTO)
title_it: Nuova sede per la Pubblica Amministrazione digitale
content_en: (Photo: Facebook/Kancelarija za IT i eUpravu) After extensive work and reconstruction and expansion of the preserved rail infrastructure, the Lozionica complex was officially opened in the Sava Amphitheater on the site of the former rail complex, which will also be home to the eGovernment House in the future. (Photo: Facebook/Aleksandar Vučić) As stated by the Office for IT and eGovernment, the place where a rail facility was built 100 years ago in 1925, which was the initiator of the second industrial revolution at the time, has been completely reconstructed and adapted. The works included the reconstruction of Lozionica on all 4,800 square meters, while preserving its recognizable appearance, as well as the water tower and the turn, but also the construction of the eGovernment House, which covers an area of 11,000 square meters. The eGovernment House is designed as a place where employees of the Office for IT and eGovernment, together with the economy and the startup community, and with the support of experts in the field of science and technology, will continue to work on new IT solutions. (Photo: Facebook/Aleksandar Vučić) As announced, an AI district, a cyber district, an open data hub, and a digital district will be formed in the eGovernment House. The entire complex covers more than 23,000 square meters. The Lozionica also houses a hall for events and gatherings, as well as numerous spaces for various creative activities. The renovation work on Lozionica began approximately two years ago, and the goal of the reconstruction is to preserve the cultural and historical heritage while adding modern elements. (Photo: Facebook/Aleksandar Vučić) – Today, after a century, Lozionica has come to life as a symbol of the combination of tradition and innovation, a place where the past and the future are building a modern and digital Serbia. At the eGovernment House, I presented the most important results and projects of the Office, such as the “Baby, Welcome to the World” project, the results of eGovernment in the fight against the Covid-19 pandemic, the “My eDiary” platform, the abolition of health card verification, as well as the “green” savings that have arisen as a result of the digitalization of public administration. I invite all young experts to start a career at the Office for IT and eGovernment. By investing in new generations of experts, we are building the foundations of a modern, safe, innovative and digital Serbia – says the announcements of the Office for IT and eGovernment and Mihailo Jovanovic, the director of this office. Fotografije: +26 Opis: Kako je navedeno iz Kancelarije za IT i eUpravu, potpuno je rekonstruisano i adaptirano mesto gde je 1925. pre 100 godina sagrađena železnička ložionica. Radovi su obuhvatili rekonstrukciju Ložionice na svih 4.800 m2, uz očuvanje prepoznatljivog izgleda, kao i vodotornja i okretnice, ali i izgradnju Kuće eUprave koja se prostire na 11.000 m2. Kuća eUprave zamišljena je kao mesto gde će zaposleni Kancelarije za IT i eUpravu zajedno sa privredom i startap zajednicom, a uz podršku stručnjaka iz oblasti nauke i tehnologije, dalje raditi na novim IT rešenjima. U Kući eUprave, kako je najavljeno, biće formirani AI distrikt, Cyber distrikt, Open data hub, kao i Digital distrikt. Kompletan kompleks prostire se na više od 23.000 m2. U Ložionici se nalazi i sala za događaje i okupljanja, kao i brojni prostori za razne aktivnosti kreativaca. (2025) Vidi sve Kancelarija za informacione tehnologije i elektronsku upravu Beograd Ložionica d.o.o. Beograd Ložionica Belgrade eGovernment House Mihailo Jovanović Your comment Send
content_it:
Nell’Anfiteatro della Sava, sul sito del precedente complesso ferroviario, è stato ufficialmente inaugurato il complesso Lozionica, che ospiterà in futuro la Casa dell’eGovernment. Come riportato da ekapija.com, il luogo, dove nel 1925 fu costruita una struttura ferroviaria simbolo della seconda rivoluzione industriale, è stato integralmente ristrutturato e adattato alle nuove esigenze. I lavori hanno riguardato la ricostruzione di Lozionica su una superficie di 4.800 metri quadrati, mantenendone l’aspetto originale, compresi il vecchio serbatoio idrico e la piattaforma girevole, nonché la costruzione della Casa dell’eGovernment, che si estende su 11.000 metri quadrati.  

L’edificio sarà sede di un distretto sull’intelligenza artificiale, un cyber distretto, un Open Data Hub e un Digital District, con una superficie totale del complesso superiore a 23.000 metri quadrati. Lozionica ospita inoltre una sala eventi e spazi dedicati ad attività creative. La ristrutturazione, iniziata circa due anni fa, mira a coniugare la salvaguardia del patrimonio storico con elementi di innovazione tecnologica.  

Secondo gli annunci della Direzione per le Tecnologie dell’Informazione e l’eGovernment, guidata da Mihailo Jovanović, la struttura rappresenterà un polo di sviluppo per collaborazioni tra pubblica amministrazione, imprese, startup e mondo accademico. Tra i progetti presentati figurano “Baby, benvenuto nel mondo”, le soluzioni eGovernment impiegate durante la pandemia di Covid-19, la piattaforma “Il mio eDiario”, l’abolizione della verifica della tessera sanitaria e i risparmi ambientali ottenuti grazie alla digitalizzazione della pubblica amministrazione.  

Alle imprese italiane attive nei settori delle tecnologie digitali, della cibersicurezza, della gestione dei dati e della trasformazione digitale della pubblica amministrazione si aprono potenziali opportunità di collaborazione con le istituzioni serbe in un contesto di crescente investimento in infrastrutture tecnologiche.

title_en: Serbia exporting more despite global turbulence – Stellantis and Chinese companies pillars of growth
title_it: Export serbo in crescita nonostante le turbolenze globali
content_en: (Photo: eKapija / Aleksandra Kekić) While the exports of some of the leading European economies are dropping, caught between the hammer and the anvil of America and China, those of Serbia grew in the first eight months of this year. The exports of Serbia in the first eight months of this year are higher by 8.6%. The imports are growing too, because we have to import energy. Although a deficit of 5.7% was recorded, the good news is that the exports grew by more than the imports. Along with Chinese companies, this year’s exports were driven by Stellantis as well. The Kragujevac factory exported around EUR 300 million worth of electric and hybrid vehicles, mostly to Italy, but also to other countries. There is something, however, which is even more important than numbers. – Two thirds of our goods exports are highly processed products. That indicates that we have certainly achieved good results when it comes to industrialization, because what we export brings a higher added value. So, of the nearly 22 billion worth of exports in the first eight months, around 15 billion are highly processed products – says Minister of Domestic and Foreign Trade Jagoda Lazarevic. That has contributed to the export-import coverage ratio reaching 80%, but also Serbia having surplus with some countries with which it previously had a deficit, such as the Czech Republic and Slovakia. There is also Bulgaria, Romania and the CEFTA countries. An export-import coverage ratio of 105% with Germany has been achieved for the first time. Exports to America are slowly growing as well. China is fourth. Copper ores accounting for ninety percent of exports True, 90% of the exports are copper ore, concentrate, copper cathodes and other products of Chinese companies in Serbia, but the remaining part is not negligible either. – There are plenty of products when it comes to our exports to China, a wide range, from combined refrigerators, freezers, some electronics, there are prunes, frozen raspberries. So, there are both industrial and agricultural-food products and that range is widening – says Minister Jagoda Lazarevic. Drop in direct foreign investments Each euro earned from exports is much needed, especially now that, primarily due to the global crises, there is a drop in direct foreign investments by around 40%, which were crucial for covering the payment balance current account deficit. – There is a fragmentation of the world economy now and plenty of hope is placed on diplomacy, on the Government managing to secure, through negotiations, the kinds of conditions that have been present for the economy of Serbia in those markets so far, or better relative to the competition. What’s also important now, concretely in terms of possibilities, is support in the green transformation of companies in Serbia in adopting new standards which are necessary in order for them to remain in the existing supply chains or get included in new ones – says Bojan Stanic from the Chamber of Commerce of Serbia. New markets opening The Free Trade Agreement with Egypt has opened the market of north Africa, and the United Arab Emirates also provide a shortcut to other countries of the Gulf. Free trade negotiations with South Korea have started, and there are also efforts to increase exports to Japan. A continuation of the negotiations about getting an acceptable level of customs fees with America, which has an impact on that and other markets, remains another key task. Fotografije: Ministarstvo unutrašnje i spoljne trgovine Republike Srbije Privredna komora Srbije FCA Srbija Kragujevac Ministry of Trade Stellantis Chamber of Commerce of Serbia Bojan Stanić Jagoda Lazarević exports copper automotive industry Your comment Send
content_it:
Nonostante il calo delle esportazioni in alcune delle principali economie europee, la Serbia ha registrato nei primi otto mesi dell’anno un aumento delle proprie esportazioni dell’8,6%, come riportato da ekapija.com. Le importazioni sono anch’esse cresciute, principalmente per il fabbisogno energetico, portando a un deficit commerciale del 5,7%, tuttavia le esportazioni sono aumentate a un ritmo superiore rispetto alle importazioni.

A trainare la crescita sono state soprattutto le aziende cinesi e Stellantis: lo stabilimento di Kragujevac ha esportato veicoli elettrici e ibridi per circa 300 milioni di euro, principalmente verso l’Italia. Ancora più significativo è il fatto che i due terzi delle esportazioni serbe siano costituiti da prodotti altamente trasformati, segnale di un avanzamento nell’industrializzazione e di un maggior valore aggiunto. Su un totale di quasi 22 miliardi di euro di esportazioni, circa 15 miliardi provengono da tali prodotti.

Ciò ha portato il rapporto di copertura export/import a raggiungere l’80% e ha consentito alla Serbia di registrare avanzi commerciali con Paesi come Repubblica Ceca, Slovacchia, Bulgaria, Romania e altri membri della CEFTA. Per la prima volta, è stato raggiunto un rapporto di copertura del 105% con la Germania, mentre crescono anche le esportazioni verso gli Stati Uniti. La Cina si colloca al quarto posto tra i partner commerciali.

Se è vero che il 90% delle esportazioni verso la Cina riguarda minerali di rame e derivati prodotti da aziende cinesi in Serbia, non va trascurato il restante 10%, che include prodotti industriali – come elettrodomestici e componenti elettronici – e agroalimentari, tra cui prugne secche e lamponi congelati, con una gamma in espansione.

Tuttavia, gli investimenti esteri diretti sono calati del 40% a causa delle crisi globali, rendendo ancora più preziosi gli introiti da esportazione. In questo contesto, la diplomazia economica e il sostegno alla transizione ecologica delle imprese serbe sono fondamentali per mantenere la competitività e accedere alle catene di approvvigionamento globali.

Nuovi mercati si stanno aprendo grazie all’accordo di libero scambio con l’Egitto, all’accesso facilitato ai Paesi del Golfo tramite gli Emirati Arabi Uniti e all’avvio dei negoziati con la Corea del Sud. Si punta anche a incrementare le esportazioni verso il Giappone e a concludere trattative con gli Stati Uniti per tariffe doganali più favorevoli.

L’andamento positivo delle esportazioni serbe, in particolare nel settore automotive e nei beni ad alto valore aggiunto, rappresenta un’opportunità per le imprese italiane di approfondire collaborazioni industriali e commerciali con il Paese balcanico.

title_en: Science-Technology Park Nis expanding capacities: More than 70 companies and 1,000 engineers in new building
title_it: Triplicazione delle capacità del Parco Scientifico di Niš
content_en: (Photo: Naučno tehnološki park Niš) The construction of the new building of the Science-Technology Park (STP) in Nis is entering its final phase, and the opening is planned for early next year. The new space will increase the park’s capacities threefold and further strengthen the position of one of the most successful and promising science and innovation centers in Serbia. At a time when algorithms have become invisible allies of everyday life, a Nis startup has decided to apply them in healthcare. Startup combines medicine and AI Their mobile application uses medical methods and artificial intelligence to analyze footprints, automatically detecting flat feet and other deformities. Based on the data obtained, the algorithm creates a personalized exercise plan and monitors the user’s progress. – The application works by the user leaving a footprint on paper. Our algorithm, based on medical methods, calculates the degree of deformity, and the user receives a personalized exercise plan to follow. The application also allows for monitoring progress over time, as well as re-scanning and insight into the results. This is a relief for both doctors and parents themselves – says Dimitrije Zdravkovic from the startup “Archfix.” He emphasizes that the STP has recognized their potential and enabled further development and entry into new markets. In the Science-Technology Park in Nis, algorithms are not limited to healthcare. Around fifty companies with more than 500 employees are developing innovative products in the automotive, textile, pharmaceutical and electronics industries. The new STP facility, which is being built between the Faculty of Electronics and the Student Center, covers an area of around 9,500 m2 and includes office space and laboratories. Completion of construction is planned for early next year. – The construction of the new building will triple the capacities of STP Nis, will be an integral part of the STP system and will enable the park to gather more than 70 companies in which at least 1,000 researchers and young engineers will work on new innovative products. This will be a significant impetus for the development of the innovation ecosystem in Nis – emphasizes Milan Randjelovic, Director of STP Nis. Fotografije: Naučno tehnološki park Niš d.o.o. Niš ARCHFIX D.O.O Science Technology Park Niš Archfix TehNis Dimitrije Zdravković Milan Ranđelović mobile application innovations Your comment Send
content_it:
I lavori per la costruzione del nuovo edificio del Parco Scientifico-Tecnologico (STP) di Niš sono in fase avanzata, con l’inaugurazione prevista all’inizio del prossimo anno. La nuova struttura triplicherà la capacità del parco, rafforzando ulteriormente la posizione di uno dei centri scientifici e innovativi più dinamici in Serbia.

Un esempio concreto di innovazione è rappresentato dallo startup “Archfix”, che applica algoritmi all’ambito sanitario: la sua app mobile combina metodi medici e intelligenza artificiale per analizzare le impronte plantari, rilevando automaticamente il piede piatto e altre deformità. L’app consente inoltre di generare piani di esercizi personalizzati e di monitorarne i progressi nel tempo. “Ciò alleggerisce il carico sia per i medici sia per i genitori”, afferma Dimitrije Zdravković, fondatore di Archfix, che sottolinea il ruolo decisivo dello STP nel sostenere lo sviluppo dello startup e la sua espansione verso nuovi mercati.

Attualmente, circa 50 aziende con oltre 500 dipendenti operano nel parco, sviluppando prodotti innovativi nei settori automotive, tessile, farmaceutico ed elettronico. Il nuovo edificio, in costruzione tra la Facoltà di Elettronica e il Centro Studentesco, si estenderà su circa 9.500 m² e ospiterà uffici e laboratori. Al completamento, previsto per l’inizio del prossimo anno, il parco potrà accogliere oltre 70 aziende con almeno 1.000 ricercatori e giovani ingegneri attivi nello sviluppo di nuove soluzioni tecnologiche. “Questo costituirà un impulso significativo per l’ecosistema dell’innovazione a Niš”, dichiara Milan Ranđelović, direttore dello STP Niš, come riportato da ekapija.com.

L’espansione del Parco Scientifico-Tecnologico di Niš rappresenta un’opportunità per le imprese italiane attive nei settori della tecnologia, della sanità digitale e dell’ingegneria, interessate a collaborare con un polo innovativo in rapida crescita nei Balcani.

title_en: French media: Moroccans arriving to Kragujevac’s Stellantis
title_it: Stellantis assume lavoratori marocchini a Kragujevac
content_en: (Photo: Ivana Bezarević / eKapija) The Stellantis factory in Kragujevac will get an additional 200 Moroccan workers at the beginning of October, joining the hundred who have already arrived in the past days, reports the French media outlet Fdesouche. The Italian-French-American group’s goal, as they state, is to strengthen the production lines of the “Fiat Grande Panda” model, since production of that car is set to cease in six European factories as early as October. They write, as reported by the “Danas” portal, that unions in Serbia remind that the manufacturer has failed to find anyone “who would be willing to accept a monthly salary of around 600 euros.” – Due to the lack of local labor, Stellantis is therefore relying on the mass hiring of workers from Morocco in order to reach full capacity, with the factory already producing around 350 vehicles per day – the French media outlet reports. They remind that these arrivals coincide with the introduction of night shifts from the first week of October, so that the factory can be used to its maximum. – For European unions, this situation illustrates the increasing reliance on foreign labor with lower wage expectations, to the detriment of domestic workers – concludes Fdesouche. FCA Srbija Kragujevac Stellantis Fiat Kragujevac Fiat Grande Panda Moroccan workers car manufacture Your comment Send
content_it: Lo stabilimento Stellantis di Kragujevac assumerà all’inizio di ottobre ulteriori 200 lavoratori marocchini, che si aggiungeranno alle centinaia già arrivate nei giorni scorsi, secondo quanto riportato dal media francese Fdesouche. L’obiettivo del gruppo italo-franco-statunitense è rafforzare le linee di produzione del modello “Fiat Grande Panda”, la cui produzione cesserà già a ottobre in sei fabbriche europee. Come segnalato dal portale “Danas”, i sindacati serbi ricordano che il produttore non è riuscito a trovare personale locale disposto ad accettare uno stipendio mensile di circa 600 euro. A causa della carenza di manodopera locale, Stellantis sta quindi facendo ricorso all’assunzione massiccia di lavoratori marocchini per raggiungere la piena capacità produttiva, con lo stabilimento che attualmente produce circa 350 veicoli al giorno. L’arrivo dei nuovi dipendenti coincide con l’introduzione del turno notturno a partire dalla prima settimana di ottobre, per sfruttare al massimo la capacità dello stabilimento. Secondo Fdesouche, questa situazione evidenzia, per i sindacati europei, la crescente dipendenza da manodopera straniera con minori aspettative salariali, a discapito dei lavoratori locali. Come riportato da ekapija.com, la situazione potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità per imprese italiane attive nel settore automotive e nella fornitura di componenti, grazie all’incremento della produzione nello stabilimento serbo.

title_en: Negotiations to begin with Chinese company Shandong Hi-Speed Group about second phase of modernization of Nis Airport
title_it: Nuova fase di ammodernamento aeroporto di Niš
content_en: (Photo: Aerodromi Srbije/ Bauprojekt) The Government of Serbia has adopted the decision to form the Task Force for the Negotiations and Preparation of a Draft Agreement for the Implementation of the Project of the Construction and Modernization of the Nis Constantine the Great Airport - Phase II. The Task Force is to cooperate with the Chinese company Shandong Hi-Speed Group Co. Ltd, with the aim of defining the value of the works and services on the project, as well as the main elements of the future agreement. The Task Force is led by Ranko Sekularac, State Secretary at the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, whereas Tatjana Ivkovic from the same ministry performs the secretarial and coordination functions. Representatives of several institutions have been appointed members of the Task Force, among which are the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, the Ministry of Environmental Protection, the Ministry of Economy and the Aerodromi Srbije company. According to the decision, the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure will secure expert and technical support to the operations of the group, whereas the members and hired persons will not be paid any compensation for their work. Upon the completion of the negotiations, the Task Force will submit to the Government a report with basic elements of an agreement and recommendations for further activities. The decision comes into effect on the eighth day from the publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Serbia. I. Z. content_it: Il Governo della Serbia ha approvato la costituzione di un Gruppo di lavoro incaricato di condurre le trattative e redigere un progetto di accordo per la seconda fase del progetto di costruzione e ammodernamento dell’aeroporto di Niš “Costantino il Grande”. Il gruppo collaborerà con la società cinese Shandong Hi-Speed Group Co. Ltd per definire il valore delle opere e dei servizi previsti, nonché gli elementi essenziali del futuro contratto. Il Gruppo è guidato da Ranko Sekularac, Segretario di Stato presso il Ministero delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, mentre Tatjana Ivković dello stesso ministero svolge funzioni di segreteria e coordinamento. Ne fanno parte rappresentanti di diversi enti, tra cui i ministeri delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, della Protezione ambientale, dell’Economia e la società Aerodromi Srbije. Il ministero competente fornirà supporto tecnico ed esperto alle attività del gruppo; i membri e i consulenti non percepiranno compensi per il loro operato. Al termine delle trattative, il Gruppo presenterà al Governo una relazione con gli elementi fondamentali dell’accordo e proposte per le fasi successive. La decisione entra in vigore l’ottavo giorno dalla pubblicazione sulla Gazzetta Ufficiale della Repubblica di Serbia, come riportato da ekapija.com. L’avvio di questa nuova fase di sviluppo infrastrutturale potrebbe rappresentare un’opportunità per le imprese italiane specializzate in impianti aeroportuali, tecnologie per la sicurezza e servizi di ingegneria.

title_en: Elderly Home “Basil of Ostrog” in Novi Becej to be renovated – Investment worth RSD 8.3 million
title_it: Ristrutturazione casa anziani a Novi Bečej
content_en: (Photo: Google Street View) The elderly home in Novi Becej will soon get a makeover. The Home for Persons with Metal Illnesses “St. Basil of Ostrog, the Miracle Worker” in this city on the Tisa, at 77 Marsala Tita Street, has opened a public invitation for works on the replacement of the existing joinery. The estimated value of the works is RSD 8.33 million. According to the technical documentation, the exiting installed joinery (doors, windows) is dilapidated and does not function, so it is necessary to install new joinery. Joinery works and the installation of joinery are to be done on the facility. A total of 16 single PVC windows of high quality, 20 double ones and three triple ones should be installed. The plan is to also install 10 new single doors, five double ones and 30 portals - aluminum and PVC. Interior and exterior PVC benches will be set up inside the facility and in the facility’s yard. Among other things, the works include treating the window sills with extension plaster, then smoothing and painting the sills. The plan is for the works to start by the end of the year, considering all the deadlines, including the period for the possession of the site and the commencement of works by the contractor/supplier, and they will last three months. Applications for the tender may be submitted by October 14, and more details (in Serbian) can be viewed HERE . content_it: La Casa per persone con malattie mentali “San Basilio di Ostrog, il Taumaturgo” a Novi Bečej, situata al numero 77 di via Marsala Tita, ha lanciato un bando pubblico per la sostituzione delle attuali serramenti, con un investimento stimato di 8,33 milioni di dinari serbi. title_en: Who is to build Vozd Karadjordje expressway? – Government forms task force for negotiations with potential contractor
title_it: Autostrada Vožd Karađorđe: creata task force per gara
content_en: (Photo: Nacrt prostornog plana područja posebne namene infrastrukturnog koridora državnog puta Vožd Karađorđe) The Government of Serbia has adopted the decision on the forming of the Task Force for the Negotiation and Agreeing of the Implementation of the Project of the Construction of the I-Grade State Road Vozd Karadjordje. According to the decision, which was signed on October 2 by Prime Minister Djuro Macut, the Task Force is to cooperate with the potential contractor for the purpose of having negotiations during which the value of the services and works on the construction of the state road, as well as the basic elements to the end of signing a commercial contract, will be defined. Miroslav Alempic, Acting Assistant Minister of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, has been appointed head of the task force, which has another 12 members. Let us remind that the contractor for the construction of Vozd, which was announced back in 2019 at the opening of the section of the Milos Veliki highway from Obrenovac to Ljig, has not yet been selected. Vozd Karadjordje was initially announced as a highway - Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said at the time that a new highway would be built, connecting Sumadija with eastern Serbia. According to the project, the expressway from Lazarevac to Bor, with a total length of nearly 164 km, will have two lanes in each direction, three tunnels, more than 130 bridges and 21 interchanges, and the value of the investment has been estimated at EUR 1 billion. Last October, Vucic stated that he expected the construction to start the next summer (this one). Take a look at our info-map Construction of Highways and Expressways in Serbia and the Region . B. P. Vlada Republike Srbije Government of Serbia Vožd Karađorđe expressway task force for negotiations with contractor contractor Your comment Send
content_it:
Il Governo della Serbia ha approvato la decisione di costituire una task force per negoziare e definire l’attuazione del progetto di costruzione della strada statale di prima categoria Vožd Karađorđe. La decisione, firmata il 2 ottobre dal Primo Ministro Đuro Macut, prevede che il gruppo collabori con il potenziale contraente per definire il valore delle prestazioni e dei lavori, nonché gli elementi essenziali in vista della stipula del contratto commerciale. A capo dell’unità è stato nominato Miroslav Alempić, viceministro facente funzione presso il Ministero delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, affiancato da altri 12 membri.  

Ricordiamo che l’aggiudicatario dei lavori per la Vožd Karađorđe – annunciata nel 2019 in occasione dell’inaugurazione del tratto autostradale Miloš Veliki da Obrenovac a Ljig – non è ancora stato selezionato. Inizialmente presentata come autostrada, secondo le parole del Presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić essa avrebbe dovuto collegare la Šumadija con la Serbia orientale. Il progetto prevede una superstrada di circa 164 km da Lazarevac a Bor, con due corsie per senso di marcia, tre gallerie, oltre 130 ponti e 21 svincoli. L’investimento è stimato in 1 miliardo di euro. Nell’ottobre scorso, Vučić aveva affermato di attendersi l’avvio dei lavori per l’estate successiva. Come riportato da ekapija.com, questo progetto rappresenta un’opportunità interessante per imprese italiane specializzate nel settore delle infrastrutture stradali e delle grandi opere.

title_en: 5G network in Serbia to be functional from December – Telekom receives US loan for financing, tender for additional stations to follow
title_it: 5G in Serbia: attivazione a dicembre con finanziamento USA
content_en: (Photo: Pixabay.com/F. Muhammad) Telekom Srbija CEO Vladimir Lucic said that he expected to sign an arrangement with the US Exim Bank for financing the 5G network in Serbia by the end of November and that the loan would have more favorable terms than they would have gotten from commercial banks. He stated during a guest appearance on RTS that this would be the first agreement that a European telecommunications operator signed with that American financial institution, and the second in the world. – This means direct support from the US state, American institutions for the development of the 5G network, and we use a lot of American products in our system, from IBM to Microsoft. Exim Bank will actually provide extremely favorable loans, much more favorable than commercial loans – said Lucic. According to him, both European and American financial institutions are ready to help Telekom in the development of the 5G network, and their goal is for it to become functional in December . The company’s CEO said that the foundation of the infrastructure had been laid that would allow users to immediately see 5G in large cities and that, as soon as the license was obtained, people would see 5G on their phones . – We are now announcing a tender for additional stations that we will deploy. In the first two years, we will cover a significant part of Serbia with a 5G network. The goal is to fully cover the whole of Serbia by the end of 2027 – said Lucic. Speaking about Telekom’s operations in Kosovo, Lucic added that the company had launched an initiative to obtain a third mobile telephony license, for which it expected great support from the US. – Although we had excellent relations with the previous administration, two years ago the key contributions of the US ambassador in Pristina and Belgrade were to prevent (Kosovo Prime Minister Albin) Kurti from disconnecting MTS. We explained in a fairly argumentative way why that point of the Brussels Agreement should be fulfilled and MTS should be given a third license – said Lucic. He also added that the branch there covered 30,000 households with internet, landline, mobile telephony and television. – We pointed out to the American administration that before Kurti’s administration we had had no problems, that previous administrations had even had understanding for our company. I hope that in the formation of the new government, Kurti’s administration will not be so strong anymore, because it obviously has no understanding, nor does it want to approach the Serbian people. Its goal is to deport the Serbian people. It seems to me that, especially in the American administration, information about the harmfulness of Kurti’s actions is becoming clearer – said Lucic. Fotografije: Telekom Srbija a.d. Beograd Telekom Srbija Exim bank USA Vladimir Lučić 5G network US loan third license in KiM Your comment Send
content_it:
Il CEO di Telekom Srbija, Vladimir Lučić, ha dichiarato di attendersi la firma entro novembre di un accordo con la Export-Import Bank degli Stati Uniti (Exim Bank) per finanziare la rete 5G in Serbia. Il prestito offrirà condizioni più vantaggiose rispetto a quelle delle banche commerciali. Come riportato da ekapija.com, si tratterebbe del primo accordo tra un operatore telefonico europeo e questa istituzione finanziaria statunitense, e solo del secondo a livello mondiale. Lučić ha sottolineato il sostegno diretto delle istituzioni americane allo sviluppo del 5G in Serbia, evidenziando l’ampio utilizzo di prodotti statunitensi nel sistema, da IBM a Microsoft.

L’obiettivo è rendere la rete 5G operativa già a dicembre. La base infrastrutturale è già stata realizzata per permettere agli utenti delle grandi città di visualizzare immediatamente il 5G sui propri dispositivi non appena verrà rilasciata la licenza. A breve sarà pubblicato un bando per l’installazione di ulteriori stazioni: nei primi due anni verrà coperta una parte significativa del territorio serbo, con l’obiettivo di estendere la copertura a tutta la Serbia entro la fine del 2027.

Lučić ha inoltre annunciato che Telekom Srbija sta cercando di ottenere la terza licenza per la telefonia mobile in Kosovo, con il sostegno atteso dagli Stati Uniti. Ha ricordato il ruolo chiave svolto due anni fa dagli ambasciatori americani a Pristina e Belgrado nel convincere il primo ministro kosovaro Albin Kurti a non disconnettere MTS (Telekom Srbija), sottolineando che l’azienda forniva già servizi a 30.000 famiglie. Lučić ha espresso critiche verso l’attuale amministrazione kosovara, accusata di perseguire politiche ostili nei confronti della comunità serba.

L’implementazione del 5G in Serbia, con il sostegno finanziario e tecnologico statunitense, potrebbe offrire opportunità per aziende italiane operanti nel settore delle telecomunicazioni, in particolare per fornitori di infrastrutture, componentistica e servizi tecnologici complementari.

title_en: MK Group considering building new Carnex factory – Investment worth EUR 90 million
title_it: Nuovo impianto Carnex da 90 milioni
content_en: (Photo: Jelena Đelić) MK Group is considering building a new factory within the Carnex company, in which around EUR 90 million would be invested, announced the group’s CEO Mihailo Jankovic. – That would be a huge investment. Carnex’s factories were built in the 1960s and we have exhausted the possibilities for optimization. We have implemented new strategies and are now close to deciding to invest in a completely new factory. The value of the investment would be around EUR 90 million – said Jankovic at a panel at the Consumer Rules Summit 2025 regional conference in Tivat. When asked what the deciding factor is when it comes to such large investments, Jankovic is clear: – It’s always the return on invested money and energy - whether it is better to invest in that project or in another one. He said that MK Group was already looking towards 2029, because the company’s strategic plans had been defined by that time. Speaking about investment decisions, Jankovic said that, in MK Group, every idea was thoroughly considered within the team: – We discuss it thoroughly within the team and come to a common solution. We had a big discussion about an alcohol factory, which is an investment of EUR 42 million – said Jankovic. Fotografije: +1 MK Group Carnex Mihailo Janković construction of new factory within Carnex Carnex new factory Your comment Send
content_it: MK Group sta valutando la costruzione di un nuovo stabilimento per la sua controllata Carnex, con un investimento previsto di circa 90 milioni di euro. Lo ha annunciato l’amministratore delegato del gruppo, Mihailo Jankovic, nel corso del summit regionale “Consumer Rules 2025” a Tivat. “Si tratterebbe di un investimento molto rilevante. Gli attuali stabilimenti di Carnex risalgono agli anni ’60 e abbiamo ormai esaurito le possibilità di ottimizzazione. Abbiamo introdotto nuove strategie e siamo ormai prossimi a decidere di investire in uno stabilimento completamente nuovo”, ha dichiarato Jankovic. Interpellato sui criteri alla base di simili decisioni, ha sottolineato che “il fattore decisivo è sempre il ritorno sull’investimento di capitale ed energie: se sia meglio investire in questo progetto o in un altro”. Jankovic ha inoltre rivelato che il gruppo sta già pianificando fino al 2029, avendo definito i propri obiettivi strategici fino a quella data. Riguardo al processo decisionale, ha spiegato che ogni idea viene approfondita all’interno del team: “Ne discutiamo approfonditamente e giungiamo a una soluzione condivisa. Abbiamo avuto un ampio dibattito, ad esempio, sull’impianto per la produzione di alcol, un investimento da 42 milioni di euro”, ha aggiunto. Come riportato da ekapija.com, tale potenziale investimento potrebbe aprire opportunità per fornitori italiani di impianti e tecnologie per l’industria alimentare.

title_en: Tehnomanija arrives on Wolt – New partnership for faster and easier electronics shopping
title_it: Elettronica su Wolt con Tehnomanija
content_en: (Photo: Wolt) Faster and simpler electronics shopping via the Wolt app - a step closer to Wolt’s vision of a digital shopping mall Wolt, a company developing the leading digital delivery platform in Serbia, announces a partnership that brings users a completely new electronics shopping experience. The latest collaboration with Tehnomanija further enriches the offer in the Wolt app and brings closer the vision of a “digital shopping mall” that brings together everything needed in one place. Users can now choose popular electronic devices and accessories directly in the Wolt app with easy ordering, fast delivery and reliable customer support. Interestingly, Serbia ranks fifth in the Wolt network in terms of electronics sales this year, primarily thanks to the already rich offer in this sector. With the new partnership, this offer has gained a quality supplement. The assortment now includes an even wider selection of products. In addition to small household and kitchen appliances, laptops, headphones and practical accessories, users can now even order a TV set. Delivery is fast, allowing users to easily get the device they need, whether it’s a sudden need or a last-minute gift. – The partnership with Tehnomanija is an important step on our path to making Wolt a digital shopping center. Electronics are an indispensable part of everyday life and we believe that we can offer users a unique experience that combines convenience, speed and reliability. We are pleased that we are opening a new chapter with Tehnomanija, as a leading domestic brand, and we look forward to the joint activations that are yet to come – said Djordje Davidovic, General Manager for Serbia and North Macedonia at Wolt . (Photo: Wolt) Wolt has already shown what instant electronics shopping looks like, from midnight deliveries of the latest gaming consoles to deliveries of new iPhones on the very day the sales start. Users are used to a no-wait, no-stress experience. The new partnership opens up space for even more interesting campaigns and activations, from promotions with discounts and special benefits, to special actions that accompany the upcoming big shopping seasons, including the holiday sales period. – This cooperation is a logical step for us in improving the user experience: we are combining technology and logistics to enable customers to purchase the devices they want immediately in a faster, simpler and more secure fashion. With Wolt, we expect to further expand the availability of our range and strengthen the position of a brand that is constantly adapting to market trends and needs. For consumers, this means more flexibility and comfort, from selection in the application to fast delivery, without going to the store and without waiting. In short, we are introducing a new dimension of shopping: faster, simpler and more affordable than before – said Milos Ristic, CEO of Tehnomanija . With this cooperation, Wolt shows how fast, safe and simple digital shopping can be, with just a few clicks. Starting today, users can explore Tehnomanija’s offer on the Wolt app and discover how simple it is to order their favorite devices, quickly, easily and without waiting. About Wolt Wolt is a technology company based in Helsinki, Finland, with a mission to bring joy, simplicity and earning potential to every local community. Wolt is developing a local commerce platform that connects users who want to order food, groceries or other products, with those who want to sell and deliver them. The company was founded in 2014, and in 2022 it partnered with DoorDash (NASDAQ: DASH). Today, they operate in more than 30 countries. You can find more information on the official Wolt website . content_it:
Wolt, piattaforma leader per la consegna digitale in Serbia, ha annunciato una nuova partnership con Tehnomanija per offrire un’esperienza di acquisto più rapida e semplice nel settore dell’elettronica. Gli utenti potranno ora ordinare direttamente dall’app Wolt una vasta gamma di prodotti, inclusi piccoli elettrodomestici, laptop, cuffie, accessori e persino televisori, con consegne veloci e assistenza clienti affidabile.

La Serbia si colloca al quinto posto nella rete Wolt per le vendite di elettronica nel 2024, grazie a un’offerta già ampia, ora ulteriormente arricchita dall’ingresso di Tehnomanija. Questa collaborazione rappresenta un passo concreto verso la realizzazione del progetto di Wolt di trasformarsi in un “centro commerciale digitale”.

“Questa partnership è fondamentale per rendere Wolt un vero e proprio centro commerciale digitale. L’elettronica è ormai parte integrante della vita quotidiana, e vogliamo offrire un’esperienza unica basata su comodità, rapidità e affidabilità”, ha dichiarato Đorđe Davidović, General Manager di Wolt per Serbia e Macedonia del Nord.

Milos Ristić, CEO di Tehnomanija, ha aggiunto: “Stiamo combinando tecnologia e logistica per consentire ai clienti di acquistare i dispositivi desiderati in modo immediato, sicuro e senza dover recarsi fisicamente in negozio”.

L’accordo prevede anche campagne promozionali con sconti e vantaggi speciali, in vista delle prossime stagioni di shopping, incluse le festività natalizie. Come riportato da ekapija.com, questa collaborazione amplia le opportunità per i consumatori serbi e potrebbe rappresentare un modello interessante per aziende italiane del settore elettronico e della distribuzione digitale, sempre più orientate a integrare canali di vendita innovativi e servizi di consegna rapidi.

title_en: Land being prepared for construction of new Zlatibor airport runway – Length in first phase 700 m, final 2,500 m
title_it: Pista aeroporto Zlatibor: fase iniziale 700 m
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Unsplash/Matt Bowden) The most visited Serbian mountain is striving to become a world tourist center. This is supported by the construction of an airport on Zlatibor, which will complete and round off the tourist offer. In the area where earthworks are currently being carried out, the mayor of Cajetina, Milan Stamatovic, announced the start of the implementation of the Zlatibor airport construction project. – In the first phase of the works, the runway will be about 700 meters long, in the second 1,200, and the final length will be 2.5 kilometers. Public interest has been established here and we are fighting to reserve the land of the Agricultural Combine, which has been blocked, for such purposes through public interest – said Stamatovic. According to him, the idea of building an airport on Zlatibor is more than two decades old, but only now have the conditions been created for its implementation. – Even 20 years ago, there was an idea that Zlatibor would have its own airport for small and light aircraft, but now the possibilities are much greater - a 2.5-kilometer runway will allow the landing of larger aircraft – the mayor emphasized. He added that the current works were also being used as a borrowing site for material that would be used for road construction, and that local public companies were benefiting from the works too. – The material found here is ideal for road construction, so it is currently being used for our infrastructure projects. At the same time, we are arranging and preparing the terrain for the future runway of the Zlatibor airport – said Stamatovic, adding that Uzice Roads, which was building a bypass and a recycling yard, was also participating in the works. Stamatovic said that this project was of exceptional importance for Zlatibor and that, upon completion, the airport would represent a new development opportunity not only for the tourist offer but also for the economy of the entire region. Opština Čajetina Milan Stamatović construction of airport on Zlatibor airport on Zlatibor Your comment Send
content_it: La montagna serba più visitata punta a diventare un polo turistico internazionale, grazie anche alla costruzione di un aeroporto a Zlatibor. Il sindaco di Čajetina, Milan Stamatović, ha annunciato l’avvio dei lavori per la realizzazione della pista, che nella prima fase sarà lunga 700 metri, per poi arrivare a 1.200 metri nella seconda fase e infine a 2,5 chilometri. “È stato dichiarato di interesse pubblico l’area in cui si svolgono i lavori di sbancamento; stiamo cercando di acquisire, tramite dichiarazione di pubblica utilità, i terreni dell’Azienda agricola combinata, attualmente vincolati”, ha spiegato Stamatović. L’idea di un aeroporto a Zlatibor risale a oltre vent’anni fa, ma solo ora si sono create le condizioni per realizzarla. “Allora si pensava a una struttura per velivoli leggeri; oggi una pista di 2,5 km permetterà l’atterraggio di aerei di maggiori dimensioni”, ha sottolineato il sindaco. I materiali di scavo, ideali per la costruzione stradale, vengono già impiegati in progetti infrastrutturali locali, coinvolgendo anche l’azienda “Užičke putevi”, impegnata nella realizzazione di una variante stradale e di un impianto di riciclaggio. Il progetto è considerato strategico per lo sviluppo turistico ed economico dell’intera regione, come riportato da ekapija.com. L’infrastruttura aeroportuale potrebbe offrire nuove opportunità anche per operatori italiani nel settore delle costruzioni e dei servizi aeroportuali.

title_en: Direct flight from Belgrade to Toronto from March announced

content_en: Illustration (Photo: Dabarti CGI/shutterstock.com) Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has said that Serbia will have direct flights to Toronto from March. – We will fly to Toronto from March. We will have a direct flight to Toronto, which is like Little Serbia – said Vucic. As he added, after Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, New York, Chicago, there will also be a flight to Toronto. title_en: Minister: Construction of Belgrade-Nis railroad to begin next year
title_it: Ferrovia Belgrado-Niš: lavori dal 2026
content_en: Illustration (Photo: bibiphoto/shutterstock) Minister of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure of Serbia Aleksandra Sofronijevic has announced a continuation of the construction of the rail corridor 10, the Belgrade-Nis railroad, which will be 230 kilometers long. She said on TV Pink that the whole project amounted to EUR 2.77 billion thus far. Sofronijevic said that the construction would start in 2026 and that it would be split into three sections, from Belgrade, Velika Plana, Paracin and Nis, and that the construction to Nis itself was planned to last 3 to 4 years, Beta reported. Ministarstvo građevinarstva, saobraćaja i infrastrukture Republike Srbije Ministry of Construction Aleksandra Sofronijević Belgrade Niš railroad beginning of construction sections price of construction Your comment Send
content_it: La ministra serba delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, Aleksandra Sofronijević, ha annunciato che i lavori per la costruzione del Corridoio ferroviario 10, tratta Belgrado-Niš (230 km), inizieranno nel 2026. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’investimento complessivo ammonta finora a 2,77 miliardi di euro. Il progetto sarà suddiviso in tre lotti: Belgrado-Velika Plana, Velika Plana-Paraćin e Paraćin-Niš. La realizzazione dell’intera tratta fino a Niš richiederà tra i 3 e i 4 anni. L’opera rappresenta un’importante opportunità per le imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture ferroviarie e grandi opere.

title_en: Price of free public transport in Belgrade heading toward half a billion euros a year
title_it: Trasporto pubblico gratuito a Belgrado: costo annuo a 400 milioni
content_en: (Photo: Dejan Aleksić) Pointing out how much the “free” public transport cost the city and the citizens, Nikola Jovanovic, the director of the Center for Local Self-Government, said that, in the first six months of 2025 alone, RSD 20.58 billion, or close to EUR 30 million a month, had been paid from the budget of the city of Belgrade to the transporters. – If we add to that number direct subsidies to GSP, loan servicing, rail infrastructure and the already agreed increase of the fee for private transporters, we end up with a price of EUR 400 million a year – explains Jovanovic. Jovanovic also pointed out that “there is no city in the world where a fourth of the budget is ‘eaten’ by the public transport.” – A system designed this way is pushing Belgrade toward a certain bankruptcy and burying the public finances of the capital city – concludes the director of the Center for Local Self-Government. content_it: Nikola Jovanović, direttore del Centro per l’Autogoverno Locale, ha evidenziato il costo del trasporto pubblico gratuito per la città di Belgrado e i suoi cittadini. Nei soli primi sei mesi del 2025, dal bilancio cittadino sono stati trasferiti ai vettori 20,58 miliardi di dinari serbi, circa 30 milioni di euro al mese. “Aggiungendo a questa cifra i sussidi diretti a GSP, il servizio del debito, le infrastrutture ferroviarie e l’aumento già concordato delle tariffe per i vettori privati, si arriva a un costo annuo di 400 milioni di euro”, spiega Jovanović. Il direttore ha inoltre sottolineato che “non esiste al mondo una città in cui un quarto del bilancio venga assorbito dal trasporto pubblico”, aggiungendo che “un sistema strutturato in questo modo sta spingendo Belgrado verso il fallimento e sta compromettendo le finanze pubbliche della capitale”, come riportato da ekapija.com. L’analisi evidenzia potenziali opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in servizi di trasporto sostenibile, efficientamento della spesa pubblica e consulenza finanziaria per enti locali.

title_en: Novi Sad–Subotica high-speed rail line to open to traffic, testing completed
title_it: Apertura linea AV Novi Sad-Subotica
content_en: (Photo: Dejan Aleksić) The third section of the high-speed railroad on the Belgrade–Subotica route, from Novi Sad to Subotica, has been intensively tested in the past two weeks and is expected to be officially opened to traffic today, RTS announced. The line is 108.1 kilometers long and will enable trains to travel at speeds of up to 200 kilometers per hour. As stated, the Novi Sad–Subotica high-speed rail line has been intensively tested in the past two weeks, which meant that Soko and other Stadler trains operated several times a day. Construction of this section began in November 2021, and the work included laying down about 273 kilometers of new tracks, including double-track and stations. Four bridges, two viaducts, 27 overpasses and 15 underpasses were built on the route. For the first time in Serbia, three eco-ducts, each 46 meters long, were also built, which will allow animals to safely cross the railway. A total of 33 culverts and 14 underpasses were built, while 302 switches were installed on the section. The works required about 8.5 million cubic meters of earthworks and 762,000 cubic meters of crushed stone. There are four stations on the newly built section between Novi Sad and Subotica – Vrbas Nova, Lovcenac, Mali Idjos, Backa Topola and Subotica. The contractor was the Chinese consortium of China Railway International and China Communications Construction Company - CHCH, with the participation of more than 200 subcontractors and suppliers from Serbia and the European Union. Dynamic testing was carried out by the German company Deutsche Bahn Systemtechnik, which confirmed in early October 2024 that the maximum speed of 200 kilometers per hour had been reached on this section. The Soko train is planned to travel between Novi Sad and Subotica in 41 minutes, while the journey between Belgrade and Subotica will take about 79 minutes. Interregio trains will operate somewhat slower - 54 minutes from Novi Sad to Subotica and about 99 minutes from Belgrade to Subotica. Today, the ceremonial opening of this section is expected to be attended by Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic with his associates and other officials, RTS reports. content_it: Il terzo tratto della ferrovia ad alta velocità sulla tratta Belgrado-Subotica, tra Novi Sad e Subotica, è stato sottoposto a test intensivi nelle ultime due settimane ed è prevista oggi la sua apertura ufficiale al traffico, secondo quanto annunciato da RTS. La linea, lunga 108,1 chilometri, consentirà ai treni di raggiungere velocità fino a 200 km/h. I test hanno visto circolare più volte al giorno i treni Soko e altri convogli Stadler. I lavori, iniziati nel novembre 2021, hanno comportato la posa di circa 273 chilometri di nuovi binari (compresi quelli a doppio binario) e la costruzione di quattro ponti, due viadotti, 27 sovrappassi e 15 sottopassi. Per la prima volta in Serbia sono stati realizzati tre ecodotti di 46 metri ciascuno per consentire il passaggio sicuro della fauna. Sono stati inoltre costruiti 33 tombini e 14 sottopassi, e installati 302 deviatoi. L’opera ha richiesto circa 8,5 milioni di metri cubi di movimento terra e 762.000 metri cubi di pietrisco. Lungo il tratto sono presenti cinque stazioni: Vrbas Nova, Lovcenac, Mali Idjos, Bačka Topola e Subotica. L’appalto è stato affidato al consorzio cinese formato da China Railway International e China Communications Construction Company, con la partecipazione di oltre 200 subappaltatori e fornitori provenienti dalla Serbia e dall’Unione Europea. I test dinamici, condotti dalla società tedesca Deutsche Bahn Systemtechnik, hanno confermato all’inizio di ottobre 2024 il raggiungimento della velocità massima di 200 km/h. Il treno Soko impiegherà 41 minuti tra Novi Sad e Subotica e circa 79 minuti tra Belgrado e Subotica, mentre i treni Interregio viaggeranno a velocità inferiori. All’inaugurazione ufficiale dovrebbero partecipare il Presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić e altre autorità, secondo quanto riportato da ekapija.com. Questo sviluppo infrastrutturale potrebbe offrire opportunità per imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture e sovrastrutture per strade ferrate, in particolare nei settori di subfornitura, consulenza tecnica e fornitura di materiali.

title_en: Montenegro on its way to becoming a global destination for remote work – From Niksic to Herceg Novi, an ecosystem for digital nomads is emerging
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Pixabay / Engin_Akyurt) In recent years, digital nomads have been changing the way the world works, working from exotic and inspiring destinations, combining work and enjoying life. The natural beauty of Montenegro, the favorable cost of living and the developing IT scene make it appear more and more often on their map. At the beginning of the year, Montenegro was ranked as the third best destination for digital nomads in the world, right after Spain and the UAE, according to the Digital Nomad Index 2025 published by VisaGuide.World. However, in order for Montenegro to fully benefit from this trend, additional campaigns and strategic support are needed . IPC Technopolis is an institution that was among the first in the country to recognize the importance of digital nomads and has been actively working on positioning Montenegro as an attractive destination for this target group for years. - Montenegro is slowly establishing itself as a destination for digital nomads, primarily thanks to its natural beauty, affordable living costs and a growing IT scene. The trend of digital nomadism in our country is still in development, but there is an increasing interest of local communities, coworking spaces and tourism actors to adapt to this global phenomenon. However, it is necessary to further educate and inform the general public and decision-makers about the possibilities that digital nomads bring, as well as to implement a large promotional campaign so that Montenegro becomes a more recognizable destination for this target group - says Jelena Popivoda from IPC Technopolis. The first coworking space in Niksic, opened in 2018, was a key step in creating the conditions for their arrival, according to our interlocutor. Today, it has 30 workplaces, a meeting room, a multimedia room, high-speed Internet and accompanying facilities. Popivoda also announces the opening of a new coworking space with 60 seats in the House of Digital Revolution , as well as coworking outdoors , where digital workers will be able to work in a natural environment. Apart from the space, Technopolis connects the local community with nomads through workshops, meetups and the international Cross Border Coworking Conference (CBCC). This year`s edition, CBCC25, will be held from October 14 to 17 in Herceg Novi, and will gather experts and digital workers from all over the world. - For the fifth year in a row, the conference is a meeting place for nomads, startups and decision-makers, and at the same time, it is a great opportunity for Montenegro to show its potential. The conference is part of the STAR project, which is funded by the European Union through the IPA III CBC Program BiH - Montenegro 2021-2027, and which Technopolis realizes in cooperation with the INTERA Technology Park from Mostar and the National Tourism Organization of Montenegro - Popivoda points out. Additionally, within the same project, Technopolis actively works with tourism operators and service providers, providing them with education and advice on how to adapt their offer to digital nomads. - This includes various trainings, recommendations for flexible accommodation packages, coworking-friendly facilities, activities and local services that meet the needs of remote workers, thus increasing their competitiveness and attractiveness of the region. Through the same project, we are organizing a residency program for digital nomads, providing them with access to coworking spaces, the possibility of professional networking and the opportunity to get to know the destination in depth, thereby contributing to the development of the community and the positioning of Montenegro as an attractive destination for nomads - Popivoda says. One of the innovations is the development of a digital platform and mobile application which will consolidate information about attractions, accommodation and activities in Montenegro and BiH, thus facilitating the planning of the stay and promoting cross-border tourism. According to our interlocutor, digital nomads bring global perspectives and experiences, and their presence can stimulate innovation, new business opportunities and the internationalization of startups, and also contribute to the development of an ecosystem that is attractive to international investors. - Through conferences, workshops and meetups, digital nomads share their knowledge and experiences which help the local community improve competitiveness, access to technologies and innovation, thus becoming active actors in the development of the startup ecosystem in Montenegro - she points out. How to brand oneself? According to the interlocutor of eKapija, Montenegro can be positioned as a destination that offers balance between work and life, combining natural beauty, quality of life and developed coworking infrastructure. - It is important to use the stories of successful digital nomads, local projects and innovative communities, but also to actively connect digital workers with local entrepreneurs and startups. Branding includes cooperation with the tourism and IT sectors, visibility in the media, digital campaigns and initiatives such as CBCC, which promote Montenegro as a recognizable and attractive destination for working and living remotely - Popivoda says. The plans of IPC Tehnopolis are aimed at the further development of coworking infrastructure and programs, community strengthening and cooperation with institutions in order to create additional incentives for the arrival of nomads. - If we manage to connect the natural beauty of Montenegro, the quality of life and modern infrastructure, we can become a globally recognized destination for working and living remotely - Popivoda concludes. Illustration (Photo: Pixabay/StockSnap) Amendments to the Law on Foreigners in parliamentary procedure According to the Ministry of Interior, 653 permits for the temporary residence of digital nomads were issued in Montenegro by February . That number became achievable thanks to changes to the Law on Foreigners that came into force in August 2022, which introduced a special visa D for digital nomads. According to the law, a digital nomad is a foreigner who is employed or performs work electronically for a foreign company or his own company that is not registered in Montenegro. The new proposal for amendments to the Law on Foreigners, currently in the parliamentary procedure, foresees additional novelties: the digitalization of visa procedures, the introduction of new bases for residence, but also stricter rules for the employment of foreigners and harmonization with EU legislation. One of the novelties is the regulation of the residence of digital nomads, who will have to submit an employment contract and proof of registration of a foreign company. Article 60a stipulates that a temporary residence permit can last up to two years, with the possibility of extending it for another two years, while a new permit is possible after a six-month break. In addition, digital nomads are allowed family reunification - spouses and children up to the age of 18 can join them during their stay in Montenegro. An additional convenience was introduced by introducing the possibility of submitting applications electronically through the information system of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, which significantly simplified the application process. title_en: SAP Business Suite Innovation Day held in Belgrade
title_it: SAP lancia Business Suite con AI a Belgrado
content_en: (Photo: Nikola Večanski) SAP recently successfully organized the SAP Business Suite Innovation Day at Sava Centar in Belgrade, where it brought together business leaders, users, and experts to explore SAP’s bold new vision for enterprise management. The event demonstrated how SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Business AI were integrated into SAP Business Suite to deliver exceptional business value. Through expert insights and real-world user examples, it was presented how SAP innovations combined powerful cloud applications with contextual and reliable data to enable the application of artificial intelligence in solving the most demanding business challenges of the modern era. At the very beginning, the attendees were welcomed by Branislav Sekulovic, Managing Director of SAP Balkans, and Ljubica Barbulj, CEO of EneTel Solutions, announcing the topics of the meeting - Business Suite and AI, that is, SAP’s view on artificial intelligence. – Our idea is to show how SAP Business Suite combined with artificial intelligence opens up new opportunities for improving all aspects of business. Some possibilities were not even imaginable until recently – said Managing Director of SAP, Branislav Sekulovic. He later referred to both users and partners. – We see engagement from users and partners and a willingness to honestly share experiences. Every implementation comes with challenges. As a software company, we are glad to have a serious network of partners and professional services that can help and respond to every request. With each passing year, our clients and we become more mature. Expectations are clearer, goals are more precise - and together we are moving forward with SAP – said Sekulovic. (Photo: Nikola Večanski) Ljubica Barbulj, CEO of EneTel Solutions, said: – Our mission is to enable agility, efficiency and sustainable growth through innovation and SAP solutions for clients. We believe that domestic teams can implement projects of strategic importance and set new standards in digital transformation. During the first presentation - “ SAP Business Suite: Future-Readiness Starts Now. How timely strategy execution drives real business impact .” - Martin Scharmach, SVP & CRO Cloud ERP Private, MEE SAP, presented the strategy of SAP Business Suite, which integrates applications, data, and artificial intelligence into a single system. – I want to start with Belgrade, the place where rivers meet. I think it's a great symbol - where two rivers meet. What we want to achieve here is to connect innovation with artificial intelligence and with data in your company. From a Business Suite strategy perspective, we believe that the only way to get the most value out of AI is to connect it to your data - to train the AI on your data. And the only way to achieve this at scale is with SAP, because SAP runs your processes, SAP generates data, and this is the data that you can use to train your AI – Scharmach explained at the beginning of his presentation. Alexander Zaytsev, Head of BTP & BDC Customer Advisory, SAP CEE, in the presentation “ Explore SAP’s Application, Data, and AI Innovations ” talked about how we could position AI for every business process and why this was of key importance for SAP customers and partners. – True AI integration is not just adding a chatbot. It’s about how AI impacts business processes and how we can use it in the future. To achieve this, we need to provide the right data. That’s why we announced SAP Business Data Cloud earlier this year, our new system that allows us to unify data from different sources, both from the SAP environment and from non-SAP systems. We can integrate all of these components using the SAP Business Technology Platform. This is also an important point, because when we integrate different processes, we can create a single environment for all business processes. Artificial intelligence is changing the way we work. Many companies have already implemented AI solutions, and this is a positive sign. This means that we need to adopt innovations faster, because AI brings real business benefits to all users – explained Zaytsev. Migration of Telekom Srbija’s on-premise SAP system to SAP Private Cloud (Photo: Nikola Večanski) Success stories of SAP system users were also presented at this year’s conference. The most significant process of migration to SAP Private Cloud was discussed by Ivan Mijailovic, SAP Program Manager at EneTel, and Mirjana Jevtic, Head of IT Strategy and Corporate Support at Telekom Srbija, which has been using SAP solutions for more than ten years. – Telekom Srbija, a leader in the region, one of the most successful telecommunications operators in Southeast Europe, as an innovative company made the decision to migrate its SAP on-premise solutions to Private Cloud in order to provide a scalable, flexible and innovative solution, as well as long-term technical support. As regular support for the ECC solution expires in 2027, we decided to start this process in 2025 and ensure business continuity – explained Mirjana Jevtic. She added that “by using the SAP Rise Cloud service, part of the responsibility for infrastructure and security is transferred to the cloud provider.” – This significantly relieves our IT team. In addition, the cloud allows for more flexible scaling of resources and faster introduction of innovations, including AI tools and advanced analytical platforms – said Jevtic. Ivan Mijailovic pointed out that Telekom Srbija had a complex SAP IT architecture with four SAP systems and numerous integrations. – Together with SAP experts and colleagues from Telekom Srbija, we opted for a PTO approach in two phases - the first phase is the migration of existing solutions to SAP PCE (Private Cloud), and then in the second phase, the system conversion and updating to the latest S/4HANA version – Mijailovic pointed out. Telekom Srbija has also successfully implemented HR solutions, and Suzana Marovic, Head of the Human Resources Development Sector, spoke about this at the conference. Noteworthy stories also coming from Pestan and Swisslion Takovo The company Pestan, which implemented SAP in 2009, this year implemented the migration to SAP Private Cloud. – In SAP Private Cloud, we get privacy and the ability to maintain existing customized processes and integrations. It is a unique environment, where we have access to advanced SAP tools as well as faster access to innovations through regular upgrades that are automatically delivered – said Lazar Simic, Head of IT Service in Pestan. According to Natasa Adzic, IT Director of the company, Swisslion Takovo “is growing with SAP.” – We implemented SAP ERP in 2005. In 2022, we converted and were among the first to make the transition from SAP ERP on-premise environment to SAP S4HANA Private Cloud, using the “lift and shift” method, with the help of our partner - Axians Serbia – said Natasa Adzic. The conference was supported by partners: EneTel Solutions, Axians, Solving - IT Solutions and Services, Atos, MI Systems, Deloitte, B-One Solutions, Coming, Infinus and Hircunus.
