content_it:
A Belgrado, presso il Sava Centar, si è svolto con successo l’SAP Business Suite Innovation Day, evento dedicato alla nuova visione di SAP per la gestione aziendale, incentrata sull’integrazione tra SAP Business Suite, SAP Business Data Cloud e SAP Business AI.  

Ad aprire i lavori sono stati Branislav Sekulović, Managing Director di SAP Balkans, e Ljubica Barbulj, CEO di EneTel Solutions, che hanno presentato il tema centrale: l’uso dell’intelligenza artificiale per migliorare ogni aspetto del business. “Alcune opportunità rese possibili dall’unione tra SAP Business Suite e l’AI non erano nemmeno immaginabili fino a poco tempo fa”, ha affermato Sekulović, sottolineando il crescente livello di maturità di clienti e partner.  

Martin Scharmach, SVP & CRO Cloud ERP Private di SAP per l’area MEE, ha illustrato la strategia di SAP Business Suite, che unisce applicazioni, dati e AI in un unico sistema. “Il vero valore dell’AI si ottiene solo collegandola ai dati aziendali. SAP genera questi dati e li rende utilizzabili per addestrare modelli di intelligenza artificiale”, ha spiegato.  

Alexander Zaytsev, Head of BTP & BDC Customer Advisory per l’area CEE, ha ribadito che l’integrazione reale dell’AI non si limita all’aggiunta di chatbot, ma riguarda l’impatto sui processi aziendali, reso possibile grazie all’unificazione dei dati tramite SAP Business Data Cloud e la piattaforma SAP BTP.  

L’evento ha anche presentato casi di successo: Telekom Srbija ha avviato la migrazione del proprio sistema SAP on-premise verso il SAP Private Cloud nel 2025, anticipando la fine del supporto per ECC prevista nel 2027. L’azienda punta su scalabilità, flessibilità e accesso a strumenti AI, con una parte della gestione infrastrutturale e della sicurezza trasferita al cloud provider.  

Anche Pestan e Swisslion Takovo hanno condiviso le proprie esperienze: Pestan ha recentemente migrato su SAP Private Cloud mantenendo i processi personalizzati, mentre Swisslion Takovo, già cliente SAP dal 2005, è stata tra le prime in Serbia a passare a S/4HANA Private Cloud nel 2022 con il metodo “lift and shift”.  

L’evento è stato sostenuto da partner chiave tra cui EneTel Solutions, Axians, Solving, Atos, MI Systems, Deloitte, B-One Solutions, Coming, Infinus e Hircunus.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la trasformazione digitale guidata da SAP in Serbia offre opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in soluzioni cloud, intelligenza artificiale e servizi di migrazione SAP, in un mercato in rapida evoluzione verso infrastrutture digitali avanzate.

title_en: Serbia to establish AI and cyber districts within Lozionica
title_it: Distretti AI e cyber a Belgrado
content_en: (Photo: metamorworks/shutterstock.com) Serbia is preparing to establish an AI district and a Cyber district in the eGovernment House, within the Lozionica complex, which will include representatives of the non-governmental sector, startup companies, business, science and innovation, in addition to eGovernment employees, said Mihailo Jovanovic, Director of the IT and eGovernment Office, in Lyon at the 18th International Law Enforcement Intellectual Property Crime Conference. Jovanovic presented Serbia's results in the field of information security and artificial intelligence at the panel “Identification and Mitigation of Risks from Digital and AI Threats.” He also stated that the installation of a new supercomputer in Kragujevac was underway, the performance of which was seven times stronger than the existing one. He also stated that the adoption of the new Law on Information Security, which is aligned with the European NIS2 Directive, was in the final stage, as the Bill was in the National Assembly. – In addition to the fact that this Law provides for the establishment of the Information Security Office, it also expands the sectors under regulation, redefines the status of ICT system operators and introduces the obligation of annual risk assessment and incident reporting within 24 hours – Jovanovic emphasized, the Office announced. Fotografije: +26 Opis: Kako je navedeno iz Kancelarije za IT i eUpravu, potpuno je rekonstruisano i adaptirano mesto gde je 1925. pre 100 godina sagrađena železnička ložionica. Radovi su obuhvatili rekonstrukciju Ložionice na svih 4.800 m2, uz očuvanje prepoznatljivog izgleda, kao i vodotornja i okretnice, ali i izgradnju Kuće eUprave koja se prostire na 11.000 m2. Kuća eUprave zamišljena je kao mesto gde će zaposleni Kancelarije za IT i eUpravu zajedno sa privredom i startap zajednicom, a uz podršku stručnjaka iz oblasti nauke i tehnologije, dalje raditi na novim IT rešenjima. U Kući eUprave, kako je najavljeno, biće formirani AI distrikt, Cyber distrikt, Open data hub, kao i Digital distrikt. Kompletan kompleks prostire se na više od 23.000 m2. U Ložionici se nalazi i sala za događaje i okupljanja, kao i brojni prostori za razne aktivnosti kreativaca. (2025) Vidi sve Kancelarija za informacione tehnologije i elektronsku upravu Beograd Ložionica d.o.o. content_it:
La Serbia sta allestendo un distretto dedicato all’intelligenza artificiale e un distretto per la cybersicurezza presso la Casa dell’eGovernment, all’interno del complesso Lozionica a Belgrado. Lo ha annunciato Mihailo Jovanović, direttore dell’Ufficio per le Tecnologie Informatiche e l’eGovernment, in occasione della 18ª Conferenza internazionale sul contrasto alla criminalità informatica a Lione. Il progetto prevede la partecipazione, oltre che dei dipendenti dell’eGovernment, di rappresentanti del settore non governativo, startup, imprese, scienza e innovazione.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, il complesso Lozionica – costruito originariamente come deposito locomotive nel 1925 – è stato interamente ricostruito e adattato su una superficie di 4.800 m², preservando elementi storici come il silo dell’acqua e la piattaforma girevole. È stata inoltre realizzata la Casa dell’eGovernment (11.000 m²), pensata come hub collaborativo per lo sviluppo di nuove soluzioni IT con il supporto di esperti del mondo accademico e tecnologico. Oltre ai distretti AI e cyber, saranno attivati un Open Data Hub e un Digital District, all’interno di un complesso totale di oltre 23.000 m², che ospita anche spazi per eventi e attività creative.

Jovanović ha inoltre riferito che l’installazione di un nuovo supercomputer a Kragujevac è in corso; la sua potenza sarà sette volte superiore a quella dell’attuale. È in fase finale l’adozione della nuova Legge sulla Sicurezza Informatica, allineata alla direttiva europea NIS2, attualmente in discussione presso l’Assemblea Nazionale. La legge prevede la creazione di un Ufficio per la Sicurezza Informatica, l’estensione dei settori regolamentati, la ridefinizione dello status degli operatori di sistemi ICT e l’obbligo di valutazione annuale dei rischi e di segnalazione degli incidenti entro 24 ore.

L’iniziativa apre opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in intelligenza artificiale, cybersicurezza, infrastrutture digitali e servizi IT avanzati, interessate a collaborare con il crescente ecosistema tecnologico serbo.

title_en: Attempt at livestock smuggling in Britain: Pig hidden in suitcase
title_it: Contrabbando di maiale in Gran Bretagna
content_en: (Photo: Tsekhmister/shutterstock.com) The British National Pig Association (NPA) has warned authorities about the growing problem of illegal pork imports. The latest report by the parliamentary Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee (EFRA) has revealed worrying amounts of meat and milk entering the country without any veterinary checks, writes Farmer. The situation culminated in a bizarre incident at the port of Dover, where customs officers found a whole pig hidden in a suitcase during a check. This case only confirmed the NPA’s claims that the current border control measures are insufficient and pose a serious risk to the health of livestock and the safety of domestic production. Disease risk endangering farms The association warns that the uncontrolled import of meat and dairy products can lead to the spread of dangerous animal diseases such as African swine fever or foot-and-mouth disease. Such outbreaks could cause catastrophic economic losses, as they would threaten the entire food supply chain and damage exports. According to the expert portal Agrarheute, the penalties so far have failed to stop smugglers. Tougher penalties proposed Public awareness of the risks of spreading animal diseases remains low, and many travelers are still unaware of the rules regarding which food products they are allowed to bring into the country. The parliamentary committee has therefore asked the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs to urgently present a plan to introduce tougher penalties, including immediate fines and the prosecution of repeat offenders. The NPA stresses that this is a matter of national food security and that it is necessary to step up surveillance at all border crossings to prevent another crisis in the British livestock industry. content_it: La National Pig Association britannica (NPA) ha allertato le autorità sul crescente problema delle importazioni illegali di carne suina. L’ultima relazione della commissione parlamentare per l’Ambiente, l’Alimentazione e gli Affari Rurali (EFRA) ha rivelato preoccupanti quantità di carne e latte introdotte nel Paese senza alcun controllo veterinario. La situazione ha raggiunto un picco con l’episodio avvenuto al porto di Dover, dove la dogana ha rinvenuto un intero maiale nascosto in una valigia. Questo caso conferma le affermazioni della NPA sulla inadeguatezza dei controlli alle frontiere, che rappresentano un serio rischio per la salute del bestiame e la sicurezza della produzione nazionale. L’associazione avverte che l’importazione incontrollata di prodotti animali potrebbe diffondere malattie pericolose come la peste suina africana o l’afta epizootica, con potenziali perdite economiche catastrofiche lungo tutta la filiera agroalimentare e per le esportazioni. Come riportato da ekapija.com, le sanzioni attuali non sono sufficienti a scoraggiare i contrabbandieri. La commissione parlamentare ha quindi chiesto al ministero competente di presentare con urgenza un piano per inasprire le pene, prevedendo multe immediate e il perseguimento dei recidivi. La NPA sottolinea che si tratta di una questione di sicurezza alimentare nazionale e che è essenziale rafforzare la sorveglianza in tutti i punti d’ingresso al fine di evitare una nuova crisi nel settore zootecnico britannico. Per le aziende italiane operanti nel settore agroalimentare, tale situazione evidenzia l’importanza di rispettare rigorosamente le normative sanitarie e doganali nei mercati esteri, nonché l’opportunità di proporre soluzioni tecnologiche o logistiche per il monitoraggio e la tracciabilità dei prodotti animali.

title_en: Serbian scientists sell autoimmune disease and cancer treatment for USD 1.9 billion – Sanofi buys biopharma company Dren Bio
title_it: Acquisita startup serba per terapie autoimmuni
content_en: Illustration (Photo: anawat sudchanham/shutterstock.com) Pharma-major Sanofi has acquired Serbian-founded biopharmaceutical company Dren Bio for up to USD 1.9 billion. Dren Bio is headquartered in San Francisco and it was founded by Serbian scientists. As said in a joint statement by the companies, this acquisition is a major milestone for the Serbian biotech sector and highlights the growing international recognition of innovations emerging from the region, reports bne IntelliNews. The agreement sees Sanofi acquire Dren Bio’s autoimmune disease treatment, DR-0201, a targeted bispecific myeloid cell activator. The drug, which has shown strong B-cell depletion in early clinical studies, is being investigated for a variety of autoimmune diseases and malignancies. Sanofi will pay USD 600 million upfront, with the remaining amount contingent on the drug’s clinical success, reaching up to USD 1.9 billion in total. – Deep B-cell depletion is at the frontier of treating autoimmune diseases and using the myeloid cell engager DR-0201 has the potential to elevate the treatment effect for patients, in particular patients refractory to existing treatments – said Houman Ashrafian, head of research and development at Sanofi. Founded in 2019 by Serbian scientists Nenad Tomasevic and Ivan Trifunovic, Dren Bio is a private, clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company. The name Dren reflects the company’s Serbian roots, referencing the dogwood tree, known locally for its health benefits. Tomasevic, a graduate of the Faculty of Chemistry, is recognized as one of Serbia’s most successful entrepreneurs in biotechnology. – It has been a privilege to advance our lead platform program, DR-0201, into clinical development. Sanofi, as a leader in immune depletion and immunology, is ideally positioned to realize the full potential of deep B-cell depletion and immune resetting for autoimmune patients – Tomasevic said. Dren Bio has raised several rounds of venture capital. In 2022, it announced the completion of a USD 65 million Series B financing, raised its total capital received to over USD 156 million. The Series B financing was co-led by Aisling Capital and HBM Healthcare Investments alongside several new and existing investors. B. P. content_it: Il colosso farmaceutico Sanofi ha acquisito la biotech Dren Bio, fondata da scienziati serbi, per un importo fino a 1,9 miliardi di dollari. Con sede a San Francisco e fondata nel 2019 da Nenad Tomasević e Ivan Trifunović, Dren Bio è specializzata nello sviluppo di terapie innovative per malattie autoimmuni e tumori. L’accordo prevede un pagamento iniziale di 600 milioni di dollari, con ulteriori 1,3 miliardi legati al successo clinico del farmaco DR-0201, un attivatore mirato di cellule mieloidi in grado di indurre una profonda deplezione delle cellule B. Questo approccio rappresenta una frontiera promettente, soprattutto per pazienti refrattari alle terapie esistenti. Il nome “Dren” richiama il corniolo, albero conosciuto in Serbia per le sue proprietà benefiche. La startup, che ha raccolto oltre 156 milioni di dollari di capitale, tra cui 65 milioni nel round di serie B del 2022, segna con questa operazione una pietra miliare per il settore biotech serbo, affermando la rilevanza internazionale delle sue innovazioni, secondo quanto riportato da bne IntelliNews e confermato da fonti di ekapija.com. L’operazione evidenzia opportunità per aziende italiane attive nel settore delle biotecnologie e della ricerca farmaceutica, in un contesto di crescente internazionalizzazione del comparto serbo.

title_en: New acquisition in Serbian pharma – Italians buy two Belgrade-based distributors for EUR 7 million in total
title_it: Acquisizioni nel settore farmaceutico serbo
content_en: (Photo: Pavel Kubarkov/shutterstock.com) Italian medical equipment manufacturer Svas Biosana said it has completed the acquisitions of Serbian medical device distributors Hermes Pharma and Megapharm . Svas Biosana acquired Hermes Pharma through its wholly-owned subsidiary Mark Medical for a consideration of 3.5 million euro (USD 3.8 million) plus a variable earn-out of about 250,000 euro, the company said in a press release earlier this month, reports SeeNews. The Italian firm bought Megapharm through its unit Levante HC Holding for a consideration of 3 million euro plus a variable earn-out of approximately 250,000 euro. Belgrade-based Hermes Pharma was founded in 2017. Prior to being acquired by Svas Biosana, it was fully-owned by local entrepreneur Predrag Andric, according to data from Serbia’s business registers agency. In 2024, it posted an operating revenue of 665 million dinars and a net profit of 92 million dinars, its annual financial statement showed. Founded in 2021 in Belgrade, Megapharm was wholly-owned by local entrepreneur Djordje Baic, according to data from the business registers agency. In 2024, it reported an operating revenue of 344 million dinars and a net profit of 51 million dinars, according to its annual financial report. Svas Biosana, established in 1972, has 350 employees and three production facilities in Italy. It is directly present in five countries and has 16,000 products, it says on its website. In 2021, Svas Biosana was listed on Euronext Growth Milan, a Borsa Italiana-manged market dedicated to small and medium-sized enterprises which are looking for capital to fund growth. Let us remind that, recently, another, much bigger acquisition related to the Serbian pharma sector, drew attention globally. Pharma-major Sanofi has acquired Serbian-founded biopharmaceutical company Dren Bio for up to USD 1.9 billion. Dren Bio is headquartered in San Francisco and it was founded by Serbian scientists. The agreement sees Sanofi acquire Dren Bio’s autoimmune disease treatment, DR-0201, a targeted bispecific myeloid cell activator. The drug, which has shown strong B-cell depletion in early clinical studies, is being investigated for a variety of autoimmune diseases and malignancies. B. P. content_it: Il produttore italiano di dispositivi medici Svas Biosana ha completato l’acquisizione di due distributori serbi: Hermes Pharma e Megapharm, entrambi con sede a Belgrado. Hermes Pharma è stata acquisita tramite la controllata Mark Medical per 3,5 milioni di euro, più un earn-out variabile di circa 250.000 euro. Megapharm è stata rilevata tramite Levante HC Holding per 3 milioni di euro, a cui si aggiunge un ulteriore earn-out dello stesso importo. Hermes Pharma, fondata nel 2017 e precedentemente interamente posseduta dall’imprenditore serbo Predrag Andrić, ha registrato nel 2024 un fatturato operativo di 665 milioni di dinari e un utile netto di 92 milioni. Megapharm, fondata nel 2021 e fino all’acquisizione interamente detenuta da Đorđe Baić, ha chiuso lo scorso anno con ricavi per 344 milioni di dinari e un utile netto di 51 milioni. Svas Biosana, fondata nel 1972, conta 350 dipendenti, tre stabilimenti in Italia ed è presente direttamente in cinque Paesi con un portfolio di 16.000 prodotti. Nel 2021 è stata quotata su Euronext Growth Milan. Si ricorda inoltre che recentemente Sanofi ha acquisito Dren Bio, azienda biofarmaceutica fondata da scienziati serbi con sede a San Francisco, per un controvalore fino a 1,9 miliardi di dollari. Queste operazioni evidenziano l’interesse internazionale per il comparto farmaceutico e biotecnologico con radici serbe. Per le aziende italiane del settore, la Serbia rappresenta un mercato con potenziale sia come hub distributivo che come fonte di innovazione nel campo biomedicale.

title_en: This is what the new GOC Narodni Front in Bezanijska Kosa will look like – Modern “house” with “closed street” and yard (PHOTO)

To clarify, on the website of the City of Belgrade, the urban project has been published, which is available for public review until April 9, where it is said that the new maternity ward will be located in Zemun, right next to the Clinical and Hospital Center Bezanijska Kosa. La nuova sede della Clinica di Ginecologia e Ostetricia (GOC) Narodni Front sarà costruita a Zemun, adiacente al Centro Clinico e Ospedaliero Bezanijska Kosa. L’attuale struttura, situata al numero 62 di via Kraljice Natalije a Belgrado, sarà sostituita da un edificio moderno di cinque piani fuori terra e due interrati, con una superficie lorda complessiva di 37.021,04 m². Il progetto urbanistico, pubblicato sul sito del Comune di Belgrado e in consultazione pubblica fino al 9 aprile, prevede un parcheggio sotterraneo con 181 posti auto.  

Il Governo serbo ha adottato a gennaio 2024 una nuova decisione di esproprio per l’area interessata, dopo quella di agosto 2023. Il progetto preliminare è stato elaborato sulla base delle indicazioni di un consulente/tecnologo esterno, in collaborazione con l’utente finale, considerando i dati previsionali su parti, interventi chirurgici e visite ambulatoriali.  

L’investitore è il Ministero degli Investimenti Pubblici della Serbia, mentre il progettista è la società Mašinoprojekt Kopring di Belgrado. La struttura, sviluppata su un’area di circa 55.000 m², riunirà tutti i reparti e i servizi tecnologici lungo un corridoio longitudinale al piano terra per ottimizzare la funzionalità.  

Le imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture sanitarie, sistemi tecnologici ospedalieri e costruzioni complesse potrebbero trovare opportunità di collaborazione in questo importante progetto pubblico serbo, come riportato dalla fonte ekapija.com.

title_en: MediGroup sold to Finnish Mehiläinen Group - Largest transaction in private healthcare market in Central and Eastern Europe
title_it: Acquisizione record nel settore sanitario privato
content_en: (Photo: Aleksandar Parezanović) MediGroup , the largest private health system in Serbia, together with the Regina Maria network from Romania, announced the largest transaction on the market of the private healthcare sector in Central and Eastern Europe. Namely, as it was announced, that these two systems join the Mehiläinen group, the largest private healthcare system in Finland, with more than 115 years of medical experience and a growing international presence. Mehiläinen Group acquires 100% ownership in the MediGroup and Regina Maria systems, which means the exit of the investors MidEuropa and Blue Sea Capital from the ownership structure . The transaction is said to be subject to customary regulatory approvals and it is expected to be finalized by the end of the year. - We are entering a new era, because MediGroup and Regina Maria become part of the Mehiläinen group. Since 2018, the majority owner of MidEuropa has been supporting the growth of the MediGroup system on the way to consolidating the leadership position of the largest private healthcare system in Serbia. Now, with the Mehiläinen Group's expertise and international presence, we are ready to further improve our services, introduce innovations and set new standards in health care. We are facing an important milestone that further strengthens our commitment to providing top-quality medical care across Serbia - Marijana Vasilescu, general manager of the MediGroup system, stated. The Mehiläinen Group is a healthcare system established in Finland which has been developing for 115 years and is present in five European countries. There are currently more than 890 medical institutions operating within the group employing more than 37,000 healthcare professionals. On an annual level, the group provides services to more than 2.2 million users, and in 2024, it achieved an income of EUR two billion, which represents an increase of 11.5% in relation to the previous year. - Regina Maria is one of the fastest growing and highest quality healthcare networks in Europe, led by top experts. We have been following its development for years and we are very pleased to now have the opportunity to take over the company. Its sister company MediGroup is also the leading player in its market with exceptional service quality. I am looking forward to this partnership - said Janne-Olli Järvenpää, CEO of the Mehiläinen Group. With more than 11,000 employees and associates, as well as by being present in all parts of Romania, Regina Maria stands out as a leader in the quality of medical services, continuously reaffirming commitment to medical excellence and patient safety. - We are honored that the largest healthcare system in Finland, with more than a century of experience, recognized the potential of the Romanian and Serbian medical markets. This investment reflects Mehiläinen Group's confidence in the region's economic development and represents an important signal of stability in the current financial context. At the same time, it marks an extremely important chapter in our network's history, and we are excited to enter a new phase together, in which we will continue to transform Europe's private healthcare sector, relying on strong management teams and a shared vision. We are confident that, with the support of the Mehiläinen Group, we will continue strengthening our services in Romania and Serbia. Together we are moving towards a future in which healthcare is increasingly advanced, digitized and accessible, where patient safety and medical service quality remain our top priorities - Fady Chreih, chairman of the Supervisory Board of the MediGroup system and general manager of the Regina Maria network, stated. MidEuropa, a private investment fund with a significant presence in Central and Southeastern Europe, became the majority owner of the MediGroup system in 2018, after acquiring 100% ownership of the Regina Maria system in 2015. With experience in the development of health systems, MidEuropa, as it turns out, played a key role in the expansion and strengthening of the leadership position of MediGroup and the Regina Maria system in private healthcare in the region. - We would like to thank the entire team for their dedication and enthusiasm, and to wish them much success in their further cooperation with the Mehiläinen Group, their experienced management and reputable investors - said Matthew Strassberg, partner in the MidEuropa fund and founder of the company's health services sector. This acquisition represents, as pointed out, a key step in consolidating the private health sector in Central and Eastern Europe. MediGroup occupies 17% of the market share in the private health sector in Serbia , while the Regina Maria network in Romania counts almost one million users of the health package and 13,000 corporate clients. Accordingly, it is expected that the combined expertise and resources of these health systems will further strengthen their positions on the market. content_it:
MediGroup, il più grande sistema sanitario privato in Serbia, insieme alla rete rumena Regina Maria, è stata acquisita dal gruppo finlandese Mehiläinen, leader nel settore sanitario privato in Finlandia con oltre 115 anni di esperienza. Si tratta della più grande operazione mai realizzata nel mercato della sanità privata nell’Europa centrale e orientale. Mehiläinen acquisisce il 100% delle due reti, segnando l’uscita dagli azionari dei fondi MidEuropa e Blue Sea Capital. L’operazione, soggetta alle autorizzazioni regolamentari, dovrebbe concludersi entro la fine dell’anno.

Marijana Vasilescu, amministratrice delegata di MediGroup, ha sottolineato che l’ingresso nel gruppo Mehiläinen rappresenta una nuova fase per migliorare servizi, introdurre innovazioni e innalzare gli standard sanitari in Serbia. Mehiläinen, presente in cinque Paesi europei, gestisce oltre 890 strutture con 37.000 professionisti sanitari, servendo 2,2 milioni di pazienti all’anno e generando nel 2024 un fatturato di 2 miliardi di euro (+11,5% rispetto al 2023).

Janne-Olli Järvenpää, CEO di Mehiläinen, ha espresso soddisfazione per l’acquisizione di due reti di eccellenza come Regina Maria e MediGroup. Fady Chreih, presidente del consiglio di sorveglianza di MediGroup e amministratore delegato di Regina Maria, ha definito l’operazione un segnale di fiducia nella stabilità economica della regione. MidEuropa, che aveva acquisito Regina Maria nel 2015 e MediGroup nel 2018, ha giocato un ruolo chiave nel loro sviluppo.

MediGroup detiene il 17% del mercato serbo della sanità privata, mentre Regina Maria conta quasi un milione di utenti e 13.000 clienti aziendali in Romania. L’unione delle competenze e risorse rafforzerà ulteriormente la posizione delle due reti nel settore. La transazione evidenzia un crescente interesse internazionale per i mercati sanitari dell’Europa sudorientale, aprendo nuove opportunità per collaborazioni con operatori italiani specializzati in tecnologie mediche, gestione sanitaria e servizi digitali integrati.

title_en: Reconstruction of Children’s Dispensary in Leskovac announced – Investment worth EUR 5.7 million
title_it: Ristrutturazione del dispensario pediatrico di Leskovac
content_en: (Photo: Google Street View) The Service for Health Protection of Children and School Children of the Health Center Leskovac will get a whole new look in the next two years, with an investment worth close to RSD 670 million, that is, around EUR 5.7 million, without the VAT. The funds are secured through cooperation between the City of Leskovac and the Ministry of Public Investment, which is financing the majority of the project – RSD 496 million, whereas the local self-government is setting aside RSD 172.1 million. As the mayor of Leskovac, Goran Cvetanovic, announced while visiting the facility, the reconstruction entails the extension and expansion of the existing facility of the Children’s Dispensary, which will have three floors following the execution of the works . The new floor of 1,665 m2 will be meant for the preventive section , and the facility will be equipped with new furniture and modern medical equipment. On a parcel of 3,770 m2, 27 parking spaces will be secured as well – 12 for the employees, 13 for the users and 2 for persons with disabilities. The energy efficiency of the facility will be improved as well, including a full replacement of the joinery. During the works, the service will be temporarily moved to the outpatient clinic no. 3, also known as the former covid outpatient clinic. content_it: Nei prossimi due anni, il Servizio per la protezione della salute dei bambini e degli studenti del Centro sanitario di Leskovac sarà oggetto di una ristrutturazione completa, con un investimento di circa 670 milioni di dinari serbi (circa 5,7 milioni di euro, IVA esclusa). I fondi provengono da un accordo tra la Città di Leskovac e il Ministero degli Investimenti Pubblici della Repubblica di Serbia, che finanzia la maggior parte del progetto con 496 milioni di dinari, mentre l’amministrazione locale destina ulteriori 172,1 milioni di dinari. Secondo quanto annunciato dal sindaco di Leskovac, Goran Cvetanović, durante una visita alla struttura, l’intervento prevede l’ampliamento dell’attuale edificio del dispensario pediatrico, che passerà a tre piani. Il nuovo piano, di 1.665 m², sarà dedicato alle attività preventive e sarà dotato di nuovi arredi e di attrezzature mediche moderne. Sul terreno di 3.770 m² saranno inoltre realizzati 27 posti auto: 12 per il personale, 13 per gli utenti e 2 per le persone con disabilità. Sarà migliorata anche l’efficienza energetica dell’edificio, con la sostituzione completa degli infissi. Durante i lavori, il servizio sarà temporaneamente trasferito presso l’ambulatorio n. 3, ex ambulatorio anti-Covid. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’occasione potrebbe rappresentare opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in edilizia sanitaria, arredi medicali e tecnologie per l’efficienza energetica.

title_en: Serbian startup Vinaver Medical receives investment for revolutionary oncology software
title_it: Startup serba in oncologia riceve investimento
content_en: Illustration (Photo: everything possible/shutterstock.com) The Digital Serbia Initiative’s business angel network has invested in Vinaver Medical , a domestic startup that develops software solutions for improving medical diagnostics and treatment planning in oncology using artificial intelligence and spectral CT technology. As announced by the Digital Serbia Initiative, the founding team of Vinaver Medical combines knowledge from physics, engineering and artificial intelligence to exploit the full potential of clinical CT diagnostics. Their proprietary software, which can be integrated into existing systems regardless of the manufacturer, has proven to be a powerful tool for tissue characterization in the field of cardiac and abdominal diagnostics, with the greatest impact in the field of particle radiotherapy. When planning the most modern forms of radiotherapy, it is extremely important to precisely know the density and composition of the tissue through which radiation passes before reaching the tumor. Vinaver Medical’s software extracts precisely this information from the CT scan with a high level of accuracy, thus enabling better planning and safer delivery of therapy. – The investment we received from DSI business angels is a confirmation that there is room for the development of high-tech solutions from Serbia with application in global medicine. We will direct the funds to support patent protection, implementation of ISO standards and the process of obtaining the FDA 510(k) certificate. In addition to financial support, we greatly appreciate the mentoring and strategic support we are receiving from the angels, and we believe that with their experience and contacts we will accelerate the entry of our product into new markets – said Stevan Vrbaski, founder and director of Vinaver Medical. The Vinaver Medical solution improves the work of all the actors in the healthcare system - from clinicians, through hospital administration to insurers - and brings the greatest benefit to cancer patients. By enabling more precise and personalized therapy planning, the software contributes to the essential goal of modern radiotherapy: curing cancer with minimal or no side effects. Their product is already being tested in cooperation with clinics in the region as well as in the US and EU markets, and they are also actively present in the domestic healthcare system, thus directly contributing to the quality of treatment of patients in Serbia. The Digital Serbia Initiative Business Angel Network brings together more than 50 successful entrepreneurs and leaders from various fields. Since its establishment, the network has invested EUR 1.3 million in 13 domestic startups, providing them with smart capital - financial, mentoring and strategic support in the early stages of development. – Vinaver Medical is a great example of a startup that combines scientific knowledge, market potential and a strong team. Their approach solves specific problems in modern medicine and we believe that they have the potential for global success – said Zorana Brankovic, Member of the Executive Board and Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Banca Intesa and a member of the Business Angel Network. content_it: La rete di business angel dell’iniziativa Digital Serbia ha investito in Vinaver Medical, startup serba che sviluppa software per migliorare la diagnosi e la pianificazione terapeutica in oncologia, sfruttando l’intelligenza artificiale e la tecnologia CT spettrale. Il team fondatore unisce competenze in fisica, ingegneria e intelligenza artificiale per sfruttare appieno il potenziale della diagnostica TC clinica. Il software proprietario, integrabile in qualsiasi sistema indipendentemente dal produttore, si è dimostrato efficace nella caratterizzazione dei tessuti, soprattutto in ambito cardiaco e addominale, con un impatto significativo nella radioterapia con particelle. La soluzione estrae con elevata precisione, dalle scansioni TC, informazioni cruciali sulla densità e composizione dei tessuti attraversati dalla radiazione, consentendo una pianificazione più accurata e una somministrazione più sicura della terapia. “L’investimento ricevuto conferma che esiste spazio per soluzioni high-tech sviluppate in Serbia con applicazione nella medicina globale. I fondi saranno destinati alla protezione brevettuale, all’implementazione degli standard ISO e all’ottenimento della certificazione FDA 510(k)”, ha dichiarato Stevan Vrbaški, fondatore e direttore di Vinaver Medical, sottolineando anche il valore del supporto strategico e di mentoring fornito dagli investitori. Il software migliora l’efficienza di tutti gli attori del sistema sanitario e offre il massimo beneficio ai pazienti oncologici, permettendo terapie più precise e personalizzate, con l’obiettivo di curare il cancro minimizzando gli effetti collaterali. La soluzione è già in fase di testing con cliniche nella regione, negli Stati Uniti e nell’Unione Europea, ed è attivamente utilizzata nel sistema sanitario serbo. La rete di business angel di Digital Serbia, composta da oltre 50 imprenditori e leader, ha investito finora 1,3 milioni di euro in 13 startup nazionali. “Vinaver Medical è un esempio eccellente di startup che coniuga conoscenza scientifica, potenziale di mercato e un team solido, con concrete prospettive di successo globale”, ha affermato Zorana Branković, COO di Banca Intesa e membro della rete. La presenza di una tecnologia medica avanzata sviluppata in Serbia, già in fase di validazione internazionale, rappresenta una potenziale opportunità per aziende italiane attive nel settore della salute e della diagnostica avanzata.

title_en: NeoMedica Nis expanding operations in North Africa, launching production of diagnostic tests in Algeria
title_it: NeoMedica espande produzione in Nord Africa
content_en: Illustration (Photo: JPC-PROD/shutterstock.com) NeoMedica , an innovative Serbian company from the field of diagnostic tests, has signed the Memorandum of Understanding with a strategic partner in Algeria, thereby making official the beginning of joint investments in the local production of Naissa tests, announced the Chamber of Commerce of Serbia (CCIS). NeoMedica develops and produces tests meant for early detection and monitoring of various diseases, including autoimmune and infectious diseases, hormonal disorders, tumor markers, viruses and other specific proteins. The tests are used on modern Naissa and Uni analyzers, produced in the Nis factory. By signing this memorandum, NeoMedica has secured the placement of its products in the state health system of Algeria, which encompasses a population of 45 million citizens. Local production and technology transfer will enable a 25% advantage in all tenders, as well as a reduced need for the import of similar products, in line with the capacity of local production. – This partnership is an important step forward in the international strategy of the expansion of NeoMedica. We are proud of our work and the products are finding their place in state systems outside the borders of Serbia, thereby confirming their quality and scientific value – stated Sasa Trickovic, the director of NeoMedica. For two years, now, the company’s products have been successfully present in the health system of Algeria. Their application is confirmed through several clinical studies, especially in the field of autoimmune diseases, and the results have been published in prestigious international science magazines. Further research in the fields of tumor markers and gastrointestinal and hormonal statuses, which include another five tests from the company’s portfolio, are in progress. The official signing of the agreement on production is planned for September this year, during the science gathering which will be organized by NeoMedica in cooperation with its Algerian partners. At the end of February, NeoMedica commenced the production of hematology reagents in its factory in Cairo, Egypt , and the launching of the production of immunochemical tests in Algeria aims to cover the markets of North Africa and the Middle East with high-tech products. content_it: NeoMedica, azienda serba innovativa nel settore dei test diagnostici, ha firmato un Memorandum of Understanding con un partner strategico in Algeria, avviando investimenti congiunti per la produzione locale dei test Naissa, come annunciato dalla Camera di Commercio della Serbia (CCIS). L’azienda sviluppa e produce test per la diagnosi precoce e il monitoraggio di malattie autoimmuni, infettive, disordini ormonali, marker tumorali e proteine specifiche, da utilizzare sugli analizzatori Naissa e Uni, prodotti nello stabilimento di Niš. Grazie all’accordo, i prodotti NeoMedica entreranno nel sistema sanitario pubblico algerino, che serve 45 milioni di cittadini. La produzione locale e il trasferimento tecnologico garantiranno un vantaggio del 25% nelle gare d’appalto e ridurranno la necessità di importare prodotti simili. “Questa partnership rappresenta un passo fondamentale nella strategia internazionale di NeoMedica. Siamo orgogliosi che i nostri prodotti siano riconosciuti anche al di fuori della Serbia, a conferma del loro valore scientifico e qualitativo”, ha dichiarato Saša Tričković, direttore dell’azienda. I test sono già presenti con successo nel sistema sanitario algerino da due anni, con studi clinici pubblicati su riviste scientifiche internazionali, soprattutto nel campo delle malattie autoimmuni. Sono in corso ulteriori ricerche su marker tumorali e profili gastrointestinali e ormonali, che includono altri cinque test del portfolio aziendale. La firma ufficiale dell’accordo di produzione è prevista per settembre, in occasione di un convegno scientifico organizzato da NeoMedica con i partner algerini. A febbraio, l’azienda ha già avviato la produzione di reagenti per ematologia nel proprio stabilimento al Cairo, in Egitto. L’avvio della produzione in Algeria mira a coprire i mercati del Nord Africa e del Medio Oriente con prodotti ad alta tecnologia. Come riportato dalla fonte media ekapija.com, l’espansione di NeoMedica apre opportunità per collaborazioni industriali e tecnologiche con aziende italiane specializzate in dispositivi diagnostici e reagenti per analisi mediche.

title_en: Serbia part of European project “Genome of Europe” – Foundation for development of personalized medicine
title_it: Serbia nel progetto "Genoma d'Europa"
content_en: Illustration (Photo: wavebreakmedia/shutterstock.com) The Office for IT and eGovernment is part of the international consortium which is implementing the “Genome of Europe” project, one of the three projects of the Digital Europe program that are currently being carried out in Serbia. The project entails participation from 29 European countries, among which is Serbia as only one of the three countries outside the European Union. In addition to the Office for IT and eGovernment and the Center for the Fourth Industrial Revolution, the Serbian team of experts that are implementing this project also features the Institute for Molecular Genetics and Genetic Engineering. – The aim of the “Genome of Europe” project is to sequence 100,000 genomes of citizens of Europe, of which 2,500 will belong to people of Serbian origin . The primary task is to identify the genetic specificities of various peoples, with a special focus on the possibilities of personalized medical treatment based on the obtained data. We want to determine which medicines are the most effective for the Serbian population and which diagnostic and therapy methods provide the best results. The knowledge and experience that we acquire during the realization of this important European project will be used for the forming of a national genome register of the Republic of Serbia – said the director of the Center for the Fourth Industrial Revolution, Jelena Bojovic, as announced by the Office. The project is also part of the wider European initiative “1+ Million Genomes”, which aims to develop digital infrastructure for a safe storage of genetic data and their linking with health information. The director of the Office for IT and eGovernment, Mihailo Jovanovic, pointed out that taking part in such a project was of great significance for the Serbian economy, the citizens of Serbia and Serbia’s innovation ecosystem, as it provided a unique opportunity to acquire the knowledge and experience necessary for the establishment of a national register of genetic and biomedical data. – The register will be the foundation for the development of personalized medicine in Serbia, and the Office for IT and eGovernment is working intensively on establishing a platform which will enable a safe keeping and responsible use of genetic and biomedical data for scientific and health purposes. The platform will be located in the State Data Center in Kragujevac – said Jovanovic. He noted that the project would also be discussed at the upcoming fourth conference “The Future of Biotechnology”, to be held on October 27, 2025, in Belgrade. As already pointed out, the “Genome of Europe” project is realized within the Digital Europe program, in which the Republic of Serbia participates based on the agreement signed with the European Union in June 2023, which is valid until 2027. This agreement enables legal and natural persons with residency or headquarters in Serbia to apply for the financing of projects in the fields of artificial intelligence, supercomputers and the development of digital skills and capacities within the EU program under the same conditions as the subjects from the EU member states, including access to grants from European funds. content_it: L’Ufficio per le tecnologie informatiche e l’e-government della Serbia partecipa al progetto europeo “Genoma d’Europa”, nell’ambito del programma Europa Digitale. Il progetto, cui aderiscono 29 Paesi europei, vede la Serbia come uno dei soli tre Stati non UE coinvolti. Il team serbo include anche il Centro per la Quarta Rivoluzione Industriale e l’Istituto di Genetica Molecolare e Ingegneria Genetica. L’obiettivo è sequenziare 100.000 genomi europei, di cui 2.500 appartenenti a cittadini di origine serba, per identificare specificità genetiche e sviluppare terapie personalizzate. I dati raccolti serviranno a creare un Registro nazionale del genoma in Serbia, fondamentale per la medicina personalizzata. L’Ufficio sta sviluppando una piattaforma sicura per la gestione responsabile dei dati genetici e biomedici, che sarà ospitata nel Centro Statale Dati di Kragujevac. Il progetto rientra nell’iniziativa europea “1+ Milione di Genomi” e sarà discusso alla conferenza “Il futuro della biotecnologia”, in programma a Belgrado il 27 ottobre 2025. La partecipazione serba al programma Europa Digitale, possibile grazie all’accordo con l’UE firmato nel giugno 2023 e valido fino al 2027, consente a enti e cittadini serbi di accedere a finanziamenti UE per progetti in ambito IA, supercalcolo e competenze digitali, alle stesse condizioni degli Stati membri, secondo quanto riportato dalla fonte media ekapija.com. Per le aziende italiane attive nel settore delle biotecnologie, della bioinformatica e delle infrastrutture digitali per la sanità, questa iniziativa rappresenta un’opportunità di collaborazione con istituzioni serbe impegnate nello sviluppo di un ecosistema nazionale per la medicina personalizzata.

title_en: NIS requests USA to issue new special license to continue operating
title_it: NIS chiede nuove deroghe alle sanzioni USA
content_en: (Photo: Print screen / Google maps) Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) has announced that, on September 28, it filed a new application with the US Treasury Department for a special license that would defer the full application of sanctions and allow the company to continue operating. NIS also filed an additional application to be removed from the SDN (Specially Designated Nationals) list. This is a lengthy and complex process, and the initial application was sent on March 14 of this year, the statement says. In January this year, the USA introduced sanctions on NIS due to the Russian share in the ownership. So far, the sanctions have been postponed six times, last time on October 1, but Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has announced that the deadline has been additionally extended by October 8 or 9. content_it: Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) ha annunciato di aver presentato il 28 settembre una nuova richiesta al Dipartimento del Tesoro degli Stati Uniti per ottenere una licenza speciale che consenta il differimento dell’applicazione integrale delle sanzioni, permettendo così alla società di continuare le proprie attività. NIS ha inoltre inviato una domanda aggiuntiva per essere rimossa dalla lista SDN (Specially Designated Nationals). Si tratta di un procedimento lungo e complesso; la prima istanza era stata presentata il 14 marzo di quest’anno, si legge nel comunicato. A gennaio, gli USA avevano imposto sanzioni a NIS a causa della partecipazione azionaria russa. Finora, l’applicazione delle sanzioni è stata posticipata sei volte, l’ultima delle quali al 1° ottobre. Il presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić ha tuttavia annunciato un’ulteriore proroga, fissata all’8 o al 9 ottobre. Come riportato dalla fonte mediatica ekapija.com, questa situazione evidenzia l’importanza strategica del settore energetico serbo e potrebbe offrire opportunità alle aziende italiane attive nel comparto energetico, in particolare per partnership tecnologiche o di gestione nel rafforzamento della resilienza energetica dei Balcani occidentali.

title_en: Radosavljevic: Hostile takeover of NIS would be disastrous, would affect gas supply
title_it: Rischio sanzioni su NIS: allarme per economia e gas
content_en: (Photo: Shutterstock/Nenad Nedomacki) The sanctions on NIS have been postponed for another eight days, and FEFA professor Goran Radosavljevic assesses that this indicates that the sanctions will come into force, which, according to him, could completely disrupt the Serbian economy. He points out that the so-called hostile takeover of NIS by the state would be disastrous because it could jeopardize the gas arrangement with Russia. Commenting on the latest postponement of the entry into force of US sanctions on NIS, professor Radosavljevic said on the “Novi dan” show on N1 that the implementation of sanctions could completely disrupt the Serbian economy, but that it did not seem to him that Serbia was preparing for sanctions to come into force. As he explained, the eight-day postponement can only change something if a solution has already been agreed upon, and it takes a day, or two to three days, for it to be implemented. Professor Radosavljevic says that one of the solutions would be for the Russian side to exit the ownership of NIS, but adds that he does not see that solution as possible. – That solution would be for the Serbian side to take over the management of NIS, or some segments of management, refinery, distribution. If there is an agreement, those eight days are enough to implement it. If there is, it can be extended for six months, but the sanctions will not be lifted because the procedure is complicated – he said. He notes that there is no new argument for postponing the sanctions except that a solution has been found and adds that the American side probably said that it would not give another month of delay, but asked for the solution to be implemented immediately. Asked what the possible scenarios are when it comes to NIS, Professor Radosavljevic points out that, from the start, the solution could have been what was used before in Europe, especially in Germany. – And that is to come to an agreement with the Russian side - let us manage it until other global problems are resolved. The company will continue to operate under state ownership and it will be a friendly takeover by the state – said the guest of “Novi dan” and added that Russia’s return to NIS would be negotiated later in the peace negotiations, once peace was agreed in Ukraine. Other options, he says, are a hostile takeover or letting the company go bankrupt, which in his opinion would be catastrophic. – In order for an agreement to be reached, both sides must want an agreement. NIS is not overly important economically to the Russian side, but politically it is, and they are probably afraid of losing political influence by someone taking over NIS – said Radosavljevic. He notes that he is convinced that some kind of negotiations took place, knowing what the negative consequences could be, and that a solution will be found. NIS a.d. content_it:
Le sanzioni statunitensi su Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) sono state nuovamente prorogate di otto giorni. Secondo il professor Goran Radosavljević della FEFA di Belgrado, tale rinvio segnala che le sanzioni saranno effettivamente applicate, con gravi ripercussioni sull’economia serba. In un’intervista al programma “Novi dan” su N1, Radosavljević ha definito “disastrosa” un’eventuale acquisizione ostile di NIS da parte dello Stato serbo, poiché potrebbe compromettere l’accordo con la Russia per la fornitura di gas.

Il professore ritiene che l’unica soluzione praticabile sarebbe il ritiro della parte russa dalla proprietà di NIS, benché tale scenario appaia improbabile. Un’alternativa sarebbe il passaggio temporaneo della gestione dell’azienda – o di alcune sue componenti, come raffineria e distribuzione – alla Serbia, con il consenso russo, evitando una presa di controllo unilaterale. In tal caso, la proroga di otto giorni sarebbe sufficiente per attuare l’accordo, che potrebbe portare a una sospensione delle sanzioni per sei mesi, sebbene non alla loro revoca definitiva.

Radosavljević osserva che l’approccio seguito in Germania e in altri Paesi europei – gestire temporaneamente le attività russe senza interrompere il funzionamento delle aziende – sarebbe stato preferibile. Al contrario, un’acquisizione ostile o il fallimento di NIS avrebbero conseguenze catastrofiche. Sebbene NIS non abbia un grande peso economico per la Russia, il suo valore politico è significativo, e Mosca teme di perdere influenza. Il professore esprime comunque fiducia che, data la gravità delle possibili conseguenze, si troverà un’intesa tra le parti.  

Come riferito dalla fonte mediatica ekapija.com, per le imprese italiane operanti nel settore energetico e delle infrastrutture potrebbero aprirsi opportunità di collaborazione in caso di ristrutturazione o riallineamento della gestione di NIS.

title_en: USA postpones sanctions on NIS for another eight days, until October 8-9
title_it: Sospesi ancora gli embarghi USA su NIS
content_en: (Photo: Print screen / Google maps) The USA has postponed the imposition of sanctions on Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS) for another eight days, until October 8-9, Radio-Television of Serbia (RTS) has learned. According to the latest postponement, sanctions on NIS were supposed to come into effect on Wednesday, October 1 , however, as RTS has learned, after negotiations led by Aleksandar Vucic, the US side decided to postpone that deadline for another eight days. The President of Serbia previously told RTS that talks with American partners had been held again with another request to postpone sanctions on NIS. While, during the previous day, there was waiting to see whether the Americans would postpone the implementation of sanctions or not, NIS CEO Kirill Tyurdenev made a statement. He sent a letter to employees in which he emphasized what would happen if banks stopped cooperating with NIS due to the introduction of sanctions. This eight-day postponement will be the seventh time that the US side has postponed the implementation of sanctions against NIS. NIS a.d. content_it: Gli Stati Uniti hanno nuovamente rinviato di otto giorni l’entrata in vigore delle sanzioni nei confronti di Naftna industrija Srbije (NIS), fissandone la data al 8-9 ottobre, secondo quanto riportato dalla Radio-Televisione della Serbia (RTS). Inizialmente previste per il 1° ottobre, le sanzioni sono state posticipate a seguito di negoziati guidati dal presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić, che aveva richiesto un ulteriore rinvio. Si tratta del settimo rinvio da parte statunitense. Intanto, il CEO di NIS, Kirill Tyurdenev, ha inviato una lettera ai dipendenti in cui illustrava le possibili conseguenze qualora le banche interrompessero la collaborazione con l’azienda a causa delle sanzioni. Come riportato dalla fonte mediatica ekapija.com, la situazione rimane oggetto di stretta attenzione da parte delle istituzioni serbe. title_en: Challenges to competitiveness of EU chemical industry opportunity for Serbia
title_it: Opportunità per l'industria chimica serba
content_en: (Photo: branislavpudar/shutterstock) The chemical industry in the European Union has been declining for the second year in a row and is in economic recession. The main reasons are the high price of energy, uncertainty that discourages new investments, as well as the decline in demand, which leads to a decrease in the competitiveness of European companies in the global market. These are some of the key messages and results of the analyses that were discussed at the General Assembly of the European Chemical Industry Council (Cefic) and the Chemicals Convention in Berlin, which was attended by representatives of the Association for the Chemical, Rubber and Non-Metal Industries of the Chamber of Commerce of Serbia (CCIS). At this meeting, it was pointed out that additional pressure was being created by tariffs from the United States of America, which increased business risks and made the import of raw materials to the European market more expensive. On the other hand, Serbia is gaining importance as an attractive destination for investors. Lower energy prices compared to EU member states make the domestic economy more competitive, and the Serbian market more attractive to foreign investors in the chemical industry. content_it: L'industria chimica dell'Unione Europea versa in recessione economica per il secondo anno consecutivo. Le cause principali sono i prezzi elevati dell'energia, l'incertezza che frena i nuovi investimenti e il calo della domanda, fattori che riducono la competitività delle imprese europee sui mercati globali. Questi sono alcuni dei messaggi chiave emersi dall'Assemblea Generale del Consiglio Europeo dell'Industria Chimica (Cefic) e dalla Convenzione sui Prodotti Chimici a Berlino, alla quale hanno partecipato rappresentanti dell'Associazione per l'Industria Chimica, Gommiera e dei Non Metalli della Camera di Commercio di Serbia (CCIS). È stato inoltre evidenziato che ulteriore pressione deriva dai dazi imposti dagli Stati Uniti, che aumentano i rischi commerciali e rendono più costoso l'import di materie prime sul mercato europeo. Al contrario, la Serbia sta guadagnando rilevanza come destinazione attraente per gli investitori, grazie a costi energetici inferiori rispetto agli Stati membri dell'UE, che rendono l'economia domestica più competitiva. Ciò rende il mercato serbo particolarmente interessante per le aziende straniere del settore chimico. Come riportato dalla fonte mediatica ekapija.com, questa situazione rappresenta un'opportunità per le imprese italiane del settore chimico di considerare la Serbia come base strategica per investimenti e produzione.

title_en: Kalista Residence - Your safe home and an attractive investment in the heart of Kolašin
title_it: Residenza Kalista: investimento sicuro a Kolašin
content_en: (Photo: Terraforming) In the very center of Kolašin, at a prestigious location in Milivoja Bulatovića Street, Kalista Residence is being built - a modern residential and business complex that brings a new standard of living and investment. Kolašin – the mountain gem of the Balkans The fastest growing mountain center of Southeastern Europe is becoming the number one destination for investors, nature lovers and families who want a quality life. The proximity of the ski resort, which is only a 10-minute drive away, and the direct connection to the highway make this location the perfect choice - both for vacation and for a safe investment. (Photo: Terraforming) Two objects – one vision of modern housing Kalista Residence is developing through two buildings. Building B is in the final stages of construction and will be ready for occupancy soon. It consists of four business apartments and eighteen residential units of different structures, starting from studio apartments of 31 m2, through one-room units of 49 m2 and two-room units of 62 m2, to four-room units of 114 m2 and 24 garage parking spaces. The construction of this facility is progressing according to the planned dynamics and in accordance with the deadlines, and the owners will soon be able to enjoy the comfort and all the amenities provided by the Kalista Residence complex. Building A will have two business spaces on the ground floor, then two business apartments, as well as 21 residential units of different structures and areas. Future buyers will have studios, one-, two- and three-room apartments available. Works on the construction of this facility are also proceeding according to plan, ensuring high quality and comfort for which Kalista Residence will be recognized. (Photo: Terraforming) Lasting quality Every detail of the Kalista Residence complex is designed to meet the highest standards of modern construction - from the selection of top quality materials, through energy efficiency and functional space solutions, to carefully designed common areas that provide a sense of safety and privacy. Special attention has been paid to sound and thermal insulation, modern installations and aesthetic interior solutions, so that future owners can enjoy the comfort and long-term value of their home or apartment. At the company Terraforming, they combined the digital way of thinking 2BI - Business Intelligence & Business Integration with the rich experience and expertise of the company Skill Inženjering in construction. The result is a recognizable brand in investment construction - Kalista Residence, with a clear focus on quality, privacy and comfort. Their commitment is to create new values that will last for generations. (Photo: Terraforming) Why Kalista Residence? Location in the very center of Kolašin Perfect balance of privacy, quality and comfort Safe investment in the growing real estate market Family environment and healthy mountain climate Inspiring view of untouched nature all year round You can get more information about the project on the terraforming.me website, by e-mailing office@terraforming.me or by calling the contact phone number +38269186363. Nel cuore di Kolašin, in una posizione prestigiosa su via Milivoja Bulatovića, è in costruzione Kalista Residence, un moderno complesso residenziale e commerciale che introduce nuovi standard abitativi e di investimento. Kolašin, considerata la “perla montana” dei Balcani, si sta affermando come destinazione prioritaria per investitori, famiglie e amanti della natura, grazie alla vicinanza dello sci (a soli 10 minuti) e al collegamento diretto con l’autostrada.

Il progetto si sviluppa attraverso due edifici. L’edificio B è in fase avanzata di completamento e offrirà quattro appartamenti commerciali, diciotto unità residenziali (dagli monolocali di 31 m² agli alloggi quadrilocale di 114 m²) e 24 posti auto in garage. L’edificio A prevede due locali commerciali al piano terra, due appartamenti commerciali e 21 unità residenziali con soluzioni da monolocale a trilocale.

Kalista Residence è progettato secondo i più elevati standard costruttivi: materiali di pregio, efficienza energetica, isolamento termoacustico, impianti moderni e spazi comuni curati per garantire privacy e sicurezza. Il progetto nasce dalla sinergia tra Terraforming, con il suo approccio digitale 2BI (Business Intelligence & Business Integration), e l’esperienza costruttiva di Skill Inženjering.

I punti di forza includono la posizione centrale, l’ambiente familiare, il clima montano salubre, la vista su una natura incontaminata e il potenziale di un investimento sicuro in un mercato immobiliare in crescita. Per informazioni: sito terraforming.me, email office@terraforming.me o telefono +382 69 186 363.

title_en: Vladimir Popović, general manager of Carine company - In Baošići, we are building the largest hotel in the region, opening next year
title_it: Carine: nuovo resort da 800 stanze in Montenegro
content_en: Vladimir Popović, general manager of Carine company (Photo: Carine) The Carine company continues to push the boundaries of the hotel offer on the Montenegrin coast, announcing the construction of the largest hotel in the country and region in Baošići. The new resort promises more than 800 luxuriously furnished rooms, a private beach, a rich gastronomic offer, as well as facilities for families and business guests. With 80% of the rooms overlooking the Bay of Kotor, the hotel combines natural beauty with top notch facilities, setting new standards in regional tourism. At the same time, the company is also developing a project in Kumbor and Đenovići, a mixed-type complex that will combine hotel facilities and residential units, including the option of a time-share model. With a total area of ​​about 75,000 m², this project is planned in three phases and promises to enrich the tourist and lifestyle offer of this location, creating a new dimension of luxury and innovative solutions in the Montenegrin hotel industry. We talked about all of this with Vladimir Popović, the general manager of the Carine company, who presented the company`s projects, plans and investment ambitions in more detail. The Carine company is building a complex in Baošići which, according to announcements, will be the largest hotel in Montenegro and the region. Can you tell us a little more about this project? - Our new resort in Baošići will have over 800 modernly equipped rooms, 5 restaurants with a diverse gastronomic offer, an outdoor and an indoor swimming pool, a private beach with all facilities, as well as rich wellness and fitness facilities - a SPA center and a gym. The resort is located on the first line of the sea and 80% of the rooms will have a direct or partial view of the beautiful Boka Kotor bay. Special attention is paid to families and the youngest, so the complex includes an indoor park and several playgrounds. The resort is also designed as a place for business gatherings - there are congress halls, business premises and a multifunctional hall with an area of ​​1,000 m2, as well as a garage. How is construction going? At what stage are the works and when do you expect the hotel to be able to receive its first guests? - The construction is progressing faster than the planned dynamics, so we expect that the hotel will receive its first guests already in June next year. The rough works were completed in a record time of only 12 months, which is an extraordinary achievement for such a demanding project. Craftsmanship works, installation of the facade and decoration of the exterior are currently underway, while the arrangement of the interior will begin at the end of this year. In June 2026, the hotel will be fully equipped and functional with all the amenities that we plan to offer. Complex in Baošići (Photo: Carine) How many jobs will be created in the new hotel? Do you expect to have trouble finding skilled workforce? - Finding quality workforce is a challenge that is becoming more pronounced every year, but we are happy that it turned out that the employees recognized the stability and perspective of our company - the vast majority have been with us for five years or more. In the new resort, we plan to employ around 400 workers and, as before, we are confident that we will attract the best personnel from Montenegro and the region thanks to the quality working conditions and professional opportunities we offer. We are aware that it may be necessary to hire part of the workforce from more distant markets, but we believe that our brand and reputation will be a strong magnet for talented people. Apart from the hotel in Baošići, there is also an active project in Kumbor and Đenovići. What will be built within that complex? What content will it have? - Currently, our focus is on completing the project in Baošići, in order to open the hotel before the high summer season. However, a project in Đenovići and Kumbor is being developed in parallel, on an area of about 75,000 m², which is planned to be built in three phases. The first phase includes a 20,000 m² plot. It is a mixed-type business complex, which will combine hotel facilities and apartments for sale, with the possibility of a time-share model. In addition to standard hotel units, the offer will also include one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments, and the entire project will be accompanied by a wide range of commercial facilities, which will enrich the living and tourist standards of this location. Future complex in Đenovići and Kumbor (Photo: Carine) When do you expect the completion and opening of this complex? - It is planned that the first phase of the complex will be completed and opened by the end of 2027, while the remaining two phases are planned for 2029 and 2031. The project will thus be implemented in stages, so that each stage is fully functional and ready to offer the highest level of service. What is the value of the projects in Baošići and Kumbor? Will the new complexes be positioned as classic hotels, facilities with an "all-inclusive" offer, or are you heading towards a residential model? - The total value of the investment in Baošići is around EUR 80 million, and approximately the same value is planned for the first phase of the complex in Đenovići and Kumbor. The resort in Baošići will be positioned as an all-inclusive destination, but with an additionally enriched and varied offer of restaurants and bars, which will make it unique in the region. On the other hand, the complex in Đenovići and Kumbor will be of mixed use - in addition to hotel facilities, it will offer residential units, including apartments and the possibility of time-share models. What is it that will set these resorts apart from other facilities on the Montenegrin coast? Is cooperation with some of the world`s hotel brands in the pipeline? - The resort in Baošići will stand out with its extremely rich and diverse all-inclusive offer and will meet the needs of all guests. Both projects will be implemented and managed under the Carine brand, which makes us particularly proud because in the age of globalization we manage to provide the highest level of service in an authentic way. Our reputation and guest ratings on online platforms are the best indicator that this approach is correct. The Park and Delfin hotels in Bijela, and the Kumbor hotel in Kumbor are also successfully operating within the Carina. How satisfied are you with this year`s season and what business results do you expect by the end of the year? - This season, the trend of growth continued compared to previous years, which gives us satisfaction and confirmation of the correctness of business decisions. Constant investments in the quality and improvement of the service give clear results - guest satisfaction has become the best recommendation for tour operators, who ask us for additional capacities every year. We expect that we will end this year with successful business results. How would you rate the development of the hotel industry in Montenegro? Is there room for developing new hotel capacities and where do you see the greatest potential? - Tourism has been the most important economic branch of Montenegro for a long time, but unfortunately we missed the chance to fully connect it with agriculture, which was once planned. Nevertheless, there is absolutely room for the development of hotel capacities, especially those of high categories. Globally, people are traveling more and more, and Montenegro offers a rare combination of natural beauty, national parks, historical monuments and old towns. When that offer is combined with quality accommodation and service, success is inevitable. This also opens up space for other sectors - travel agencies, local manufacturers, transporters. However, the key prerequisite for everything is quality infrastructure and a good connection with emission markets. What are your company`s plans in the coming period? Is the development of a similar project outside the Herceg Novi Riviera announced? - In the coming years, we will primarily focus on developing projects in Baošići and Kumbor. Herceg Novi and the Herceg Novi Riviera have become our home and we are pleased that our projects contribute to the development of the local community and that we have the support of citizens and the Municipality. In the near future, our focus will be on hospitality, construction and logistics, and later we will carefully consider the possibility of expanding beyond this area.
